loans.name: Johanna Anabel

texts.es:
Johanna de 26 años, da sus servicios como empleada domestica a diferentes casas de Guayaquil. Vive en una casa de ladrillos con su esposo y dos hijos en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.

Comenzó a trabaja para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos ya que él es albañil y no tiene muchos ingresos por lo que tienen dos hijos de 10 y 6 años. Trabaja dando sus servicios como empleada domestica trabajando desde las 07h30am hasta las 18h00pm. Presta sus servicios para planchar, lavar, cocinar. 

Ella quiere darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y ayudarle a su esposo en la construcción de su casa por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, arena para construirla por parte. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio para dedicarles más tiempo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Johanna is 26 years old, and offers her services as a housekeeper in different houses in Guayaquil. She lives in a brick house with her husband and two children in a semi-urban area called Paraíso de la flor, a region characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

She began working to help her husband with the expenses, since he is a builder and doesn't have a lot of income, and they have two children aged 10 and 6 years old. She works offering her services as a housekeeper from 7:30am until 6pm. She offers services such as ironing, washing, and cooking.

She wants to give her children a better life and help her husband in the construction of the house. For that reason she wants this loan to buy cement, blocks, and sand to construct it in parts. In the future she wants to have a business in order to dedicate more time to her children.

loans.use: Cement, blocks, sand

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina E., 46 and married, supports her family by operating a farming business. A resident of Purok 3, Brgy. San Jose, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, Rubina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her farming business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable and now earns an average monthly income of Php 30,000. Rubina is requesting Php 23,000 in order to continue to fund her farm operations. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rubina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her farm

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. She is from Lebanon. She has run a successful coffee and nut-roasting shop for seven years. Her father is the main income provider for her family but as is common with the majority of the Lebanese families, they cooperate to pay for the high cost of living.

She obtained a first Kiva loan and she is thankful for her decision. Today, she is requesting a new loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory of nuts, coffee and a variety of food products. With the new merchandise, she will increase her sales and her income. In the coming year, she plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es: Leonora, D. 50 años, vive al lado D.  esposo y sus dos jóvenes hijos, en su casa que es propia.Después D. haberse dedicado varios años a la atención  en  su tienda D.  comestibles, tuvo que cerrar el negocio; pues ya no le era  rentable. DesD. entonces, empezó con la comercialización  D. frutas, y en la actualidad tiene un puesto en el mercado D. su zona, y le va muy bien y para dinamizar el comercio D. su negocio compra su mercadería D. los mismos productores, que venden en sus camiones, pues los ofrecen a precios muy asequibles. D. ese modo pueD. aumentar el precio D. las frutas que ofrece  en el puesto ambulante que tiene en el  contorno del mercado D. su zona. Lo que mas le gusta del negocio es que le es muy rentable, y le permite captar buenas utilidades, pero lo que no le gusta es la polvareda que debe soportar en su puesto. Leonora está pensando en el  futuro alquilar un puesto dentro  del mercado, para que su negocio alcance el desarrollo.Es el 16avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como es una socia antiguo D. su banco comunal se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que recibe D. parte D. los integrantes, y también agradece a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando sin problemas.Leonora tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D.  mayor cantidad D. frutas, que tienen bastante salida durante la temporada D. verano, D. esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Leonora is 50 years old.  She lives with her husband and two young children in her own home.

After having spent several years working in her own grocery store, Leonora had to close her business because it was no longer profitable.  She then started selling fruit and she currently has a sales stall in her local market.  Her business is going very well and, in order to energize her business, she buys her merchandise from the producers themselves, who sell from their trucks, since they offer her very affordable prices.  In this way, she can increase the price of the fruit that she sells from the mobile stall that she has on the outskirts of her local market.

What Leonora most likes about her business is that it is very profitable and allows her to make a good incomes.  However, what she doesn't like are the dust clouds that she must put up with on her stall.  Leonora is thinking, in the future, of renting a stall insiD. the market itself so that she can make progress in her business.

This is Leonora's 16th loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member of her community bank, she feels grateful for all the support that she receives from the other members.  She would also like to thank the people who maD. her loan possible as it will allow her to continue working without problems.

Leonora is planning to invest her money in buying a larger quantity of fruit which are quite popular during the summer season.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (fruit) to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase juice, yogurt, beans, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Aportar para cubrir los gastos del hogar, fue el motor que impulsó a Gloria S. R. a convertirse en vendedora de productos por catálogo, negocio que inició desde hace 15 años y que le ha permitido aportar en su hogar para ayudarle a su esposo a sostener a sus tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Gloria necesita de un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y además de las ventas por catálogo incluir oferta de productos para el hogar con el fin de captar cada vez más clientes.

En el futuro esta emprendedora espera ofrecerle un buen futuro a sus hijos y brindarles educación superior, para ello, espera seguir trabajando en su negocio, ampliarlo y poder ahorar para su futuro y el de su familia.
texts.en:
The need to pay for household expenses was what motivated Gloria S. R. to start working in catalog sales, a business she started 15 years ago. The income has allowed her to help her husband to support both their home and their three children.

Gloria now needs a loan to expand her business and also to offer household products through catalog sales in order to gain more customers.

In the future this businesswoman hopes to offer a decent life to her children and provide them with a better education. As for herself, she wishes to continue with her business, expand it, and be able to save for her own future and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy products for her business

loans.name: Mumuwa Community Bank-Mpigi Group

texts.en:
39-year-old N. Aisha operates a retail shop in Mirembe-Mpigi. The shop has been in existence for the past 8 years and mostly serves the rank and file residents in and around her area. She mostly deals in rice, soap, wheat, maize flour, etc. Aisha also does some part-time farming.

Aisha is happily married with five kids and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more general merchandise to resell. She belongs to Mumuwa community bank.

loans.use: the purchase of more general merchandise to resell

loans.name: Hoziana

texts.en: Hoziana is 31 years old, has 3 childre, who are ages 1-6 years old, and only the eldest is enrolled in school yet. Hoziana sells metal pieces which are used for the manufacture of metal doors. Hoziana works with her husband in this business. They also sell a local drink called ubushera, which is made from malted sorghum. They have had this business for 10 years, and it has enabled them to build their own house in which they live, and a second house, which they rent out. Hoziana is requesting this loan to buy additional metal, and with the profits she plans to save them and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy additional metal to resell

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Chean S. lives with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its ancient temples. She makes a living raising pigs and earns about $2 a day. Her husband is a farmer, and earns about $1 a day. Each month, the family spends $40 on food and $40 on other necessities. S. is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income she earns to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José forma parte del banco comunal “Fénix”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna. 
El se dedica a vender frutas, verduras y abarrotes en un local que tiene ubicado en el ante jardín de su casa. José trabaja desde hace 7 años en el rubro. Su mercadería la compra en la feria de Lo Valledor, ésta es una feria para comerciantes, ya que los precios son a bajo costo, por lo tanto más conveniente económicamente. Su horario laboral es de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 23ºº horas, todos los días de la semana. 
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio, específicamente; abarrotes, verduras y frutas. Además comprará una reja para proteger su local y mejorar su infraestructura. 
Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y abastecerlo, además quiere comprar un vehículo que le sirva para trasladar su mercadería, ya que por ahora paga fletes para trasladarla. 
José vive con su esposa quien además le ayuda a atender el negocio cuando el no se encuentra y también prepara ensaladas.
José está muy agradecido del crédito obtenido a través de Fondo esperanza, además se siente muy contento de la organización que tiene la institución, para ayudar a personas emprendoras como él. Respecto a las capacitaciones José ha aprendido a llevar la contabilidad de su negocio.  En cuanto a las reuniones con los demás socios, estas son muy amenas y José está muy comprometido con su grupo, puesto que además es delegado del banco comunal.
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
José is a member of the “Fénix” (Phoenix) communal bank in the city of La Cisterna.  He is a fruit, vegetable and groceries merchant.  He has a store in his front yard.  He’s been in this line of work for 7 years.  He buys his merchandise at the Lo Valledor market, a market for merchants, because prices are low so it’s more convenient economically.  He works from 8am until 11pm every day of the week.

He will use the loan to stock his store, specifically with groceries, vegetables and fruit.  In addition, he will buy a metal grille to protect his locale and improve its infrastructure.  His dream is to enlarge his business and to stock it.  He also wants to buy a vehicle that he can use to transport his merchandise because at present he pays shipping costs to transport it.

José lives with his wife who helps him tend to the store when he’s absent and she also makes salads.

José is very grateful for the loan he got from Fondo Esperanza.  He’s also very happy with the organization the institution has to help enterprising people like him.  With respect to the training, José has learned how to manage his business’ accounting.  As for the meetings with his fellow members, they are quite pleasant and José is very committed to his group; he is his bank’s Delegate.

La Cisterna is a commune located in the south central sector of the metropolitan area.  It is essentially a residential and commercial commune.  At its beginning it was rural with large tracts.  However, due to its increase in population and the arrival of basic services it became 100% urban.

loans.use: to buy groceries, fruit and vegetables and also to buy a metal grille to protect his store and improve its infrastructure.

loans.name: Simba Group

texts.en:
Modesta W. is in her early thirties and married with three children who are still at school.  She has a second clothing and shoes business which she has been selling door to door for two years. She works from 8.00am to 4pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Modesta's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to buy  more second hand clothes and shoes.  Her dream is to one day build her own house.

Modesta will share this loan with her loan group "Simba" which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture Modesta is in centre with a white blouse.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has seven family members (two of them are working). In 2010, Jawad bought a large generator to distribute power lines to the people. He has good experience because he was working for many years in this field. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Jawad is requesting $3000 to buy a new large generator. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new large generator.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 55 years old and lives in the village of Babaneuri with his family: his wife, Marine, and 26-year-old son. Vazha and his family are busy with scot breeding: they have five milk cow and 18 calves. Vazha’s son takes the scot to the mountains each year in the month of May and brings them back in fall. This relocation results in better quality dairy products and better calves. In October, the family sells cheese and calves. Their average monthly income is 850 laris. 

With the requested loan, Vazha will purchase six calves and take them to the mountains together with his already existing scot. In October, grown calves will be sold for a higher price. 

Vazha plans to use the earned profit for house renovation. After renovations, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara is trading in women’s clothing from a rented booth in one of the city’s markets. She would like to develop her business through refreshing the clothing stock.

With the loan’s help, she will be able to continue doing her business successfully. The income from this retail business is the main source of income for her and her pensioner husband.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen was born in 1973 in Kapan. He is married and has a son and a daughter. Karen’s wife stays at home and takes care of their children. For the past 12 years, Karen has been managing his own food shop. Also, he has a contract with one of the Armenian ice cream factories, and he distributes ice cream to different cities in the Syunik region. Thanks to profit from his food shop, Karen has been able to buy a truck, which he uses for his shop’s needs and to deliver ice cream to different cities. 

Karen’s profit allows him to support his family and he hopes to develop his food shop in the future. He is seeking a 1,000,000 dram loan to increase his food shop's assortment and to buy a large lot of ice cream for his business.

loans.use: to increase his food shop's assortment and to buy a large lot of ice cream for his business.

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a 24-year-old single lady who lives with her family. Her mother has been embroidering traditional dresses and knitting for over 20 years. Maysaa has inherited her mom’s talent and has always watched her since childhood to learn from her mom. Three years ago, Maysaa decided to help her mom increase business by marketing the dresses and then make and help her with the embroidery to get the order done on time. 

Now Maysaa is applying for this loan to buy more embroidery material and fabric to have more products on hand, since she is planning to market her business outside Jordan also.

loans.use: To buy more embroidery material and fabric

loans.name: Segunda Adelaida

texts.es:
Segunda Adelaida tiene 30 años, es soltera vive con los  hijos de 15 y 16 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Segunda Adelaida se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, ademas se dedica a la crianza de aves de casa. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos, ademas alimentacion para las aves el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y ayudar en la educación a la hija.

Le gusta visitar a los padres que viven en Chillanes.
texts.en:
Segunda Adelaida is 30 years old, single, and she lives with her children who are 15 and 16 years old. She lives in the enclosed community of El Progreso in the cit of Chillanes. 

The members of the communal bank El Progreso, located at 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes, is made up of 13 members who request their third loan from the cooperative. The members of this group are agriculturists who cultivate cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca.

Segunda Adelaida is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa, corn, bananas, soy and yucca. She also raises poultry. She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and she carries out her sales at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes. 

The loan will help her purchase more products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations, and she will also be able to feed her poultry. The loan will help her increase production in her cultivations. She has faced challenges such as illnesses that have struck the workers, and plague and diseases on the cultivations. Her dream is to keep working and to contribute to her daughter’s education. 

She enjoys visiting her parents who live in Chillanes.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure, and to purchase feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 22 años, natural de la comunidad de Vista Alegre Baja, Jaime convive con Elba de 19 años y fruto de esa relación esperan el nacimiento de su primer bebe. Jaime hoy mas que nunca se esmera en trabajar arduamente ya que sabe que su primer hijo esta en camino y por ello que cultiva con mucha laboriosidad sus plantas de cacao, café y frutos de piña, donde viene realizando su actividad desde sus 20 años con el apoyo de los jornaleros, menciona que desde niño aprendió a labrar la tierra gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres hoy trabaja sus propias tierras. Su producto más rentable es el fruto de la piña, porque gracias a ello logró comprar una mototaxi donde sus días no laborables aprovecha en prestar servicio de transporte. Los meses de Junio a Agosto son tiempos donde mayormente se siembra todo tipo de semillas, razón por la cual Jaime acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar sus créditos y llevar consigo uno de sus propósitos sembrar más frutas de piña. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo más espacios de terreno para así sobresalir adelante. Este será su primer crédito con MFP y por lo cual necesita el apoyo para concretar sus planes a la vez se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus aportes de pago. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar más semillas de piña ya que desea implementar sus sembrios.
texts.en:
Jaime is 22 years old and from the community of Vista Alegre Baja.  He lives with 19 year-old Elba and they are awaiting their first baby.

Jaime, now more than ever, is ensuring that he works hard since he knows that his first child is on the way.  He is therefore growing his cacao, coffee and pineapple plants with a lot of care.  He has been working in this business since he was 20 years old, with the support of laborers.  He says that he learned to work the land when he was a young boy and, thanks to his parents' instruction, he now works his own land.  His most profitable product is his pineapples because they have enabled him to buy a motorcycle taxi which he provides a transport service with on his days off.  The months of June through August are when he mainly sows his seeds.  Jaime is turning to our financial institution for loans so that he can achieve one of his goals of sowing more pineapples.

Jaime's plans include continuing to sow his crops and acquiring more land so that he can get ahead in life.  This will be his first loan with MFP and he needs the support to carry out his plans.  He pledges to make his repayments on time.  Jaime will use his loan money to buy more pineapple seeds to start his sowing.

loans.use: to buy more pineapple seeds

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.es:
El Señor Patrocinio es un Docente catedrático de la ciudad de Ybycuí, a la par que trabaja en dicho puesto también es estudiante de la carrera de Licenciatura en Educación en la Universidad Técnica de Comercialización y Desarrollo en la ciudad de Ybycuí.
Él se define como un hombre muy aplicado en los estudios y dice que todo lo que hace es por convertirse en un gran profesional y poder de esa forma generar un poco más de ingresos para él y para su familia. Comenta que uno de sus mayores sueños es poder ser profesor de una universidad y de esa forma transmitir todos los conocimientos que pudo obtener.
Él nos cuenta que solicita el crédito para el pago de las cuotas de la universidad y como así también para la compra de libros, folletos y demás que va a utilizar en sus estudios. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya la oportunidad que le brinda, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Patrocino is a faculty instructor in the city of Ybycuí.  In addition to this job, he is a student earning an education degree at the Technical University of Business and Development in the city of Paraguarí.  

Patrocinio defines himself as a man who has applied himself to his studies.  He says that everything he does is purposed with helping him become a successful professional so that he can generate a little more income for himself and his family.  Patrocinio states that one of his greatest wishes is to become a university professor.  

He says that he is requesting this loan to pay his university fees as well as purchase books, pamphlets, and other items that he will use for his studies.  Patrocinio is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity given to him, which will be a great help.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and the purchase of books and binders

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa madre soltera  su hijo estudia,  planes es mejorar su nivel de vida.           La clienta es comerciante tiene de proyecto  de la compra de un vehículo para transportar su productos siendo de una gran ayuda.la mayor necesidad que tiene es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. Con préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, piedrines, piso, estribu, golosa entre otros materiales ya que construir un cuarto así ampliando  su vivienda. Obtendrá          comodidad  y seguridad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother of a son who is in school. Her plans include improving her standard of living. Rosa is a merchant and has plans to buy a vehicle for transporting her products, which will be of great help.

Her greatest need is to improve the infrastructure of her home. With this loan, she will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, blocks, gravel, floor tiles, buttresses, screws, and other supplies so that she can build a room and expand her home. This will provide greater comfort and security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Francois Herve

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 36 ans, célibataire et père d’un enfant âgé de 11 ans.
N’ayant pas de motivation pour poursuivre ses études universitaire, il se lance dans le commerce des cartes de recharges et des appels téléphoniques  depuis 2007.
Ses ventes journalières sont considérables , il vend en moyenne 50 000 – 75 000 F FCA par jour. Avec ce crédit  il va renforcer son commerce en achetant : des cartes recharges et du recharge électronique des réseaux nationaux comme : MTN, AIRTEL, WARID, AZUR.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité ; il compte épargner et à la longue ouvrir un autre point de vente où il pourra vendre du crédit de recharge en gros afin de fournir à d’autres commerçants de la place.
Comme un bon père de famille , il voudrait construire une maison  et financer les études de son enfant.
texts.en:
This client is 36 years old, single and the father of an 11 year old child. With no motivation to continue his university studies, he began selling reload and phone cards in 2007. His daily sales figures are quite high: on average he sells 50,000 - 70,000 CFA francs per day. 

With the loan, he will expand his business by buying: reload cards and electronic reloads on national networks like MTN, AIRTEL, WARID, AZUR. With the profit, he plans to save and, in the long term, open another sales outlet where he can sell reload credits at wholesale so that he can be a supplier to other local sellers. As a good father, he wants to build a house and pay for his child's schooling.

loans.use: to buy Airtel, MTN, Azur, and Warid pre-paid phone cards.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Tong is 33 years old, married, and lives in Prey Chor District of Kompong Charm Province, Cambodia. The people in this region are dedicated to agriculture, mainly the cultivation of corn, bananas, rice and the breeding of animals. Currently, Tong is growing rice, from which she can earn $3USD per day.

She and her husband would like to expand their business, but because they lack money they are seeking a loan from Kiva partner HKL to purchase a plot of land. This loan will contribute to her financial stability and will improve the quality of her product and her farming activities. A calm, honorable and very responsible woman, Tong will be punctual in her payments. She is very grateful to all kind lenders supporting her business.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El joven Manuel esta invirtiendo a mejorar la casa de sus padres ya que como el vive con ellos desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y así un mejor patrimonio. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el materia que es (madera, clavos, y cemento) y empezar a construir el cuarto de madero que sea para sus padres. 
Manuel planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una farmacia, ya que su papa se encargara de los gastos familiares. 
Desean  estar más seguros y protegidos antes de que llegue la temporada de invierno y así evitar enfermedades.
texts.en:
Manuel is investing in improving his parents' house, since, as he lives with them, he wants to give them a better quality of life and so a better inheritance.

He is requesting a loan to buy the materials (lumber, nails, and cement) and begin to build the wood room for his parents.

Manuel plans to repay the loan with the salary from his job in a pharmacy, since his father takes care of the family expenses.

They want to be safer and protected before the winter season arrives, and so avoid illness.

loans.use: to build a room with wood.

loans.name: Elizabeth Kristhel

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza hace tres años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella vende de forma ambulante, llevando y ofreciendo sus productos a distintas instituciones publicas y privadas donde ya tiene clientela y muchos clientes ya realizan sus pedidos, ella deja los productos al contado como también a crédito, también  reparte por su zona es una persona muy emprendedora y lucha por salir adelante,  vive por la zona de Pasanqueri es muy buena  cliente, trabajadora y muy responsable, ella es casada pero su esposo esta de viaje, con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos al por mayor y productos que se encuentran en promoción, y así podrá ofrecer a un precio mas alto y obtener mas ganancias,   La Sra. Elizabeth se encuentra agradecida por la confianza y el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Elizabeth has been selling cosmetics for three years. She sells door-to-door carrying and selling her products at various locations, public and private, where she has built up a clientele. Some of her clients also place orders. She also sells her products on credit. She is a self-starter, and she struggles to get ahead. She lives in an area of Pasanqueri with many good hard-working clients. She is married, but her husband travels. With the loan she will purchase cosmetics at wholesale prices and products that are on sale, so that she can increase her profits. Mrs. Elizabeth is thankful for the trust and support offered.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics at wholesale prices

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has operated in the transport industry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 3 years. He is 59 years old and married to his wife Esther. They have two school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. Besides his transport business, Francis also operates a second-hand clothing business. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of clothes to sell and also to boost his transport business. 

In the future, Francis hopes to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To boost his transport business and to add more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is the father of five school-aged children. His wife is engaged in the hog-raising business, but the source of income for his great family is the business of growing corn. He has been in this business for twenty-five-years. He earned about 40,000 PHP with his last crop. 

Now, Orlando wants to borrow PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his corn farm. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can fulfill the financial needs of his family and save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his corn farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph works hard to provide for his family.  He is 43 years of age, married and have four children.  Aside from farming business, he also raises hogs.  Joseph has been a farmer for ten years.

Joesph has a happy family, which inspires him to work hard.  He is in affect father and mother to his children because his wife is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Workers).   

Joseph plans to increase his rice crop yield, to further improve their living conditions. 

But he is sad, because of the high cost of basic commodities which he needs to buy.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy farm inputs to make his rice grow.  Joseph also prays that he could save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for agricultural business.

loans.name: Miyuke B Group

texts.en:
Alfred is the facilitator of the Miyuke B group. Alfred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alfred takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Alfred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Albert was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Alfred will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Miyuke B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Alfred is pictured with his group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.es:
Leslie, de 26 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 8 y 3 años a quienes tiene a su cargo ya que su ex conviviente los abandono. Es una tarea muy ardua la que realiza pero todo lo hace para poder brindar lo mejor a sus hijos y así tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Vive en su casa propia a lado de sus hijos y su hermana. El trabajo de Leslie consiste en la venta de cuadros, de manera programada se va al penal a comprar cuadros que realizan los internos, de ahí los coloca entre sus clientes y semanal o quincenal realiza la cobranza. Es un trabajo que le esta brindando la oportunidad de poder tener un ingresos para así brindar educación y alimentación a su familia, lleva realizándolo por dos años y le esta yendo muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer mucho de su tiempo, pero no siempre le fue tan fácil poder realizar su trabajo ya que al principio no sabia nada del negocio, pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo y ahora es una forma de vida lo que realiza. Espera poder seguir trabajando y seguir generando ingresos a su hogar. Mas adelante tiene en mente empezar a vender en mayor cantidad y enviar a otros lugares y distritos de la región. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de hambrea puntual como en el anterior crédito que tuvo, además se siente muy a gusto de poder trabajar con su banco comunal ya que son buenos y muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará madera y materiales, para poder hacer más cuadros ya que esta en clases intensivas de aprendizaje y empezará a fabricarlos ella misma.
texts.en:
Leslie, 26, is a friendly, good and hardworking woman. She is a single mother of two children, 8 and 3, who are dependent on her, since her former partner abandoned them. She has to work hard, but everything she does is so she can provide the best for her children and they can have a better quality of life. She lives in her own house with her children and her sister. 

Leslie’s work consists of selling pictures. She makes scheduled visits to the prison to purchase paintings done by the inmates and then sells them to her clients on credit, collecting from them weekly or biweekly. This job earns her an income so she can provide an education and food for her family. She has been doing it for two years and it is going very well. What she likes about her work is that it allows her to schedule her own time, but it was not always so easy, because at first she knew nothing about the business, however little by little she began learning how to do it and now it is a way of life for her. She hopes to be able to continue working and generating an income for her household. In the future she is thinking of beginning to sell in greater volumes and of sending her products to other places and districts in the region.

This will be Leslie’s second loan from MFP and she hopes to have your collaboration so that she can continue to meet her goals. She is committed to making her payments on time as she did with her earlier loan. As well she is very pleased to be able to work with her communal bank, since they are good and very responsible people.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida only passed the fifth standard, but can read and write. She couldn’t study further due to poor financial conditions of her family. Now she stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is the mother of five children. Two of them are studying while her eldest three left their education after the fifth standard and started operating different businesses.

Her eldest son runs a business selling gol gappay (a fast food item made with flour and served with yogurt, chili sauces and chickpeas). This is a very popular dish among people, and he makes a good profit with it. Her other two sons are involved in a fruit salad selling business.
 
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her eldest son's business. With the loan, her son will buy flour, spices and chickpeas in larger quantities for making gol gappay in larger quantities to meet the customers' demands while maximizing his revenue.

Sajida is very confident about the positive growth of her son’s business as a result of an investment.

Note: One of the members of Sajida's Group has a sewing business, which is why she is pictured with a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy flour, spices and chickpeas for making gol gappay (a fast food item).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a fence

loans.name: Xochitl Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Xochitl  Cristina  es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes desde hace tres años es una persona amable que le gusta luchar por sus sueños.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Roberto una persona humilde que ayuda a su esposa en cualquier problema que se le presente.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es: jabon, aceite, cebollas.cafe, leche, pan, galletas, cereales y refrescos.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para comprar más mercancía para su tienda.
texts.en:
Xochitl Cristina is a hard-working lady who has worked selling groceries for three years.  She is a kind person who enjoys fighting for her dreams.

She is happily married to Roberto, a humble person who helps his wife with whatever problem she presents to him.

She requested the loan in order to purchase more merchandise such as: soap, oil, onions, coffee, milk, bread, cookies, cereal and soft drinks.

She gives thanks to the foundation for the support that they have given her allowing her to purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance – Ishaka branch and she has six children aged 30, 28, 25, 21, 17 and 14 with the last four of the six in school. She is a farmer who devotes twelve hours per day to the farming business. She works six days each week and when she is off the farm, she attends to her bar which is her other source of income. She started farming in 1999 and has not turned back since then for it has been her major source of income to sustain her family and she has high hopes that she will be financially stable if the loan is given since it will give her profits in the long run. Her clients are cattle traders in the area and she hopes to use the money to buy more cattle which she intends to fatten and sell at a profit. Her challenge is lack of capital but she believes that if she is given the loan and stays the shrewd farmer she has always been, she will succeed in life.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Benoîte Denise

texts.fr: Mariée à un certain Séverin et mère d'un enfant, scolarisés et à leur charge, Benoîte Denise est âgée de 59 ans. Benoîte Denise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Benoîte Denise vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Benoîte Denise subvient ensemble avec son mari aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Benoîte Denise vend des chaussures et du charbon de bois depuis vingt ans et cette  activité lui permet de de faire face aux diverses charges de sa famille. Benoîte Denise s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Benoîte Denise sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Estefani Mariel

texts.es:
Estefani, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora e independiente. Está casada y es madre de una niña de 11 meses de edad, quién depende económicamente de ella. Estudió la carrera de cosmetología y actualmente vive en Irapuato, en donde también tiene su negocio.
Cuando comenzó a estudiar, Estefani tomó la decisión de iniciar un spa de tratamientos faciales y corporales para que, de esa manera, pudiera comenzar a practicar lo aprendido y al mismo tiempo iniciar su patrimonio. Este negocio, el cual continúa prósperamente, le ha permitido ser independiente y sobre todo, estar cerca de su familia y de su hija. Su sueño es hacerlo crecer aún más y convertirlo en una clínica de tratamientos y al mismo tiempo en una escuela de cosmetología.
Con esta motivación, Estefani ha solicitado un crédito que le ha permitido comprar aparatos para dar más y mejores servicios a sus clientes, así como productos que utiliza en el spa.
Su meta en el negocio es lograr un incremento en sus ganancias, lo que le brindará mayores beneficios en su vida profesional y personal.

loans.use: comprar aparatos y productos que utiliza en el spa

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is an active group member of Kabuta ladies in action. She has 4 children and fortunately they finished college and three of them are working. She supports her nephew with school fees and she pays $228 every year.

She started her business 9 years ago. Currently she has 2 dairy cows producing 17 litres in the morning & 10litres in the evening. She sells 25 litres per day at $ 29 cents per litre. She also farms horticultural products in her farm. Currently she has planted watermelon & butternuts, which she expects to harvest about 2000kg by end of August. This will give her roughly $200. She sells her fruits to people with groceries and market stall in muranga town as well as sagana market. She employs 3 permanent workers and pays them a total of $77 per month.

loans.use: : She wants to buy pipes, sprinklers 7 fittings, for irrigation purpose. She will plant kales to meet the local demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lydia would like to buy chicks for rearing

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.en:
Mrs Eva Maria is married and has two children, aged 7 and 2. Her husband is a baker and has worked for 8 years for a department store. His income is not enough to cover the family expenses. Therefore Eva, for the past 7 years, has been making and selling Tacos. She first stared helping one of her sisters and now has her own business, working from home.

Eva wants to move ahead and contribute more with the family expenses and provide a better education to her children. Eva now needs a loan of $200 to buy supplies to make the tacos and plans to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months. Your support can improve the standard of living of this family and help this business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Virgilio Russi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eva Maria es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, de 7 y 2 años. Su esposo es panadero y trabaja desde hace ocho años en una tienda departamental, sin embargo, el ingreso que recibe no cubre todas las necesidades de su familia, por esta razón desde hace siete años Eva se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tacos, inició ayudándole a una de sus hermanas, pero desde hace cuatro años tiene su propio negocio, en su domicilio. Eva desea progresar y tener un ingreso extra para poder contribuir en los gastos familiares y otorgarles una buena educación a sus hijos. En estos momentos Eva necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los insumos que necesita para la elaboración de los tacos, mismo que planea devolver en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia y contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: purchase supplies

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angelica is 43-years-old single mother of five. Like many women in her region, she had to work at a spinning mill in the city for the 23 years. With a lot of sacrifice she was able to provide for her family without the help of her children's father. A staff reduction left her without work, but she was indemnified, and with the money she opened up a store in her home to serve as the family's source of income. Along with this, she took up making baby's clothing. Through these activies she had a decent life and could feed her kids and provide them with a good education. Her store has good earnings, since this year her clientele has increased, and at times it has been difficult to have a supply that meets the demand. To correct this situation, Angelica is requesting a loan of $200, which she plans to use to purchase necessary supplies in larger quantities, like flour, sugar, rice, noodles and oil, because those are in the highest demand at her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Angélica tiene 43 años. Es soltera y tiene 5 hijos. Como tantas mujeres luchadoras tuvo que trabajar en la hilandería de la ciudad desde los 23 años. Con mucho sacrificio mantuvo su hogar sin la ayuda del padre de sus hijos. La reducción de personal la dejó sin trabajo. Sin embargo, fue indemnizada y con el mismo dinero abrió una despensa en su casa que le sirve como sustento para la familia. Aparte se dedica también a confeccionar ropa para niños. Mediante estas actividades tiene una vida digna y puede brindarles a sus hijos alimentación y buena educación. Su almacén le está dando buenos ingresos, ya que este año han aumentado sus clientes, y hasta en ocaciones le resulta difícil cumplir con su demanda. Para contrarestar esta situacion, Angélica, desea solicitar un crédito de $ 200 con los que planea comprar mercaderías de primera necesidad y en mayor cantidad para su despensa, tales como harina, azúcar, arroz y fideos, pues estos son los de mayor demanda.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, rice, noodles, oil, etc.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora is 42 years old, she is married to Isabelino Marín, and they have two children, ages 19 and 17 respectively. The older studies Psychology at the university, and the younger is still attending high school.

Flora is the proprietor of a beauty salon which she operates in a rented location. She has worked in this field for 21 years. She says that after she finished high school, because she came from a very humble family, she did not have the opportunity to study for a career at the university, but nonetheless her mother paid for a beauty school course which she succeeded in finishing with much effort, thus acquiring her profession.

Due to the enormous cost of the education of her children, she must redouble her efforts to obtain sufficient income to cover them. That's why she is open every day, whether it's raining, cold, or hot, and even on holidays.

She has always used loans to invest in the beauty salon. This time she is requesting a loan to buy articles such as: dyes, shampoos, gel, and creams, and also to renew the elements of her work such as: hair dryer, curling iron, scissors, etc.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Flora tiene 42 años, está casada con Isabelino Marín y tienen 2 hijos, de 19 y 17 años respectivamente. El mayor estudia en la universidad la carrera de Psicología y el menor aún está siguiendo la secundaria.

Flora es propietaria de una peluquería que funciona en un local alquilado, se dedica a la misma actividad hace 21 años. Comenta que al terminar la secundaria y debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria, sin embargo su madre pudo pagarle un curso de peluquería que logró terminar con mucho esfuerzo, adquiriendo así la profesión.

Debido al enorme costo que demanda la educación de sus hijos debe redoblar esfuerzos para obtener los ingresos suficientes para costearlos, por tal motivo abre todos los días, así llueva, haga frío o calor, además de los días feriados.

Siempre recurrió a los préstamos para invertirlos en su peluquería. En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para comprar artículos como ser: tinturas, shampoos, gel, cremas además de renovar sus elementos de trabajo como ser: secador de pelo, planchita, tijeras,etc.

loans.use: To buy dyes, shampoo, hair dryer, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old, married and has 6 children. She and her husband own a matatoo, a van for transporting up to 14 persons. They also have a small 6 room rental unit attached to their house which they built themselves using previous loans. Janet is the treasury of her lending group and on the day we visited, she hosted as we went from business to business. She is a delightful person with an easy smile and a love for her community.
With her loan she hopes to buy some new tires and to do some much needed maintenance on their matatoo.

loans.use: Janet plans to use her loan to buy new tires and to do much needed Maintenance on their matatoo, taxi.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
This single mother of two teenagers owns and manages two different businesses. The venture to which she dedicates the majority of her time is a stand selling candies on a busy street in Ayacucho, Peru. She tends to this stand every single day of the week. As an “ambulante,” Mauricia has a stand on wheels, and when business is slow in one area, she has the capability to pick up and move to a more profitable section, taking advantage of greater flows of traffic. Mauricia explains that she loves her job because she is her own boss and it allows her the freedom to move about, taking advantage of the most visited and traffic-heavy areas of the city.

Although she enjoys selling candies, Mauricia’s second business is the one she is working to develop into a full-time job. This business consists of renting out the “moto-taxi” she saved so diligently to buy. A moto-taxi is a type of covered three-wheel motorcycle with a backseat, and they are the principal means of public transportation throughout this small Andean city. Every morning, the chauffeur to whom she has rented the taxi drives her to her stand and then he sets off earning money during the day. Mauricia charges 25 Soles per day to rent her taxi, or about US$ 8.50. This is an ideal way to make a living, explains Mauricia, and her dream is to save up enough money to buy a fleet of taxis that she would rent out daily.

A major factor allowing her to work diligently toward her dream business has been her involvement with her village bank. Having been the catalyst to her hard work and savings, Mauricia is very grateful to her bank. There, she has learned how to save her money and has received the economic support necessary to grow her business and accumulate capital. The reason she works so hard is to put food on the table for her children and facilitate their high school and college educations. Thanks to the loans she receives, this is a goal that is always met.

Mauricia is requesting a loan of US$ 425. This money will be put toward the repair of her moto-taxi because although it is profitable, it not necessarily a reliable type of automobile, requiring continual maintenance. She will buy new tires and cylinders.

loans.use: To buy new tires and cylinders for her moto-taxi

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek R., 42, is married with six children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife while her husband works as a carpenter making tables, chairs, beds, cabinets and other wooden furniture items, making on average around $4/day. One of her children works as a waiter; another is a motor-taxi driver and the rest attend school. Mrs. Sek R. hopes to use this loan to purchase more carpentR. tools and other supplies for her husband to expand his products.

loans.use: To purchase more carpentry tools and other supplies for her husband to expand his products.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 45 -ear-old Stella K.. She is single with three children, ages 8, 13, and 15. In 2000 Stella established a poultry business. Stella has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $700 in order to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on Kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. "Who or what are kuku?" you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals or prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mr. Lay S. has been married to his second wife since 1996. He has four children; two sons and two daughters. His two sons work in the construction business with him and the other two children are studying in the local school. Mr. S. has been in business for four years. Besides construction work, he is also a fisherman. His wife has been farming for more than ten years. Lay and his family live on an island in the Mekong River,about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000. He will use this money to purchase additional construction tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a very hard-working woman and mother of three children, and she is responsible for supporting all the family. Her husband is a public employee and doesn’t have a good salary. “I’m the leader of the house”, she says.

Petronila sells a collection of chic pants, blouses, slippers and shoes to women of the Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo. As she doesn’t have a locale to run the business out of, the entrepreneur visits friends, neighbors and other people of the surroundings in order to sell her goods.

Petronila’s dream is to have a very big clothing store "with millions of products and thousands of loyal customers". With her loan, Petronila will purchase more goods to add to her stock.

loans.use: purchase of clothing to supply her small business

location.town: Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia V. is 38 years old. She is the single mother of a son who is currently attending the 7th grade at a local public school. Claudia is the owner of a mini market, a small general store, which she has been running out of her house for the past 8 years.

Claudia is a beloved member of her neighborhood, recognized for her willingness to help her neighbors and for her charisma. These are the powerful reasons why neighbors and friends prefer to shop at her store.

Her store is always well stocked. She is of the opinion that it's better to have a variety of products so that her customers always find what they need. Among the items she offers we can find: beef cuts, sweet treats, dairy products, drinks, etc. She started with a small kiosk that throughout the years and thanks to her investments has grown considerably.

Currently she has a computerized system for her receipts and to control her stocked merchandise. She obtained this system a few years ago thanks to the previous loans she received from Fundación Paraguaya. This system makes it easier for her to do her cash count and to control her merchandise.

A few months ago, Claudia's mother, who lives with her, was ill and the tests and medications were very expensive. In oder to be able to pay for it Claudia had to use the money she had saved to purchase the merchandise for her store.

Claudia is an excellent client of the institution and has been very punctual in paying her previous loans and has invested them well. She now asks for a new loan to be able to replace her stocked merchandise and in this manner keep her customers happy.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Claudia V. tiene 38 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo varón que actualmente se encuentra cursando el 7º grado en un colegio nacional de la zona; Claudia es propietaria de un mini market, la misma esta ubicada en su casa y ya lleva 8 años de antigüedad en el rubro.

Claudia es una mujer muy querida en su barrio, reconocida por su buena predisposición para ayudar a sus vecinos y su carisma, estas son razones poderosas por la cual sus vecinos y amigos prefieren ir a comprar en su negocio.

Su tienda esta bien surtida, ella dice que es mejor tener variedad para que sus clientes encuentren siempre lo que necesiten; entre ellas podemos contar que pose carnicería, golosinas, lácteos, bebidas. Ella empezó con un pequeño kiosco que con los años y su buena inversión hoy ha crecido bastante.

Posee un sistema informático de tiquetes y control de stock de mercaderías que lo adquirió hace unos años gracias a los créditos anteriores que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya, este sistema le facilita su arqueo de caja y control de sus mercaderías.

Hace unos meses, la madre de Claudia, que vive con ella, enfermó y la demanda de los medicamentos y estudios fue muy alta por lo que para costear eso utilizo el dinero que ella ahorro para la compra de mercaderías de su local.

Claudia es una excelente cliente de la Fundación y ha pagado con puntualidad los créditos que ha retirado anteriormente y que los ha sabido invertir bien. Hoy día, ella solicita un nuevo crédito para poder reponer su stock de mercadería y así poder mantener siempre su buena clientela

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as: meat, canned goods, dairy products, sweet treats, cleaning products, breads, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase silver jewelry to retail in her community

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy R., 39, is married and lives in Siem Reap Province with her five children. She sells fish in the market, making $3 each day, while her husband works in construction, making about $5 every day. They are also supported by one of their children, who is employed in the area.

Inflation has driven up prices across Cambodia, and many are facing severe economic struggles. Soy R. has approached CREDIT for a loan of $500 to purchase some wood to repair her leaking house. She believes this will be a sustainable investment that will significantly raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair home.

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzovi K. was born on December 31st, 1975 in the Village of Neope, in Togo. She is married and the mother of three (3) children. With her parents assistance, she achieved her childhood passion of become a dress maker. She began her practice in 2001 and after marrying a tailor, developed the idea of starting a sewing materials business. The business started successfully as she and her husband were the first clients. She has become the source for sewing materials for her competitors, however, she has not been able to adequately serve them as she can not provide sufficient stock. To resolve this, she is requesting her first business loan to increase her stock by purchasing 20 rolls lace, 20 rolls of poplin fabric and 10 pieces of pagne (decorative cloth).

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Née le31décembre 1975 à Noèpé un village du TOGO, madame K. Adzovi est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Ses parents l’ont aidé à réaliser sa passion d’enfance, devenir couturière. Ainsi elle exerce son activité depuis 2001 et étant donné qu’elle s’est mariée à un tailleur, elle a eu la géniale idée de faire le commerce des articles de mercerie. Ceci a réussi car son mari et elle-même sont le premier client de cette activité. Elle constitue en même temps le point d’approvisionnement de ses concurrents, cependant elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle à cause de la rupture de stock. Pour y remédier, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 20 rouleaux de guipures 20 rouleaux de popeline et 10 pièces de pagne.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials and pagne (decorative cloth)

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mr. Phon P., 45, is a farmer from the Trean Commune in Cambodia's Kampong Cham Province. He also relies on fishing as an additional income source to supplement his earnings from farming. He is married and has four children, one of whom is employed as a garment worker and who helps support Mr. Phon's loan repayment. His wife stays at home and cares for the children.

Rising family expenses have made it necessary for Mr. Phon to expand his business and earn more. Thus, he is requesting a loan to purchase more nets for his fishing business. He will use the remainder of the loan to purchase some piglets to raise. Mr. Phon and his wife are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing nets and some piglets to raise

texts.es:
Liz Kelly tiene 28 años y vive en el jirón Las Fábricas Manzana R  lote 8B  Semirustica El Bosque Trujillo La Libertad Perú, donde también funciona su negocio.
Estudió secundaria completa pero ya no siguió estudiando por razones económicas y sobre todo porque se casó con Wilson Rolando Medina Morales y tienen tres hijas que dependen de la pareja.
Con un ahorro que tenía empezó a vender gaseosa y se dio cuenta que podía vender también otras cosas como azúcar, arroz, aceite y sobre todo detergente que también le sirve para lavar ropa ajena algunas veces.
Ha recibido su primer préstamo de 300 soles con lo que compró arroz, azúcar y detergente.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500 soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, piensa invertir en su negocio comprando gaseosa, papel higiénico y detergente.
Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y ver a sus hijas profesionales y con un gran futuro.
Liz Kelly pertenece al Banco Trabajo  y Amor, cuenta que el Banco le ayuda mucho a reflexionar sobre la importancia de tener educación y visión de trabajo.
texts.en:
Liz Kelly is 28 years old and lives in the street Las Fabricas Manzana R lote 8B, Semirustica El Bosque Trujillo La Libertad, Peru, where she runs her business. She completed high school but has not continued studying due to economic reasons and above all, because she married Wilson Rolando Medina Morales and has three daughters that depend on her and her husband. With the savings she had, she started to sell soda and realized that she could sell other products as well such as sugar, rice, oil, and most importantly, detergent that would allow her to provide laundry services. She has received her first loan of 300 soles with which she will buy rice, sugar, and laundry detergent. With this loan of 500 soles, which she can pay back in 4 months, Liz believes she can invest in her business by purchasing soda, toilet paper, and laundry detergent. Liz’s dream is to grow her business and see her daughters become professionals with a grand future. She belongs to Banco Trabajo y Amor and says that the bank has significantly helped her to reflect on the importance of obtaining an education and having a vision of business.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery products

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Vicky B. from Mwanza, married with two children, both 18 years old. Vicky has been running a shop since 2006 selling rice, beans, maize flour, soaps, sugar, and tea leaves. Working at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and assisted by her son, Vicky currently earns about $100 per month.

She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy additional maize flour, rice, beans, soaps, sugar, and tea leaves. In the future, she plans to increase the range and quantity of stocks. Vicky thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice, beans, soaps, sugar, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Bopha P. was born in 1987 and now she lives in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who takes care of her baby of six months and is a good cook. Her husband, Mr. Keng Sovannarith, is a policeman. In addition, in his free time he is a motorbike driver to earn a living. Now they face an obstacle because their house is old and they do not have enough money to repair their house. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Bopha P. decided to ask for a loan to repair the house. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to repair their house

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny Y., 35, and her husband, Mr. Hout Sen, 35, who live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1992 and have two sons who attend school.

Ny has been a silk weaver since she was seventeen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She also taught her husband to do silk weaving as well. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Hout has been a carpenter since he was twenty years old, a skill he learned from his father. He produces looms, tables, and cupboards for sale.

Now, Ny is requesting a loan of US$ 350 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Fololina

texts.en: Fololina M., 51, is married with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $250 USD).  SPBD loans are Fololina’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for purchasing cement and iron roofing for her house.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone and sting for her farming business

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abass is a 31-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abass has been working as a car mechanic. He has been repairing and selling diesel cars for 8 years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second request for a loan. He always made his loan payments on time. His previous loan helped him improve his business.

Abass is a special businessman because his is trustworthy. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He started his business because he wanted to earn more cash and be independent. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding clients. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Purchase tools for diesel car repair business

loans.name: Khursheed Sadiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Khursheed Sadiq M. keeps herself busy with her clothing business. She buys clothes from Multan and sells in her community and to clothing shops. She is 55 years old and a widow; her husband Sadiq M. died of a heart attack. She is a citizen of a historical place named Yadgar, Pakistan for the past 20 years.  Khursheed is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons have an iron business. They make iron rods and sell to different shops. Her daughter reads in 8th standard. Khursheed successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a loan to buy iron to expand her son’s business. 

She is a group leader for women in her locality. Shamim Baji and Rubina Naz Baji each want a loan to buy iron to sell. Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her business. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw, a local three-wheeled motor vehicle. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee on each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron to sell, scrap to sell and an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Manuela Achata Gómez es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe”, en la comunidad D. Sajjo, en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 37 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios D. secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella se dedica al engorD. D. ganado mayor (toros) y la venta D. golosinas, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio (golosinas y bebidas). 
Ella requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir ganado menor (ovejas y porcinos) para someterlos a engorD. y posteriormente venderlos como carne; asimismo desea adquirir mas mercadería (golosinas) además D. bebidas y otros; D. esta manera ella piensa invertir todas sus ganancias en la implementación D. una sastrería puesto que su esposo es “sastre” y se dedica a esta actividad, con ello desea brindar una adecuada educación a sus hijos a nivel superior.
texts.en:
La señora Ruth Manuela Achata Gómez es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe”, en la comunidad D. Sajjo, en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 37 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios D. secundaria completa. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella se dedica al engorD. D. ganado mayor (toros) y la venta D. golosinas, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio (golosinas y bebidas). Ella requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir ganado menor (ovejas y porcinos) para someterlos a engorD. y posteriormente venderlos como carne; asimismo desea adquirir mas mercadería (golosinas) además D. bebidas y otros; D. esta manera ella piensa invertir todas sus ganancias en la implementación D. una sastrería puesto que su esposo es “sastre” y se dedica a esta actividad, con ello desea brindar una adecuada educación a sus hijos a nivel superior.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para adquirir más mercaderías como galletas,bebidas,frutas.

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Zeneyda M. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños teniendo sus vitrinas donde los exhibe a diario.

Ella actualmente require invertir en su negocio y para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual le sirva para la compra de los perfumes  y así llenar sus estantes de los perfumes.
texts.en:
In the township of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua, Mrs. Zeneyda M. works with great spirit and effort at her business of selling perfumes for women, men and children, having display cabinets where she displays them daily. At the moment, she needs to invest in her business, and for that she has sought support from Ceprodel to receive a loan, which would serve for the purchase of perfumes and in this way fill her shelves with perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of perfume

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr:
H. Léontine est née le 23 mars 1977 à ADJOHOUN dans la Vallée du Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Léontine est mariée à SEGODO Roger déclarant en douane. Léontine est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Léontine est dans la restauration. En effet, Léontine vend devant chez elle à la maison la pâte de maïs, de causette d'igname, de manioc, du riz et du haricot. Léontine connait de fréquentes rupture de stock en maïs, riz et haricot. Pour parer à cette difficulté, Léontine sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé sous forme de prêt afin de pouvoir constituer un stock important de provisions pour mieux servir sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Léontine was born on March 23, 1977 in ADJOHOUN, in the valley of Ouémé county, in southern Benin. She is married to SEGODO Roger, a customs advisor, and is the mother of three children, all in school. She works in the food catering business. Essentially, in front of her home, she sells cornmeal mash, chips made of yams or cassava, rice, and beans. Léontine used to experience frequent inventory shortages of corn, rice, and beans. To fend off these difficulties, she’s requesting financial support from Alidé in the form of a loan in order to be able to replenish her sizable stock of provisions, so as to serve her customers better.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, beans, cassava flour, rice, and condiments for making sauces

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Mrs. Gemma J. is 37 years old, is married, and lives in Tuburan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 4 children. Her husband is a private employee. Some of her children are in college already. She says, "If we only depend on the salary of my husband, it is not enough to support our daily needs.” She feels the difficulty of sending their children to school. And so Gemma thought of an economic project that would generate additional income.

Cooking is her favorite household chore. That’s how she got the idea of selling cookies and bread. In October 2008, she joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for a chance to take a loan. She’s happy that the cooperative has extended their services to the needy members. From then on, she gained more customers and generated daily income. Today, she is applying for PHP 20,000 for additional capital for her cookie- and bread-making business. Seeing all her children succeed in life is her greatest achievement.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cookie and bread making

loans.name: Kyeviiri's Group

texts.en: Kyeviiri N. is a very hardworking mother of six children, two of whom are still in school. She also helps care for four grandchildren. She has been selling produce in Ibanda town for over fifteen years. She gets some of the produce from her own garden and the rest from her fellow farmers who have no access to a ready market. The previous loans she has gotten have helped her with paying her children’s school fees, and this is why she has been able to send her eldest four through school while she continues to take on the rest of her responsibilities. She needs a loan to help with paying school fees for her school-going children as well as for employing labor on her farm.

loans.use: To employ labor on her farm and pay school fees

loans.name: Usuf

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Юсуф Ниёзов родился в 1960 году. По специальности он преподователь, преподает урок арифметики в местной школе. Юсуф живет вместе со своей семьей. Женой Рахимой и 3 детьми.Жена Юсуфа домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей.
