Сыновья Юсуфа уже имеют свои собственные семья. Старший сын плотник, он каждый месяц зарабатывает 500 сомони, а младший занимается ремонтом автобусов, и зарабатывает в месяц 350 сомони. Дочка Юсуфа еще маленькая, она учится в школе.
Так как заработная плата у преподователя в нашей стране очень низкая, Юсуф занимается еще и животноводством. В этом деле ему помогают жена, и невестки.Первый раз когда наш клиент получил кредит у него было 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, на сегодняшний день их уже 9 голов. Он хочет получить  кредит во второй раз, для того чтобы откормить свой скот и перепродать его на рынке.
Планиреут увеличть колличество своего скота до 11 голов.
texts.en:
Usuf N. was born in 1960. He is an arithmetic teacher at a local school. Usuf lives with his family – wife Rahima and their 3 children. Usuf’s wife is a homemaker, raising children. Usuf’s sons already have their own families. His oldest son is carpenter, making 500 somoni every month. The younger son is a bus mechanic, making 350 somoni per month. Usuf’s daughter is still very young and goes to school. Because a teacher’s salary is very low in this country, Usuf is also involved in animal husbandry. His wife and daughters-in-law help him with the business. When Usuf first obtained a loan, he had 7 heads of livestock and has 9 today. He wants to obtain this second loan in order to feed his livestock and resell it at a market. He plans to increase his livestock quantity to 11 heads.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and sale of cattle

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is from the village of Biasong. She is 61 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to be used as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosalinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: James Omondi

texts.en: James S. is a forty-seven-year-old man living in Bukembe Village of Kakamega District, Western Kenya. He is married to Emily and they have five children. James currently sells various fish such as tilapia and omena. Omena is a small two-inch long fish found in Lake Victoria in Western Kenya. He buys his fish from Kisumu City which is situated next to Lake Victoria. James has been managing his business on his own for the last twelve years. This will be James' third loan from KADET. He plans to use this loan to increase his stock of fish and also plans to buy cattle as a way of diversifying his business. His dream is to one day own a boat and start fishing. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fish, and buy cattle in order to diversify his business

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa C. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Leonisa is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Leonisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Leonisa has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the products offered at her store

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 48 years old. He is married with three children, who are currently in school. Benjamin is a taxi driver; he has been driving for the past 12 years. Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He picks passengers up from the local lorry station and drives to the nearby towns at a transport fare of 50pesewas (0.5 cedis) per head. He requests a loan to enable him to maintain his taxi so he can make daily income to support his family and pay his kids' school fees.

loans.use: To buy an engine

loans.name: Sok Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Leng P., a 37-year-old single woman living in Andoung village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In addition to working this plantation, she is a pig-breeder. Since the latter business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing two more piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Ladyétou

texts.fr: Cette femme est mère de 04 enfants ; elle a épousé un cuisinier. C’est pour aider son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants qu’elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale, dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle dispose d’une machine assez spacieuse où elle vend des pâtes alimentaires, des tomates, des sardines, des savons et bien d’autres produits de nécessité. Elle est connue de beaucoup de personnes dans le quartier et sa boutique est très visitée à cause du bon accueil qu’elle réserve toujours à tous ses clients. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler son stock presque épuisé ; c’est pour cela qu’elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 02 cartons de sardines, 12 bidons d’huiles et différents cartons de savons.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy, 33 years old and married, sells electrical goods such as microwaves, irons, etc.  She started this business in 2005 and now hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electrical goods to sell.  She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney C. is from the village of Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, which is in the province of Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old. Rodney is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Rodney works in a family member's vulcanizing shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tire repair. Rodney has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rodney joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodney is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional equipment needed in tire repair. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rodney from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment needed for tire repair.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Don Moisés, Es cliente antiguo de la institucion, vive en la casa de su hermana, por que aun esta ahorrando para comprar la suya. Vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos que estan estudiando en colegio. su actividad principal es la venta de ganado en pie en el mercado campesino actividad que la viene desarrollando desde hace 3 años y con la cual mantiene a su familia. El credito invertira en la compra de una vaca que le ofrecieron de oferta.
texts.en:
Moisés, a long-time institution client, lives with his wife and two children, who are high school students, in his sister's house because he is still saving up to buy his own house. To support his family, he sells live cattle in the farmer's market; he has done this for the past 3 years. He will use these funds to buy a cow which was offered to him at a reduced sale price.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Entrepreneur Lorelie S. is interested in expanding her curtain business and adding some items like different styles of bed sheets. She also plans to get involved in selling meat in the market. She is 33 years old, married to Weny S. and has two children, namely Michaela Louriz and Reimuz Rodel S., who are in grade school. They live in Caniogan, Morong, Rizal.

Lorelie had been a member of ASHI for 11 years now and had been sewing curtains and selling them in other towns for almost 10 years. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos to purchase bed sheets, Sylvia Blue curtains, Gina Printed Blue, peach, pink and maroon curtains and to purchase meat for the market. She’s hoping for the best in their lives and this is a big step for her and her family. This loan will make their dreams come true: to have their children finish their studies and to have a comfortable house of their own to live in. They also dream of buying their own tricycle for a business. Like most families here, they are just hoping for the best and knocking on your good hearts for the kind support you can give.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets, curtains and meat

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 43 years old and is married with seven children. She and her family live in Kicukiro, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Penina has been in the business of selling shoes for the past five years. She employs two people from her community and the hours of business are from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every weekday.

Penina is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more shoes for sale in order to make her business more competitive as well as satisfying the high demand for shoes from her customers. Through this expansion, she hopes to supply to larger markets than before.

If this expansion succeeds, Penina will build a financially sound future for her business as well as provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for sale

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Alberta works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a fish monger. She buys fresh fish, smokes them, and supplies the smoked fish to food vendors. She buys the fresh fish directly from the fishermen in her community. Alberta has been in business for ten years and yearns to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es: El joven Diego M. G. tiene 21 años de edad, es casado y vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su menor hija de dos años. Su domicilio está ubicado en el sector Santa Petronila distrito de Santiago- Ica. Labora como obrero de campo en la empresa Agrícola La Venta ubicada en la misma zona. Su esposa se dedica a labores de campo en parcelas de sus padres. Son personas muy trabajadoras que fueron damnificados del terremoto y han construído su casa, una parte de material noble y otra de caña y adobe. No cuenta con endeudamiento en ninguna institución y requiere de financiamiento para terminar de construir parte de su vivienda ya que cuenta con algunos materiales de construcción en stock. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa y brindar mejor calidad de vida  a su familia. El Sr. Diego M. G. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar para alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Diego M. G. is 21 years old, married, and living in his own house with his wife and their 2-year-old daughter. Their home is in the Santa Petronila district of Santiago. He is a field worker with the La Venta agricultural company, located in the same area. His wife works in the field, in land owned by parents. They are hard-working people, victims of the earthquake. They have built their house partly of concrete, partly cane and adobe. They have no debts outstanding with any institution, and need financing to finish building their house, using construction materials available. Their dream is to finish building their house and offer the family a higher standard of living. The M. G. family is grateful for the support we can offer to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Madame Anta K. est une femme mariée de 52 ans, sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC de Baye Laye depuis Aout 2009.Elle  habite dans la localité de Homo 6 , une cite environnante de la zone de Guediawaye. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit déjà rembourse au sein de l’IMCEC.C’est un véritable soutien de famille car elle est mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 12 et 25 ans. Madame K. a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans le commerce de fleurs, de tissus, de drap et de friperie. Elle fréquente la  foire de Dakar et les grands marches. Elle est née dans une grande famille de commerçantes. Et à cet effet elle a été orientée dans cette activité par une de ses tantes qui voyageait sur la Turquie et  qui lui a appris le commerce de fleurs en premier lieu. Les moments les plus favorables  pour son commerce sont les périodes d’événements  de Tabaski, de korite et de fin d’année. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de marchandise. L’achat se fera par l’intermédiaire de fille qui va à Doubaï. Mais son plus grand rêve est d’envisager dans le futur un voyage pour son propre compte..Grace aux crédits empruntes elle parvient à renforcer ses stocks et a diversifier ses produits. Par conséquent l’amélioration de sa marge bénéficiaire l’aide a constituer une épargne personnelle et  a penser a des projets futurs. Avant tout c’est une source de satisfaction des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ms. Anta K. is a 52-year-old married woman who has been a member of the U-IMCEC branch of Baye Laye since August 2009.  She lives in the town of Homo 6, a place encompassing the area of Guediawaye.  She has already benefited from a loan already repaid within IMCEC.  She is practically the family's breadwinner, since she is the mother of seven children, whose ages range from 12 to 25 years.  Ms. K. has over twenty years of experience in the commerce of flowers, fabrics, bed sheets, and second-hand clothing.  She goes to the Dakar fair and to the big markets.  She was born into a large family of merchants.  And because of this, she was familiarized with this work by one of her aunts, who used to travel to Turkey and who taught her commerce in flowers in the first place.  The best times for her business are during the events surrounding Tabaski, Korite, and New Year's Day.  Ms. K. is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for bolstering her stock of merchandise.  Her supplies will be purchased through brokers who go to Dubai.   But her greatest dream is to do the traveling herself in the future.  Thanks to the loans taken out, she is able to boost her inventory and to diversify her products. Improving her profit margin helps her as a result to build up some personal savings and to think about future projects.  Above all, it's a way of meeting family needs. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 46 years old, married with 4 children who are 17, 20, 22, and 25 years old. Virginie has been in the business of renting out wedding clothes for about 10 years. Virginie is happy in her business because it helps her to take care of her family. The hours of her business are from 5 AM to 7 PM every day.

Virginie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing some other styles of wedding clothes. Those new styles are modern styles, and she hopes that once she adds those new styles to her business, she will attract many young people who are ready for marriage and she hopes that once they are ready to get married, they will come to rent clothes. Virginie, by using this Kiva loan, expects to see an increase in sustainability in her business.

loans.use: Additional wedding clothes to rent out

loans.name: Ebubedike

texts.en:
Ebubedike is 42 years old, married and has five children. She is a client of LAPO Microfinance and has been borrowing for the past four years. Ebubedike sells 'fairly used' bags and has been in this business for some years. Before she started this trade, she sold foodstuffs. She said sale of 'fairly used' bags is more profitable for her. 

Ebubedike is full of life and hard work. She makes sure there is no lack in her home – food, clothing and more. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more 'fairly used' bags to sell. She promises to pay back promptly and says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more 'fairly used' bags to sell

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia,  D. 47 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la casa D. su suegra con su esposo y  su última  hija, pues sus 2 hijos mayores se han independizado.Cada día alrededor D. la 4 D. la madrugada acuD. a la distribuidora central D. periódicos, para recoger los diarios que tiene que redistribuir  hasta  el mediodía, los lleva  a los diversos kioscos del distrito donD. vive. DesD. hace 2 años se dedica a esta labor, le genera regulares ganancias que le permiten cubrir  la alimentación y  educación D. su hija menor, ya que su pareja es un hombre muy  irresponsable que no se hace cargo D. su pequeña. A veces tiene dificultades en su trabajo, pero a Eusebia le gusta mucho trabajar como distribuidora D. diarios.  Y en los próximos meses quiere incursionar en la venta D.  productos D. belleza, con la finalidad D. incrementar sus ingresos, y así brindarle una mejor  calidad D. vida a su menor hija.Es el  séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además se siente satisfecha con sus compañeras D. crédito  porque son personas responsables, al igual que ella.Eusebia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra D.  revistas, porque hay mayores ganancias en las ventas,  y  con el resto del dinero comprará gran cantidad  D. productos D. belleza, para empezar en este negocio y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Eusebia, age 47, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her husband and her youngest daughter. Her two oldest children are independent. Everyday at around four in the morning she goes to the central newspaper distributor to gather the papers that she needs to redistribute until noon. She takes them to various kiosks in the district where she lives. She has been doing this work for two years. It generates regular earnings, which allow her to cover the food and education for her youngest daughter. She does this because her husband is a very irresponsible man, who does not take care of his daughter. At times she has difficulties in her work, but Eusebia really likes her work as a distributor of daily papers. In the coming months she wants to venture into selling beauty products. She wants to do this to increase her earnings and give her youngest daughter a better quality of life. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She promises to make her payments punctually. She is happy with her loan colleagues because they are responsible people, the same as she is. She will use the money she is requesting to buy magazines because there are greater earnings selling them. She will use the rest of the money to buy a large quantity of beauty products to start in this business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy magazines to improve her business

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El señor Porfirio B. M. tiene 3 años de estar laborando Con CEPRODEL-El sauce, como fiador de dichos créditos otorgado a su hijo Ali Josué B. ambos habitan en la comarca el pajarito municipio Achuapa, es por primera vez que el cliente ase solicitud para la compra de 3 terneros para bueyes ya que en su inventario ganadero no tiene. 
El cliente tiene 5 hijos a su cargo 2 están estudiando en la secundaria y los otros trabajan en su finca, cuenta con una propiedad de 80 MZ propia de terreno, donde la desarrolla para la explotación ganadera y agricultura.  
Se dedica a la actividad de agricultura y ganadería la inversión la realizo con el objetivo de tener una mayor fuente de ingresos y mejorar su  trabajo, para así sacarle provecho y abastecer las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Porfirio has been working as a cosigner for his son Ali’s loans through CEPRODEL-El Sauce for the past three years. Both live in the “Pajarito” region of the city of Achuapa. This is his first request and he will use the money to buy three plots of land on which to raise oxen. He has five children, two of whom attend junior high school and the others work his herd. He has his own land which he has developed for raising livestock and for farming. He started farming and raising livestock in order to have a better source of income and improve his work in order to be able to better provide for his family’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land to raise oxes

loans.name: Lunh

texts.en: Lunh H., 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is engaged in a business weaving Cambodian traditional silk for an income of about USD 1 per day. Her husband is a farmer and sells his rice product for an income of USD 0.5 per day. H. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more raw silk to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to build a new house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to expand the business.

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan is 27-year-old woman. She is from the city called Borewala, in Pakistan. (Borewala is famous for its shrines.) She is an uneducated lady. Her parents couldn’t send her to school because they have a big family to support.  She spent her time at home and did household work. She got married at the age of 18 to a man whose name is M. R.. 

Rasoolan gave birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son reads in 2nd standard and the others have no occupation. Rasoolan is a very talented lady; she manages her clothes-selling business. She receives order from her neighbors and relatives. She purchases clothing from different cities (especially Multan & Lahore) because of their cheap rates and good designs. She has been operating this business for the last 3 years. Her income helps her to share the financial burden with her husband. 

Her husband sells vehicle tyres (rubber edging for wheels) in the market. He has been in this business for over 25 years. He has obtained a good reputation among his customers. He sells quality materials in his shop which attracts more customers.  

Rasoolan has been a client of Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan) for the last three years. She is applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase tyres in bulk to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: Purchase tyres for husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely B., 58, is married to Niverio B., a driver, and they have two children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life by managing her own dried fish business. Fely has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow ten times in CCT’s Cooperative. She uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her dried fish business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan to be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more dried fish. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more dried fish

loans.name: Foi Plus Group

texts.en:
Monique Katinga, 45, is the manager of the Community Bank named “Foi Plus” which means “Faith” in English. It is composed of 20 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Monique has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2005, when she began her business selling used clothing. Her business has prospered thanks to accumulated profit and good management, generating a profit of $40 per week, and her next loan will be used to buy spices in bulk to resell retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Monique’s ambition is to open a general store.

She is a married mother of nine children between the ages 6 and 27, seven of whom attend school.

loans.use: To purchase spices in bulk to resell retail with the goal of increasing her profits

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 29 años, es una persona muy honrada y laboriosa, que vive  en su casa propia, junto a su pareja Primitivo de 30 años y sus tres hijos, quienes son su razón de vivir. Hace más de 10 años siembra diferentes variedades de papa, en terrenos propios y junto a su esposo, también crían animales como toros, carneros y cerdos, los cuales cuida cerca  a las chacras que va trabajando para no perderlos, lo que más le gusta es sembrar las semillas de tubérculos (papa), debido a que tiene que darles el espacio suficiente para su desarrollo, sin embargo el tener que hacer los surcos, le resulta pesado para levantar cierta cantidad de tierra, que abrigue el producto hasta su maduración. Nilda, con el buen entusiasmo que le caracteriza, asegura que la agricultura es bastante rentable, porque con las ganancias, pudo comprar más terrenos agrícolas, además cubrir los gastos domésticos, así como la educación de sus hijos. Por tanto desea continuar sembrando pero en grandes extensiones, además planea comprar más reses para poder engordarlos y venderlos en fechas festivas. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, se muestra entusiasmada el saber que continuará laborando con las personas más responsables en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, para que empiece a sembrar papa, que es lo que más produce en su zona.
texts.en:
Nilda is 29 years old and an honest industrious person. She lives in her own home with her partner Primitivo, age 30, and their three children who are her reason for living. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been growing different varieties of potatoes. She also raises animals such as bulls, sheep, and pigs. Nilda keeps the animals near the fields where she works so that she can keep watch of them. What she enjoys most is planting potato seedlings. In order to give them enough space to develop, she must dig furrows and overturn large amounts of soil to keep the seedlings covered until they mature. Known for her enthusiasm, Nilda is confident that farming is a profitable endeavor. With her earnings, she plans to buy more farmland so that she can cover her household expenses and pay for her children’s education. She wants to continue farming, but on larger tracts of land. Nilda also plans to buy more cattle for fattening so that she can sell them on holidays.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Nilda is delighted to know that she will continue working with the other responsible members of her Communal Bank. The loan she requested will be used to buy several bags of compost so that she can begin planting potatoes, the crop that is most produced in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Clavelina Estherlia

texts.es:
Clavelina Estherlia N. M., tiene 41 años.  Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos,  en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos,  Washintong  y Johana.
 
Clavelina es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Clavelina  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra cacao y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Echeandia y vende la misma localidad y los alrededores.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de  cacao y maíz para sembrar y vender. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio e incrementar los ingresos. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y las plagas y enfermedades que afectan los cultivos.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Clavelina Estherlia N. M. is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. She has two children, Washington and Johana. Clavelina is a member of the communal group 'Y', which is located 1 1/2 hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are seeking from la Cooperativa San José. Clavelina works in agriculture, producing cocoa and maize. She makes her purchases in Echeandia each month and sells in the same place, and around the area. She is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of cocoa and maize to sow and sell. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to move forward. Her dreams are to have her own business and increase her earnings. Preventing her from achieving her goals is the lack of money and the plagues and diseases that affect the crops. Clavelina likes to working in the countryside.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cocoa and maize to sow and sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es casada y tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando, Nancy tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huarakaq que significa Abundancia en quechua, lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Nancy solicita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, verduras y azúcar.
Los sueños de Nancy son mejorar su negocio, ser mayorista y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy is married and has three children enrolled in school. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. Nancy manages her business every day.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Muchuy Huarakaq”, which means “Abundance” in Quechua. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is having the incentive to save. Nancy is requesting a loan of 2100 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice, vegetables, and sugar.

Her dreams include improving her business, becoming a wholesaler, and helping her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, vegetables, and sugar

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Yguazu Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Unidas de Yguazú”.  Están  en el Quinto Ciclo, con 12  integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y comprometido con sus responsabilidades. 
Cada integrante de este comité tiene una actividad dependiendo de las facilidades con cuentan en sus correos.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elena quien tiene un bar donde vende comestibles, y bebidas.
La señora Elena todos los días se levanta muy temprano para elaborar sus comestibles y de esa manera tener todo listo muy temprano para los clientes, quienes concurren en gran cantidad al negocio por la calidad de sus productos y por la buena atención que reciben de ella.
Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y desea invertir en la actividad especialmente en la compra de ingredientes que ella utiliza y también para la compra de bebidas.
texts.en:
The loan group is called “Mujeres Unidas de Yguazú” (“United Women of Yguazú”). It is in its fifth cycle and it has 12 members. The group stands out in the neighbourhood for being very active, supportive and responsible. The lines of business of all group members depend on the facilities they have available. Elena, one of the members, owns a pub where she sells food and drink. Every day Elena gets up very early to prepare the food and have everything ready for her customers first thing in the morning. They go to her pub in large numbers thanks to the quality of her products and her good customer service skills. She is very happy with her business and would like to invest in it, particularly in the purchase of the ingredients she uses as well as to buy drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, condiments, ingredients to make bread, oil, soda water, cigars, wines and beer.

loans.name: Las Doras (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la calle Avenida del Ejército de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal las Doras.
Este es un grupo de personas que ha pesar de que este es su primer ciclo es muy unido y  sus socias muy amistosas. Ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios,).

Aquí encontramos a la señora Marisol P.,  es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, ella tiene 40 años, esta divorciada  y tuvo 3 hijos en la actualidad mantiene una relación de unión libre. Nació en Junín pero a los 11 años se vino a vivir a Portoviejo, es maestra artesana en corte y confección y esta estudiando párvulo en la extensión de la Universidad de Guayaquil.

Tiene un negocio de Cabinas telefónicas y computadores con servicio de internet. Negocio en el que trabaja todos los días de 8am a 20h00, aquí le ayudan sus hijos a los cuales les paga un sueldo para que ellos tengan para sus estudios. El negocio lo tiene en su casa por lo cual se le facilita sus labores de ama de casa y de maestra ya que también da clases de tareas dirigidas. Dice que le va muy bien en su negocio  ya que es el único en el sector.

Este crédito lo va emplear en construir un lugar adecuado para impartir sus clases. Es su primer ciclo en el Banco y esta muy contenta, le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir el crédito.
 
Sus metas son seguir en su negocio y seguir impartiendo sus clases para bienestar de su comunidad.
texts.en:
The Las Doras loan group meets every fortnight in the Avenida del Ejército street in the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Manabi province which has been known for many years as the city of the Tamarind Kings. The group is very close and its members are very friendly, even though it is only in its first cycle. The members work in different activities (retail, sales, manufacture and services). One of them is Marisol P., president of the loan group. She is 40 years old, divorced with three children, and she is currently in a relationship. She was born in Junín but at age 11 she moved to Portoviejo. She teaches tailoring and is studying at the University of Guayaquil extension. She owns a business which provides telephone booths and computers with internet access. She works every day from 8am to 8pm. Her sons help her, and she pays them a salary that supports them with their studies. The business is based in her house, which makes it possible for her to also do the housework and teach, as she also gives classes supervising homework. She says her business is doing well because it is the only one in the field. The loan will be used to build a suitable room where to teach her classes. This is her first cycle with the bank and she is very pleased; she likes the ease of getting credit. Her goals are to continue in business and to keep on teaching for the benefit of her community.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a classroom.

loans.name: Oktyabri

texts.en:
Oktyabri B. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and son in Hovd province in western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and takes care of their small son.

Since 2003 Oktyabri has been working in the construction industry. Since construction work is seasonal, he wants to drive a taxi. He is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his taxi business. Oktyabri dreams of saving money from his new business and purchasing his own property.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: La Bendicion 3 Group

texts.es: Doña Juana X. C. es una señora casada, tiene cinco hijos: tres hijas y dos hijos, doña Juana trata de apoyar económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos, actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace más de 10 años, doña Juana necesita surtir su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas de ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desde hace mas de 10 años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata de apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas de su aldea, el cual cada una de las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de frutas, crianza de animales, venta de alimentos, elaboración de canastas entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana X. C. is married and has five children, three daughters and two sons.  She tries to support her family and prepare a better future for her children.  She sells clothes for children and adults.  She has been in business for over 10 years.  She needs to stock the business to improve sales and profits.

For this reason she gathered together a few friends and neighbors that she’s known for over 10 years to form a group because she tries to help not only her family but other people in the village too.

Each of the women engages in a different activity, such as: fruit sales, small animal raising, food sales and basket weaving, among others.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Vantin

texts.en:
Mr. Vantin T. and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Norng, have been married since 1996 and have three children:  two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and another one is still young and stays at home. The family lives along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vantin is a motor taxi driver and he drives in Phnom Penh City. His wife sells fish in the local market. Unfortunately, his motorbike is old and breaks often, so he spends a lot of money to repair it very often. 

Facing this, he decided to ask for his first loan of $800. He will use the loan to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

Mr. Vantin T., his wife and their young son are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike to continue his motor taxi business.

loans.name: Rael Jepchumba

texts.en:
Rael is a 26-year-old mother of two children and married to Mr. S.. She runs a veterinary shop at the center and sells a variety of drugs to farmers. She has been in the business for three years now and has been making good profit.

She was introduced to Kadet Ltd. by a friend who is also a Kadet client. With this first loan, she plans to add stock to her shop so that she can meet the growing customer demand. 

Her future plan is to own a veterinary wholesale store and supply other veterinary shops at the center.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her veterinary shop

loans.name: Tania Maricela

texts.es:
La Señora. Tania V. es socia del banco comunal San José, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se encuentra a 18 km. de la ciudad de Cuenca, su principal actividad económica es la agricultura y cría de animales que en su mayoría es para su propio abastecimiento, tiene como atractivo turístico el cerro Mama Tepal el cual es un mirador natural y se puede observar la ciudad de Cuenca y parte de la ciudad de Azogues.

La Señora. Tania es una socia muy joven de la banca comunal, tiene 20 años, es casada y tiene una hija de un año y seis meses de edad, su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven por el momento en casa de sus suegros.
 
Doña Tania labora en un Centro de Formación Infantil, actividad que desempeña hace un año y siete meses, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de unos cerdos para iniciar con este negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Tania V. is a member of the San José communal bank. She lives in Ingapirca, in the Santa Ana parish. This parish is located 18km. from the city of Cuenca. The basic economic activities there are farming and raising animals which are mainly used for personal supplies. There is a tourist attraction called the Mama Tepal hill. The hill is a natural viewpoint and you can see the city of Cuenca and part of the city of Azogues from there.

Tania is a very young member of the communal bank. She is 20 years old. She is married and she has a one and half year old daughter. Her husband works as a construction worker. They do not have their own home. For now, they live with the in-laws.

Tania works in a preschool center. She has held this position for a year and a half. She works Monday to Friday, from eight in the morning until four in the afternoon.

This is her third loan with the communal bank. Her new loan will be used to invest in the purchase of some pigs to start a business. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Carlos Raul

texts.pt:
Carlos Raul C. nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane tem 33 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 4, 7 e 10 anos, os dois mais velhos e que vão a escola. Fez 12ª classe não concluiu devido a distância que o separa a faculdade. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e responsabiliza se pela sua mae que vive em inhambane enviando lhe 1.000.00mt por mês para despesas de casa..

Sai de Inhamabane para o Distrito de Namaacha no tempo da guerra, apos a sua chegada ele trabalha em casa das Irmãs Missionarias de Maria durante 3 anos, como criador de frangos. Mas porque o emprego não lhe dava tempo de continuar com os estudos, abandona o emprego e engressa a Escola onde faz a 12ª classe, de seguida começa a trabalhar nas TDM como servente, auferindo mensalmente 5.700.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda do seu negocio ele consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o quarto empréstimo de Carlos na Hluvuku  e terceiro com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, rede, barrotes e outros) para ampliação da sua capoeira. Os anteriores de (15.500.00 14.000.00 e 34.000.00) forao para compra e criaçao de pintos. 

Esta seguro que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado pois para elêm dos suas  actividades conta também com ajuda da sua esposa que e  Docente.
texts.en:
Carlos Raul C. was born in Inhambane Province. He is 33 years old, married, and the father of three children, 4, 7, and 10 in age. The two eldest children attend school. He went to school up to 12th grade but didn't finish because he lived too far away. He owns his own house and lives there with his family. He is also economically responsible for his mother, who lives in Inhambane, sending her 1000 meticals a month for household expenses.

He left Inhambane for Namaacha during the war, where he worked for the Irmãs Missionarias de Maria (Missionary Sisters of Maria) for three years raising chickens. But because his work kept him too busy to continue his studies, he quit the job and returned to school, which he attended up to 12th grade. He then started working for the Mozambique Telecommunications Company (TDM), earning 5700 meticals a month, which he uses for household expenses. Thanks to his business he is even able to save a little money in his bank account.

Carlos has never had loans from other banks. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku and his third with Kiva, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he plans to use to purchase construction material (cement, sheet metal, mesh, joists, etc.) to expand his chicken coop. His previous loans (for 15,500, 14,000, and 34,000 meticals) were to buy and raise chicks.

He intends to pay back this loan back ahead of schedule, since besides his two incomes he can also rely on help from his wife, who is a teacher.

loans.use: Purchase construction material (cement, sheet metal, mesh, joists, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is the mother of one young child. She has almost five years of experience working as a make-up artist. Her business income is vitA. to help her husband with the family income especially to cover the child's expenses. She works from her home where she receives the clients. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase make-up tools and products. She has high hopes for the future of her business; she is looking to continue the expansion of her business in the coming year. In the future, she hopes to open a formA. beauty salon where she can receive the clients. 

Women continue to play an important role in Lebanese society, especially in the development of the family. Women are able to serve as strong role models for their children while also helping to supplement their household incomes. In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high.

loans.use: to purchase make-up tools and products

loans.name: Wycliff

texts.en:
Wycliff E. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Wycliff has a business of a grocery, which he has had for less than one year.         

To help expand his business, Wycliff has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more items for his store .  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Wycliff hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Wycliff hopes to see his children complete their studies.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in the town of Sto. Niño with her family. She earns a living through farming. She plants and harvests rice crops and raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market. Evelyn strives hard to improve her business and her earnings.

Evelyn is in need of seeds, fertilizers and other supplies for her farm. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es:
Ramón, de 49 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 28, 26 y 22 años de edad, todos trabajan y colaborar para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Ramón se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, esta actividad la aprendió desde muy joven cuando aún vivía con sus padres, no tiene horario fijo de trabajo y por el momento necesita del financiamiento de un préstamo para la compra de ganado.
Este préstamo le permitirá aumentar el número de ganado y continuar dedicándole tiempo y trabajo a las actividades agropecuarias. Ramón tiene como metas ampliar el negocio, aumentar su producción de ganado al igual que en la agricultura y estar al pendiente del bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Ramon is 49 years old and he lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife and their three children, aged 28, 26, and 22 years old. They all work and they contribute towards the household expenses. Ramon is an agriculturist and a farmer. He learned this trade since he was very young, when he still lived with his parents. He doesn’t have a fixed work schedule. He requires a loan to purchase cattle. 

This loan will help him increase the number of cattle in his herd and to continue to dedicate his time and work to his agricultural activities. Ramon's goals are to expand his business, increase the number of cattle in his herd and increase his agricultural production, and to be able to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent M. is a married lady. Her husband works with Kenya Power and Lightning Company, and they have two children aged 12 years old and 3 years old. Her business is located at Mukuru Kwa Njenga and she is served by Kitengela branch. 

She owns a general store known by the name Byfaith General shop in which she sells such things as sugar, wheat, flour, beverages, detergents, etc. She has been in this business for seven years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are other people in the area doing the same business as hers, so customers are not loyal as they have plenty of choices. 

However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to add stock to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand it to wholesale and open another shop. She also sees herself building a house for her family. She describes herself as business-minded and ambitious.

loans.use: to stock more sugar, flour, cereals and more

loans.name: Eni

texts.es: Eni, de 48 años, es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Paúl y Katia, a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Santa Ana (selva central peruana). Hace 26 años que se dedica a la docencia, enseñando a leer y escribir a niños menores que estudian en un colegio estatal. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con los niños, pues eso la relaja. Paralelo a su trabajo se dedica a la agricultura en donde siembra café, asimismo vende hielo al por mayor y menor, los cuales realiza gracias a las máquinas procesadoras que tiene. Esté negocio le brinda muchas ganancias en los meses de verano, donde hace mucho calor, llegando a vender varios kilos de hielo, obteniendo ganancias mínimas de S/. 100 nuevos soles. El servicio que hace es a los diferentes eventos sociales, como también a las tiendas, restaurantes y demás lugares donde se vende bebidas de toda variedad. La principal dificultad que tiene son los gastos de los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, a los que tiene que mandar pensiones mensuales, pues estudian en la ciudad de Huancayo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los milagros”, y este es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece todo el apoyo que le brindaron en todo estos años. Eni, comenzará la segunda cosecha de café en sus terrenos agrícolas; por ello con el dinero solicitado invertirá para pagar el salario de los peones que le aydurán en la cosecha, asimismo invertirá en reparar las máquinas que le sirven para hacer hielo.
texts.en:
Eni is 48 years old and a single mother who lives with her two children, Paúl y Katia, whom she educates and cares for.  They live in their own home in Santa Ana (central jungle of Peru).  For the past 26 years she has been teaching children to read and write in a public school.  What she enjoys most about her work is to be in touch with the children because it helps her to relax.

Aside from her work, she also raises coffee and has ice machines and sells ice in large and small quantities.  This business generates a good income for her, minimum of S/100 PEN, during the summer months, when the weather is very hot and she sells several kg of ice.  She services various social events, stores, restaurants, and places that sell different types of drinks.

Her biggest financial challenge is that of her children’s university studies.  She must send them monthly stipends because they study in Huancayo.  She is a member of the “Los Milagros” communal bank and this will be her seventh loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the support she has gotten over the years.

Eni is about to begin her second coffee harvest and is asking for this loan so that she can hire field hands to help with the harvest.  She will also use some of the money for maintenance of her ice machines.

loans.use: to pay for field hands

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres al Poder”, está en el cuarto ciclo con 17 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras.
Son humildes pero sacrificadas, no tienen en cuenta las dificultades que se les presenta cada día porque ellas buscan la superación laboral, por ellas mismas y sus familias, ellas dicen que la familia lo es todo, por eso se esmeran por salir adelante y con orgullo de ser honradas.
La sra. Graciela es la presidenta del comité y ella se dedica a la venta de comidas en un puesto que posee, desde allí trata de proveer de los mejores comestibles a las distintas personas que acuden a su negocio, es muy servicial y se preocupa mucho por la calidad de lo que ofrece.
Ella trata de ser amiga de sus clientes y no sólo comerciante, pues dice que todos podemos ser amigos, más allá del mero hecho de comprar y vender como desconocidos.
Esperando contar con la ayuda de Kiva, solicitan el crédito para comprar todos los materiales para incrementar sus micro-empresas, y la sra. Graciela lo solicita para adquirir panificados, carnes, legumbres, bebidas y otros comestibles necesarios para la preparacion de alimentos y posterior venta.
texts.en:
This committee is named “Mujeres al Poder” (Women of Power), which is starting its fourth loan cycle with 17 members. All of these women are responsible and hardworking. The members are humble, but have made sacrifices. They do not take into account the difficulties presented before them each day because they seek to excel in their work for themselves and their families. For them, family is everything so they seek to move forward with pride and honesty.

Sra. Graciela is the committee president. She sells food from a stand that she owns. There she tries to provide the best food products to the various people who come to her business. Graciela is very helpful and concerned about the quality of products that she offers. In addition, she tries to be a friend to her customers, not just a merchant. She says that everyone can become friends instead of buying and selling as strangers.

Hoping to receive assistance from Kiva, the members are requesting a loan to buy all of the supplies needed to expand their small businesses. Sra. Graciela will use the loan she requested to buy baked goods, meats, legumes, beverages, and other food products needed for preparing dishes to sell later.

loans.use: to purchase baked goods, meats, legumes, beverages, and other food products.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been in farming for five years in his native town of Kitale in Western Kenya. He is married, with 4 children between 12 and 2 years, three of whom are in school. He has one farmhand and produces milk, maize, beans and poultry, which all go to the local market.

David has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will improve his milk production and provide income for his children's education, as well as acting as their food supplement. He is focusing on only high yield dairy cows for better output in the future.

David adds that Juhudi loans have helped in uplifting small farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sérieux Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe SÉRIEUX sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA HAMEAU  un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus et de pagnes avec KARI, qui compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de MEDINE et effectue sa vente au  marché de BOUGOULA HAMEAU et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120.000FCFA, qu’elle utilisera  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et réinvestir dans les affaires.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The eight members of the group SÉRIEUX are all married, and they average 30 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in BOUGOULA HAMEAU, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These group members are on their fifth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans have all been repaid nicely.   This group of women does commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth) in the case of KARI, who intends to use her loan to buy 100 lengths of Wax pagnes. She gets her supplies at the main market of Medine. Accepting cash, she makes her sales at the BOUGOULA HAMEAU market and at the house. Her customer base is composed of women and men. KARI plans on making an average monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA that will be used for day-to-day family expenses and for reinvesting in the business. Her ambition is to increase her turnover, so as to satisfy her customers further.

loans.use: to buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Seydina  Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité Seydina Mohamed est créé depuis le 12 mai 2010. Il est composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même  quartier. Elles ont comme activités principales le petit commerce et l'embouche.

Madame Awa la responsable est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants mais a en charge deux autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en sari multicolore et a levé la main droite.

Elle mène une activité d'embouche et fait parallèlement de la restauration. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs d'activités. 

Awa s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire du village en moutons, aliments pour bétails et en tous les condiments nécessaires à la restauration. Elle revend ses moutons au même lieu après les avoir engraissés en trois ou six mois. La restauration marche beaucoup pendant les jours de marché hebdomadaire.

Avec son prêt elle souhaite augmenter son cheptel en achetant plus de moutons mais aussi de l'aliment pour les nourrir. Ceci lui permettra de faire plus de bénéfices. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille en nourriture et habillement et aider ainsi son mari. Elle compte à l'avenir acheter des bœufs pour l'embouche si elle parvient à obtenir toujours des financements de Caurie.
texts.en:
The Seydina Mohamed Solidarity group was created on the 12th May 2010.It is made up of eight women who live in the same neighbourhood. Their main activities are small businesses and the fattening of livestock.

Mrs Awa, the leader is 44 years old. She is married and mother to three children but also cares for two others who are entrusted to her by family and friends. In the photograph she is standing on the right, dressed in a multicoloured sari with her right hand raised.

She runs a livestock fattening business and at the same time does catering .She has a lot of experience in these activities.

Awa buys her stock of sheep, animal feed, and all the condiments necessary for her catering at the weekly market in the village. She resells her sheep at the same place having fattened them up for three or six months. The restaurant trade is much brisker on market days.

With her loan she wishes to increase her herd of livestock by purchasing more sheep but also more animal feed .This will enable her a make better profit.

Her profits enable her to pay for the family needs in food and clothing and thus help her husband. In the future she intends to purchase some oxen for fattening if she still manages to obtain loans from Caurie

loans.use: purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. Randy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & biscuits. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock for the store like sacks of rice. Randy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Randy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store like sacks of rice

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 33 years old and a hard working businesswoman. She is married and blessed with eight children. She has been selling small fish (omena) for the last two years. She expects to expand her business in the next five years and her dream is to be able to purchase a plot. She has requested 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more small fish (omena).

loans.use: To buy small fish (omena)

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El señor Luís es músico y también trabaja efectuando legalizaciones de documentos ante las autoridades correspondientes para el buffet de abogados para el que trabaja. De esta manera complementa sus ingresos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una guitarra eléctrica  para su grupo musical y así atender acontecimientos sociales por las noches y los fines de semana. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. Sus ganas de progresar profesionalmente y el flujo de caja analizado por nuestro oficial de créditos influyen en la aceptación que IMPRO ha dado a su solicitud de crédito.
texts.en:
Luís is a musician.  He also works preparing legal documentation, to be submitted to the corresponding authorities, for the lawyer's office he works for.  This is how he supplements his income.

Luís needs this loan to buy an electric guitar for his band.  This will enable him to work at social events in the evenings and at weekends.

Luís lives in his parents' home which is located in San Pedro district, in the city of La Paz.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the first time that he has requested a loan.  Luís' desire to make progress professionally and the cash flow analysis that our loan officer carried out on him meant that IMPRO accepted his loan request.

loans.use: to buy an electric guitar for his band

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Georgina;  tiene 52 años D. edad  y es casada la socia tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales todos ellos ya son independientes,  La socia se dedica a la atención D. su horno  pastelería, la socia tiene en casa un horno y a implementado su pastelería, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. pasteles, la socia tiene pensado comprar harina al por mayor ella compraría sacos D. harina, azúcar, huevos, mantequilla a granel al por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración D. pasteles y panes para el horno. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Georgina belongs to the “Illary III” Communal Bank in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Georgina is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom are independent. She operates a pastry oven in her own home and bakes pastries. Georgina wants to invest the loan in buying ingredients for pastry making. She is planning on buying flour, sugar, eggs, and butter in bulk at wholesale. The loan will be used for purchasing these baking ingredients.

Georgina appreciates and values the loan she hopes to receive, making possible an improved quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make pastry and bread in her oven to sell

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es: Mabel de 42 años vive con su hijo de 12 años en el municipio de Soledad donde se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en todas las líneas. Su principal mercado son los grandes confeccionistas a quienes les ofrece el servicio de maquila, mujeres a quienes les confecciona sobre sus medidas y almacenes y misceláneas. Mabel inició su negocio desde el año 2005, cuando después de haber trabajado en una confección, se retiró para emprender su propia aventura de negocios en un taller de confecciones, que ubicó en el sitio de su vivienda. Ella compró mediante 2 créditos las maquinarias de segunda mano, que pagó fabricando jeans, a quien se las vendió. Su negocio ha ido creciendo en su infraestructura y hoy tiene 7 máquinas, cuenta con 3 empleados y en temporadas en las que aumentan las ventas contrata dos más. Su sueño es independizar su espacio familiar del espacio productivo, para tener el tan anhelado sosiego, por eso su meta más adelante es tener un local con un punto comercial, donde pueda exhibir y vender los diseños que produce. Su mayor desafío es la selección de clientes que solicitan créditos a largo plazo y ella no tiene las condiciones de capital para financiar totalmente su cartera. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos de confección, para producir ropa a clientes que requieren plazos mayores, pues viven las ciudades de Barranquilla y Montería y necesita sostener este mercado, conocido y muy rentable. Mientras Mabel trabaja para cumplir su sueño se esmera en manejar su negocio sosteniendo un margen de contribución no menor del 27% y una rentabilidad no inferior al 19%, que aspira a incrementar con su nueva inyección de capital de trabajo, porque sus compras la hará de contado y en mayor volumen que el  ya acostumbrado
texts.en: Mabel is 42 years old and she lives with her 12-year old son in the municipality of Soledad. She crafts all styles of clothing. Her primary market is the large wholesalers, offering them manufacturing services. A group of women who produce according to specifications and the products are destined for clothing, and general stores. Mabel started out her business in 2005 after having retired from her employment as a seamstress. She decided to take up her own business venture with a tailoring shop, set up in her house. With the help of 2 loans she bought second-hand sewing machines. She repaid the loans by producing jeans for those who sold her the machines. Her business has been increasing in infrastructure and today she has 7 sewing machines and 3 employees. During those seasons when there is an increase in sales she hires two other employees. Her dream is to separate her family living space from her business and production space in order to enjoy the peace she has wanted for so long. For this reason her long-term goal is to have a commercial store space where she will be able to exhibit and sell her designs. Her greatest challenge is approving clients who request long-term credit plans, as well as not having the capital funds hat she needs to complete finance her business. This is the reason why she requests a Kiva loan. It is the first loan she requests through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With her loan she will purchase materials and sewing products to produce articles of clothing for clients who require longer term credit plans. Her clients live in the city of Barranquilla and Monteria and she needs to sustain this market, as it is already well-known to her and it is very profitable. As Mabel works to accomplish her dreams she strives to maintain a contribution margin of no less than 27% and a profit margin no less than 19%. She aspires to increase her profit margin with this new injection of funds to her working capital. She will be able to make her purchases in cash and in larger quantities than usual.

loans.use: to purchase products and sewing materials to craft articles of clothing.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es muy visitada por la belleza de su centro colonial, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, la gran variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños.
 
Doña Ana tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos  en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora Ana labora en su propio negocio, ella tiene una tienda y bazar 6 años y labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de productos de primera necesidad y arículos de bazar, esos productos sirian: arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevos, detergentes, aceites, tarjetas , peluches, regalos, ropa, etc. para surtir más su negocio.
 
Su sueño es viajar a New York.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Bankito Progresista Communal Bank.  She lives in Cuenca, a city that many people visit for its beautiful colonial downtown area.  Four rivers run through the city; its people maintain local culture and traditions; and its great gastronomic variety captivates the palates of both locals and visitors.

Ana is 34 years old and married.  Her marriage has produced three children who are 13, 11, and 5 years old.  Her eldest son is in middle school and her two younger sons are in elementary school.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession and he works in his own garage.  They own the house they live in.

Ana works at her own business, a convenience store and stationary shop she has owned for six years.  She works Sunday to Sunday from seven in the morning to nine at night.

This is the fourth loan she is taking out with the communal bank and she will invest her loan in purchasing much-needed products such as rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, detergent, oil, cards, hair accessories, gifts, clothes, etc. and stationary items to better supply her store. 

Her dream is to visit New York.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, detergent, and other products

loans.name: Elda Mariana

texts.es: La Señora Elda Mariana se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 9 años en este negocio.  su negocio consiste en ofrecer una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes, sus compras las realiza en Managua en donde obtiene sus productos mucho más favorables,  es una mujer muy trabajadora y que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, sobresale por ser una buena madre. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, bolsos, toallas, sandalias, sabanas, cosméticos y ropa en general. Las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Elda Mariana sells general merchandise. She has had this business for more than 9 years. Her business consists of offering a wide variety of products to her customers. She makes her purchases in Managua, where she gets much better products. She is a very hardworking woman who is concerned with her family's wellbeing and she is an excellent mother. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as pants, bags, towels, sandals, sheets, cosmetics and clothing in general. She needs the income to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, bags, towels, sandals, cosmetics and clothing in general.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with five children. She is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. Lorna is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizer for the corn. 

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lorna hopes to see their children finish a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the corn

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin de 32 años, convive con Bernardina de 32 años, con quien tiene 02 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Él es un hombre dedicado, desde muy joven daba el servicio de transporte público, y que gracias a sus padres, lo ayudaron a comprar un vehículo y desde hace 7 años realiza esta actividad. Este negocio le esta generando buenas ganancias, ya que le pone todo el esfuerzo, se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana en busca de sus primeros clientes, entre ellos comerciantes que a esa hora se movilizan al mercado central. La labor que realiza es de constante movimiento, por ello debe procurar tomar todas las medidas para evitar cuelquier tipo de accidente. Actualmente su vehiculo, excedió el tiempo de servicio, por la que se requiere un nuevo permiso. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3000 soles, él abrirá una tienda de abarrotes, para así generar más ingresos ecnómicos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Edwin is 32 and lives with Bernardina, also 32, with whom he has two children. They live in their own house which is located in the Pichari district. He is very dedicated, having provided a public transport service since he was very young. Thanks to his parents, who helped him buy a vehicle, he has spent seven years working in this field. The business has generated a good income for him since he puts all of his effort into his work. He gets up at 4am to attend to his first customers, some of whom are stallholders who need to get to the central market at this hour. The work that he does means that he is constantly moving, so for that reason he needs to take many precautions to avoid accidents. Since his vehicle service date has expired, he now needs a new roadworthy certificate.  

This is Edwin's first loan with MFP and he promises to make his repayments on time. With these 3000 soles he will open a general store to generate more income for his home.

loans.use: to buy products to set up a store

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita tiene 48 años, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de los cuales tres son mayores e independientes, y solo tiene un niño de 7 años viviendo con ella en su casa propia. El trabajo de Lita consiste en la compra al por mayor de bebidas, para después venderlos al menudeo y ganando un porcentaje por cada venta. Ella realiza este trabajo por más de cinco años, y ahora cuenta con una fuente de soda pequeña en su casa, siendo su principal medio de ingresos para su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para hacer algunas otras cosas más, le va bien ya que tiene clientes en su cuadra y buscan siempre bebidas heladas. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera que le vaya bien como le fue la primera vez, además se mostró como socia muy responsable. Con el monto solicitado, comprará bebidas al por mayor para poder tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus fieles clientes.
