texts.en: Lita is 48 years old and a single mother of 4 children, 3 of which are adults and independent and only 1, a boy who 7 years old, lives with her in her own house. Lita's work involves the bulk purchase of drinks which she later sells retail to earn a percentage of each sale. She has been doing this work for more than 5 years and now has a small soda fountain in her house which is her major source of income for the household. What she likes about her work is that it gives her time to do a few other things. She is doing well as she has customers in her block who are always looking for cold drinks. This will be her second loan with MFP and so she hopes to do as well as with the first one, as she also demonstrated herself to be a responsible member. With the requested amount, she will buy drinks in bulk in order to be able to offer her loyal customers more variety.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Khayridin

texts.ru: Хайридин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет 8 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается скотоводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Khayridin lives in the Yavan district.  He is 36 years old, married and has eight children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock for future sale.  Khayridin is requesting this loan for the purchase of bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 34. She supports her husband by doing embroidery works. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month.

Her husband has a livestock business. He purchases goats and sheep in their young age, grows them up and sells to butchers and on Eid for profits.

Zubaida is the mother of a son; she is a good housewife and a very caring mother.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business; with the loan, he will buy goats and sheep in larger numbers and then sell them for profits after growing them up.

Her husband is an experienced person and has been in his business for many years. Zubaida is hopeful that after the loan investment, he will successfully be able to upgrade his business and increase his profits.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she has established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zubaida.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for an animal sales business.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr:
Akouwa est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un guide touristique. Elle a 3 enfants.  
Akouwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des articles de quincailleries dans une boutique.
Akouwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de quincailleries. 
Elle  prévoit assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouwa is a 42-year-old woman. She is married to a tour guide. She has three children.
Akouwa has worked as a retailer since 2007. She sells hardware items at a store.
Akouwa has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy hardware items.
She intends to ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: To buy hardware items.

loans.name: Kholboy

texts.ru: Холбой трудолюбивый, порядочный человек. Он отец пятерых детей. Жена помогает в бизнесе. Он владелец небольшого  земельного участка. На участке он выращивает сельхозкультуры. Земля приносит хороший доход, но и требует большого внимания и труда. Он хочет улучшить свои бытовые условия. На земле он в следующем году хочет вырастить урожай пшеницы, арбуза и кукурузы. Для этого следует хорошо подготовить землю к весеннему посеву. Он хочет получить займ для приобретения минеральных удобрений и ГСМ. Он надеется на помощь добрых людей и с нетерпением ждет одобрения займа. Он заранее благодарен за поддержку
texts.en: Kholboy is a hardworking and decent man. He is a father of five children. His wife helps him in this business. He is an owner of a small plot of land. On this plot he grows crops. The land gives good income, but also demands a lot of attention and labor. He wants to improve his living conditions. Next year he wants to grow crops of wheat, corn and watermelon. He needs to prepare the land well for the spring sowing. Kholboy wants to take out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and POL. He hopes for the help of kind people and is looking forward to the loan approval. Kholboy is thanking in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer and POL.

loans.name: Moushira

texts.en:
Moushira is a 27-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. In order to pay their children's education fees, Moushira and her husband strive to work really hard. And for that reason, Mourshira decided to start her own business. She opened her own clothing shop in 2008. Her husband has been also working in his own women's clothing store for the past ten years. 

Today, Moushira is looking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, in order to purchase the new winter collection of clothes. She notes that this will increase her business sales, especially during the holidays. In the future, she plans to open other branches in different areas.

loans.use: to purchase a new winter collection of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ndonguide Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09 juillet 2002. Il  est  constitué de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on 9th July 2002 and is made up of twelve women who live in the same district. Their main activity is trading.

Mariama, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is in charge of the group. She is 48 years old, single and mother to two children. She also has four other children who have been entrusted to her care by relatives.

She sells vegetables and has good experience in this domain since she has been doing it for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and develop her business more easily. The profits she makes will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (schooling etc.)

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 26 years old and is a married woman with three children ages 3, 8 and 9. Jocelyn's husband works as a farmer and as an ice cream vendor.

Jocelyn has been in the business of raising hogs for two years. Jocelyn works hard to support her husband in providing for their family's needs and sending her children to school. She plans to use her loan to purchase feeds, vitamins and school supplies.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to have a progressive business. She also has hopes for her three children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and school supplies.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 54 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.
Bernardita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. Bernardita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo and other groceries. 
Bernardita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable. Está casada con Víctor quien es militar en actividad, fruto de esa unión tienen 03 hijos de 20, 6 y 1 año de edad. Juntos habitan en su propia casa, que logró construir con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Milka es la venta de productos de belleza, que son adquiridos por catálogos son vendidos a amistades, siendo su casa el lugar para recibirlo y realizar la venta. Pues ahí tiene un salón de belleza, negocio que se inicio hace 6 meses con los primeros préstamos de MFP. Le gusta su negocio, pues éste rubro lo aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional. Ahora genera sus propios ingresos económicos, y por lo tanto tiene deseos de ampliar su salón de belleza para poder atender a más personas y darles una mejor comodidad. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado comenta se siente cómodo con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas responsables y amables. Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para implementar su salón de belleza como tintes, cosméticos y otros.
texts.en:
Milka, 44, is a hard-working, determined woman who is very cheerful and kind.  She is married to Víctor who is in the military services.  They have three children, ages 20, 6 and 1, and live in their own house which they worked hard to build.  Milka sells beauty products which she acquires by catalogue.  She sells them to her friends and works from home where she sells her products.  She also has a beauty salon which she set up six months ago with her first loans through MFP.  She enjoys her trade which she learned at the vocational education center.  She now has her own income and wants to expand her salon to be able to attend to more customers and provide them with more comfortable services.  

This is her second loan through MFP and she is counting on it to help her reach her goals.  She is comfortable in her communal bank because she feels all the members are responsible, kind people.  She plans to use the 600 PEN loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as hair color, cosmetics and other items.

loans.use: To buy hair color, cosmetics and manicure products.

loans.name: Jesus Lionel

texts.es:
Jesús es un hombre de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Jesús pudo estudiar la carrera de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos  momentos con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Jesús trabaja como profesor de matemáticas particular, él cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, donde dicta clases a sus alumnos, así también, en las noches vende frituras, tales como hamburguesas, pollo broaster, salchipapas y otros, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree  que le va bien por su paciencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jesús se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mesas y sillas; de esta manera Jesús tendrá su hogar mejor acondicionado para poder seguir dictando clases a sus alumnos, así pues Jesús seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus metas y su gran sueño de terminar de construir su vivienda y ver a sus pequeños convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 29 year old man who lives in the city of Pisco with his wife and his two small children, who he loves and considers to be his primary reason for living.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, dedicates all their efforts to helping their family to get ahead in life. Thanks to his hard work Jesús was able to study at a university in the field of education.  In his free time, he likes to share quality time with his family.

By his own initiative, and with a great deal of dedication and hard work, Jesús works each day as a teacher of mathematics.  He has a small space in his house where he gives classes to his students, and at nights he also sells fried snacks in the evenings, like hamburgers, roasted chicken, salchipapas (hot dogs and fries), and other snacks.  He enjoys his work and thinks that it's going well thanks to his patience and the goodwill that he shares with everyone.

Jesús  is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy tables and chairs.  With this, Jesús will have a house that is better suited to continuing to have classes for his students. Jesús will continue working and making an effort to achieve his goals, and his greatest dream is to finish construction on his house and see his little ones grow up to have an education and good careers.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a smallholder farmer residing in Eldoret, an agricultural town in the North Rift region of Kenya. She is arguably among the most successful client of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. Tomatoes are Evaline’s flagship produce. She sells more than 40 Kgs of tomatoes every day.

Back in 2000, Evaline practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. She was doing only half an acre of maize crop per season. The returns were so meager that she could barely fend for survival. She kept doing maize farming for years without turning a profit until 2013, when she switched to tomato farming and there was light at the end of the tunnel for Evaline. 

Today, Evaline is a fully-fledged entrepreneur. She has been provided with technical guidance, training programs and exposure visits. She has already serviced other asset-based loans fully from Juhudi Kilimo! Through the loans, she has acquired high quality dairy cows, farm implements and fertilizers. She has employed one permanent staff from the village to help run her agribusiness. 

To capitalize more on returns from the booming tomato farming, Evaline is seeking a loan of KES 130,000 to build another greenhouse. Unlike his competition, Evaline conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high quality produce. By doing this, she has created a name for herself and a demand for her produce. 

Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of Evaline’s goal, which is to expand the greenhouse. In the future, she is also planning to introduce zero grazing method, intensify her maize farming, and start value addition.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Julian Alexander

texts.es:
Julián es un joven de 20 años de edad, emprendedor, soñador, trabajador, una persona que se dedica a la venta de vasijas, actividad que inicio su negocio con el ánimo de ayudar a su madre en los gastos del hogar y de construir un futuro prometedor.
Su propósito es mejorar en ventas, crecer como empresario, ser útil en su casa y junto con su madre salir adelante.
Julián quiere solicitar un préstamo para crecer en inventario de productos, su propósito es comprar vasijas de porcelana, insumos y materiales para pintarlas y vender productos personalizados.

If you want to know more about our entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join our group called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia” where you can get more information and help from our advisors: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

loans.use: comprar vasijas de porcelana, insumos y materiales para pintarlas y vender productos personalizados.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a very hard working lady and it’s from this that she has managed to educate her 5 children to college level. She earns her income from selling vegetables and milk from her farm. She has a diary cow, dairy goats and a banana plantation. She gets about $71 per month from all her business activities. She has a small piece of land but she utilizes it to the optimum. With improved seeds and food supplements for the cows, she is sure that her productivity will increase and thus, increase income will be realized in a short while.

loans.use: Salome wants to buy dairy meal, improved seeds and agrochemicals

loans.name: Semerder

texts.en: Semerder M. owns a small local market in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Semeder is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and quality of products he supplies to his customers.

loans.use: Purchase better and different inventory for store.

loans.name: Pulega

texts.en: Pulega is a mother of three who started her own pineapple plantation. When she was younger, she worked happily on her family's farm, which is what led her to start her own plantation. She now sells the pineapples she grows to earn a living for her family. Pulega also enjoys her work as she follows in her father's and mother's footsteps.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita is married and has three children who are all married. Her husband works as an electrician and a metalworker, and his income varies greatly. So, Benita needed to help him with their household income. She wanted to do something she already knew how to do; she saw that in her local market, no one sold hamburgers and in order to find them, one had to travel quite a long way away. And so, she began to sell hamburgers from her home, and with time saw her business grow. Now she has many customers and her own stock is not enough to keep up with demand.

In order to meet demand, Benita is applying for a loan of $200.00 so that she can purchase a hamburger stand that she has seen is being sold and with the stand prepare and sell her hamburgers in a more timely manner. She will repay the loan in 3 months and she thanks you very much for your help which she needs to see her business continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Benita esta casada y tiene tres hijo que están casados, su esposo trabaja como electricista y albañil por lo que sus ingresos son muy variables y ella tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlo en traer ingresos a su hogar, por ello ella viéndose en la necesidad de poner ago que ella sepa hacer, vio el mercado en el que se encontraba y nadie por su casa vendía hamburguesas y tenían que ir lejos para poder conseguir estas, así que ella empezó vendiendo en su casa, con el tiempo le fue bien y ahora ya tiene muchos clientes y ya no le basta con las que puede preparar en su hogar.

Por ello, Benita solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder comprar un carrito de hamburguesas usado que le están ofreciendo y así poder prepararlas ahí de la manera adecuada y más rápida, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindes para poder hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Othman

texts.es:
For eight years I have had a small shop in Comayaguela where I sell used clothing. Many people can't afford to buy new clothing and they come to me instead since they know I keep my prices low. The money I earn from this business lets me support my family and see to it that my two children can finish school.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, tengo una pequeña tienda en la ciudad de Comayaguela, este negocio lo tengo hace 8 años. Tengo muy buenos clientes porque tengo buenos precios ya que hay muchas personas que no se pueden comprar ropa nueva. Con este negocio mantengo a mi familia y ayudo amis hijos para que terminen sus estudios.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace K. is married with a family of three children — all girls, aged nine, seven and three years. Peace is selling timber and has four years of experience. She started the  business as a result of insufficient funds raised by her husband, who is a driver. Timber selling has been a challenge to many due to the marketing; nevertheless, Peace has marketing skills. Peace at the moment has potential clients who buy timber for construction and many other uses. She would like to borrow $1,100 to stock more timber that will help meet the demands of clients and at the same time help expand her business through savings.

loans.use: Purchase of timber stock

loans.name: Sina Uelese

texts.en: Sina is a 52-year-old lady who is married with five children. She is very glad to have joined SPBD’s loan program as it has helped her develop her farm which provides the income for her family. She has been in the program for a long time, and this is the largest available loan to members. This is her sixth loan, and it will be used to expand her farm and for home improvement. The farm is already quite big and helps her family meet financial commitments. She hopes to stay in the loan program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her farm and make home improvements

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba A. lives in Khijand; she is married and has a child. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007, and she recommended herself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Loan sums are permanently increased to those that show business stability and an income increase. She is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mrs. A. has a business in fruit selling (bananas, pears, apples, etc). She has a straight supplier that allows her to work with clients of different income levels. She is very polite, which is why she has repeat customers. Nasiba A. is very experienced in the business, but she has stiff competition in the sector, which is why she wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. Now Mrs. Nasiba A. requests a loan of 1,400 TJS (US$425) for business development and to widen her assortment by purchasing new goods.

loans.use: to wide the existing assortment

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo lives with his mother in his own house in La Paz. His activity involves making sombreros (hats) for children and adults. He is also starting to make suits and jackets. He is seeking a loan to purchase a sewing machine and more raw materials for his products.

His previous history qualifies him as a good loan candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gerardo vive en casa propia con su mama en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona Tiwiña de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la confección de sombreros de niños y adultos, también está empezando a elaborar trajes, chamarras etc. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina de coser y comprar más material para la confección de trajes y chamarras, así como también sombreros. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine, material, thread, etc.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
I am the group leader of three women: Rabia B. runs a beauty parlor. Parween B. will invest her share of our loan in her family’s vegetable business. Asiah B. operates a boutique. These women are my neighbors and we have been together for a very long time.

I was born in a small town, Vehari, but moved to a mid-size town, Multan, after my marriage. I have two kids: one boy and one girl. My son is seven years old and attends kindergarten and my daughter is three years old and will begin school next year. I want to start a beauty parlor and I need a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: Start up a beauty salon

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan E. and his wife have been married for over twenty years. They have four children—three sons and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives in the family home. Two of their sons are construction workers and the youngest is in school. The family lives in Mekong River’s Island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. E. has been a Khmer traditional musician for over twenty years. Besides playing traditional music he also drives a motor taxi. His wife farms.

Mr. E. is requesting a loan for the first time. He is asking for $1000 to help fund the building of a house for his daughter.

loans.use: To help fund the building of a house for his daughter

loans.name: Olguita

texts.es:
Mrs. Olguita R. Y. is a member of the "Vision 2000" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region of the Picota province in the district of St. Hilarion. She provides good customer care with a variety of foods. The need to provide better education for her children prompted her to start a business of preparing meals in her small home. Thanks toher perseverance, she has achieved her goal. With the loan of $750.00 to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy non-perishable items like sugar, rice, a variety of soft drinks, and preserves, vegetables, meats, and fruits for the preparation of various dishes that she offers daily to her customers . Olguita, who is 35 years old, is a very enthusiastic and cheerful woman and she longs to have a bigger and better equipped restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Olguita R. Y., es socia del Banco Comunal “Visiòn 2000”, vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, brinda a sus clientes una buena atención con variedades de comidas. La necesidad de dar una mejor educación a sus hijos la impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio de la preparación de comida tipo menú en un pequeño ambiente de su casa, gracias a su perseverancia, ha logrado lo que tiene como meta . Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 a ser pagados en 6 meses, comprará los insumos no perecibles como azúcar, arroz, menestras gaseosas de diferentes marcas y sabores, conservas, verduras, carnes, frutas para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su basta clientela. Olguita, es una muy mujer entusiasta y alegre con 35 años, que anhela tener un restaurante mas grande y mejor implementado .

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Cộng, 52, participates in TYM fund since 2003. Her husband passed away so she had to take care of her 4 children by herself. She was relying on her husband's salary but since his death, life has become very difficult for her financially. Her children attend higher education so the expenses are high. She was determined to provide a good education to her children no matter what so she has contracted a loan to open a small farm supply store selling fertilizer. Her life slowly becomes easier with time, 3 of her children have graduated from university and they all have a steady job. Today, Mrs Cộng is still getting loans from TYM to get her youngest child through university. Lately people start farming a lot so her business has picked up. She needs to replenish her inventory so she is requesting 825 USD. Her income is 180 USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Cộng, 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Chồng mất, gia đình chị Cộng chỉ còn 5 mẹ con. Trước đây việc nuôi con ăn học đều nhờ lương chồng nên cũng thuận lợi. Sau khi anh qua đời, cuộc sống trở nên vất vả đối với chị Cộng vì các con đều học cao, chi phí lớn. Với nỗ lực vượt qua mọi khó khăn vì tương lai các con, chị vay vốn mở một chiếc quán nhỏ bán đạm lân và thuốc sâu. Cuộc sống dần trở nên ổn định, đến nay 3 con của chị đã tốt nghiệp đại học, cao đẳng và có công ăn việc làm tử tế. Hiện nay chị Cộng vẫn tiếp tục vay vốn kinh doanh để lo cho người con út ăn học. Vào thời điểm này lúa đang làm đòng cần nhiều phân bón nên chị Cộng đề nghị xin vay 825USD lấy thêm hàng về phục vụ nhân dân. Thu nhập hiện nay của chị là 180USD.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Hem Leng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hem L. is the group leader I. this small group I. Soben Village I. Kampong Chhnang Province. She is currently I. the business of Khmer noodle selling. Her husband is a motorbike-taxi driver who can generate only a small income to support the family. Mrs Hem L. is 41 and the mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled I. school. Mrs Hem L. and the family members are now I. poor conditions and they live I. an old house. Mrs Hem L. is requesting a loan to increase her profit to build a new house to replace the old one.

Previously, Mrs Hem L. obtained a loan to expand her Khmer noodle business. She will share this loan with her group members.

loans.use: To increase her profit in order to build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Affi

texts.fr:
Agée de 53 ans, madame A. Affi est une femme veuve avec à sa charge 04 enfants. Elle est née à Lomé, y a grandi et y vit actuellement. C’est une brave femme qui se bat pour élever convenablement ses enfants en leur assurant une éducation adéquate. Elle y arrive grâce à son activité, qu’est vente de pagnes et de produits cosmétiques qu’elle a commencé depuis 1995.

Elle achète les marchandises au grand marché de Lomé en gros qu’elle revend dans son quartier. Elle attire sa clientèle par les prix concurrentiels de ses produits. Elle baisse sa marge bénéficiaire et vend en masse. Cette façon de procéder fait qu’elle augmente sans cesse son capital. C’est ainsi qu’elle demande ce deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Affi A., 53, is a widow who is raising 4 children. She was born in Lomé, grew up there, and lives there at present. She is a well-respected woman who is fighting to raise her children appropriately and assure an adequate education for them. She manages to do this thanks to the business of selling lengths of African print cloth (pagnes) and cosmetics which she has been pursuing since 1995.

Mrs. A. buys her merchandise wholesale in the big open-air market in Lomé and resells it in her neighborhood. The competitive prices of her products attract customers. She lowers her profit margin and sells larger quantities. This procedure has allowed her to continually grow her business capital. Thus she is presently requesting her second loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes" and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Yeom

texts.en: Mrs. Yeom L. was born in 1947 and she now lives in Thmey Village in Kandal Province. She is a fisherman who now faces a problem with her business because she does not have enough fishing equipment to gather her fish. In order to catch more fish, Mrs. Yeom L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat. She intends to use the rest of the loan to buy fish nets. Mrs. Yeom L. has two children one of whom assists Mrs. Yeom L.'s business while the other one is a labourer who makes a small income which he uses to help support the family.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria Natividad, tiene  una pequeña tienda de venta de productos de consumo básico, la heredo de su padre, quien tuvo este negocio por mas de 35 años.  Poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su negocio, con los pequeños préstamos que FAPE le ha dado.

Ella es madre soltera con una hija, y quiere darle lo mejor posible, en educación y salud.

Además los días sábados tiene una venta de comida,  de papas fritas y pollo. 

Ahora ella necesita un crédito un poco mayor  para comprar mas producto para su tienda, quiere comprar más verduras, frutas, mas aguas gaseosas, surtir mas con golosinas, algunos trastes de cocina también, quiere comprar ollas de barro, todo lo indispensable, ya que vive en una aldea muy alejada del municipio. 

Espero que me den estos préstamos ya que lo necesito mucho.
texts.en:
Maria Natividad owns a small shop, which sells basic food products. She inherited the shop from her father, who owned the business for over 35 years. Little by little she has grown the business with the loans FAPE has given her. She is a single mother with one daughter. She wants to give her daughter the best possible education and healthcare. Also, Saturdays she sells food, including fries and chicken. Now she needs a slightly larger loan to purchase more products for her store. She wants to buy more vegetables, fruit, soft drinks, sweets and kitchen utensils such as a clay pot. Everything is necessary as she lives in a village very far from the capital. She hopes that you will give her the loan because she needs it very much.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to supply her store as well as a clay pot.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Selina K. from Mwanza. Married with seven children between the ages of 7 and 30, she is also responsible for supporting two dependents who are orphans. Selina, who has been running a beer business since 2002, works 16 hours per day, 7 days per week, assisted by seven employees.

Currently earning about $500 per month. she is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more beers such as Balimi, Kilimanjaro, Safari Lager, Serengeti, Castle Lager, and soda. In the future, she plans to increase her stocks of beer. Selina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additioinal brands of beers and soda.

loans.name: Chan Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Thoeun V. is a villager in Prey Kla Tboung village in Takeo Province. She is a grocer. 

Her husband, Mr. Chuon Ra, is a farmer and owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 
On his plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests which hurt his crop, and he does not have enough money to hire laborers to support his field. 

Thus, Mrs. Chan Thoeun V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve her living conditions with this loan. 

She is a 27-year-old mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
A. Saodat first applied to the MicroInvest in 2007. She applied for a business development loan and, thanks to previous loans, she could open a trade outlet in the central bazaar. Mrs. A. Saodat lives in the B. Gafurov region but trades in Khujand local bazaar. She trades in fruits and has been engaged in this business for 20 years. She works with direct suppliers. She has repeat customers because she is a very polite and kind woman by nature.

Mrs. A. Saodat asks KIVA for a business development loan of 1200 STJ for 5 months to import fruits.

loans.use: Import fruit

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюда заёмщица с 2004 года.Она все эти годы хорошо без проблем погашала свои кредиты.Вначале своего бизнеса она продавала носки, но постепенно увеличив кредит она заменила ассортимент на детскую одежду.Мавлюда недавно стало бабушкой для третьего внучка.Она счастливая мать и бабушка в своей семье.Мавлюда с радостью получает свой очередной кредит для увеличения ассортимента детской обуви.Её фото во время выдачи.
texts.en:
Mavluda has been a borrower since 2004 and has always repaid her loans without a glitch. She started her business with selling socks and, by gradually increasing her credit, replaced her goods assortment with children’s clothing. Mavluda recently became a grandmother for the third time and is a happy mother and grandmother in her family. Mavluda would be pleased to obtain this loan in order to increase the assortment of children’s shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's shoes

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq (05) membres du groupe kolaban vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques  avec en moyenne 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers  des liens de voisinage dans le quartier rail ko de Diamarabougou et militaient toutes dans l’association traditionnelle. Elles font essentiellement les activités  d’achat et de vente des céréales, de poisson de savon et charbon de bois
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de plus en plus grandissant de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur 2ème prêt; après avoir bien remboursé le premier prêt.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 405 kg de poisson frais dont une partie est vendue frais et l’autre moitié frite et des sacs de charbon de bois. Elles se ravitaillent en poisson frais tous les jours au bord du fleuve Niger et au marché de Kirango. Tandis que le charbon de bois est vendu à domicile, le poisson est vendu frais en ambulant dans le quartier rail ko et frit en face de l’hôpital au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 41 250FCFA par mois utilisé généralement pour, rembourser les intérêts du prêt, la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants,  subvenir aux besoins familiaux et le  payement de la tontine. Elles ont pour ambition  d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Kolaban live for the most part in polygamous families and average 43 years of age and three children. They know one another through community ties in the Rail Ko district of Diamarabougou. They are all highly active in the traditional association and work essentially in buying and selling grain, fish, soap, and charcoal.

Concerned about satisfying their burgeoning customer base, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which they are on their second loan, the first one being repaid. The new loan will be use to buy: 405 kg of fresh fish (some of it sold fresh and half of it fried), sacks of onion, and charcoal. Supplies of fish are gotten every day on the banks of the Niger River and at the Kirango marketplace. While the charcoal is sold at home, the fish is sold fresh door-to-door in the Rail Ko district and is also sold fried across from the hospital. Cash is accepted, and sometimes credit, from customers composed of women and men.

The group members intend to realize an average profit of 41,250 francs CFA per month that will be used generally for paying the loan interest, covering the school costs for the children, providing for family needs, and making payments to the tontine (community revolving credit system). Their ambition is to have a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and charcoal

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy N. is a villager in Ta Pang Choeurng village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller. Her husband, Mr. Seim Mech, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he helps his wife’s business.

Since this couple's business is doing well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Channy N. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more coconuts; she would use the rest of the loan to fix her truck for her business to earn more income. She is a 30-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school. Her husband and son are shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts and  fix her truck

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia Boamah is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children: three females and four males. She says two of her children have completed university and two have completed senior high school, while the others are in basic school and learning a trade.

Her husband is a palm nut farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a family apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

Felicia produces palm oil out of palm nuts. She procures palm fruits from nearby farms to add to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. Felicia aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La señora Dominga vende ropa y perfumes, también tiene una maquina de coser donde realiza trabajo de costura, en estas ventas lleva cinco años, El cual inicio con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia para cubrir las necesidades. Tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez, tiene dos hijos ambos estudian, su esposo trabaja en la construcción. Con este quiere invertir en la compra de ropa, y cosmético para vender  a sus clientes. Con este inversión espera obtener buenas ganancias, captar clientes. Sus planes es poder apoyar a sus hijos, obtener mejores utilidades y poder hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Dominga has been selling clothes and perfumes for five years. She also has a sewing machine and works as a seamstress. She started her business in order to help support her family.

She is 34 and lives in the Enrique Bermúdez district. She has two children, both of whom are studying. Her husband works in construction.

She wants to invest the loan in clothes and perfumes to sell to her customers.

With the investment, she expects to get new customers and turn a profit.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Natividad es casada tiene 56 años, dos hijos de 29 y 30 años., ya están  son casados.
Natividad  hace doce años estudio manualidades en un centro especial y con el tiempo se puso a dictar clases y a confeccionar manualidades, se compro su maquina industrial, para poder terminar sus pedidos a tiempo.  
Necesita un crédito de 800 soles, para la compra de tela para sabanas.
Desde que esta en Finca ha a portado mucho a su vida, es un soporte para su negocio, aprendió la  camarería, el compañerismo y la solidaridad. 
El sueño de natividad es tener un taller de productividad de linia blanca.
texts.en:
Natividad is a partner of Bancomunal Sarita Colonia. She is married and is 56 years old. She has two kids, 29 and 30 years old who are already married. For twelve years Natividad studies handicrafts in a special center where she now gives classes and also makes her own handicrafts. She bought an industrial machine, so she can finish her orders on time. She needs a loan of 800 soles, in order to buy fabric for sheets. She has done well in life since she has been in Finca. It is a support for her business, and she has learned camaraderie, companionship and solidarity. Her dream is to have a workshop producing white linen.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Needs an 800 soles loan to buy fabric for sheets.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Contra La Pobreza Group

texts.en:
Lucia M. R. is a group coordinator for the group called “Mujeres Trabajando Contra La Pobreza,” which in English means Women Working Against Poverty. Lucia is the owner of a small convenience store, where she sells food items such as rice and oil to her community. This will be Lucia’s third loan with Kiva's partner Esperanza and she is hoping this one will improve her business as much as the first two did. Lucia has two grown children, one of whom lives with her and her husband, Gabriel M..

Lucia dreams of continual growth for her business and also continually learning skills through her business and her experience with Esperanza. She dreams that her grown children will have a good position in society and also be able to own their own businesses one day. Because of her faithfulness in repayment of her first two loans, Lucia has been able to receive more with this current loan. Lucia’s loan is for 15000 Dominican pesos (about $420).

On behalf of Lucia M. R., Mujeres Trabajando Contra La Pobreza and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Replenish supplies

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo tiene 51 años, está casado con la madre de sus 6 hijos; de los cuales, los 2 menores, aun están estudiando y viven con ellos. Durante 31 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado vacuno, aunque en algunos momentos tiene que priorizar sus labores en la chacra, no descuida del cuidado de sus animales, los cuales son su herramienta de trabajo, con los que brinda el servicio de arado a sus vecinos, cobrando entre 50 y 60 soles por chacra. Por esta razón, no se descuida de sembrar la avena, que es el alimento primordial de sus toros. Los meses de noviembre a enero son época donde se preparan las tierras temporales para la siembra, y es cuando Máximo y sus toros tienen mayor trabajo. El resto del año, se dedica a trabajar en sus propios cultivos, que finalmente comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Máximo está muy contento con los trabajos que viene realizando, ya que gracias a estas actividades pudo educar a cada uno de sus hijos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo demostró ser un cliente muy puntual en cada uno de sus pagos. Los dos mil soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de semillas de avena, para sembrarlas y alimentar a sus toros, con el resto del dinero comprará fertilizantes para el abonado de su chacra de papas.
texts.en:
Máximo is 51 years old and married to the mother of his six children, the youngest two of which are still in school and live with them. For the past 31 years he has made a living in agricultural and raising cattle. Although sometimes he had to prioritize his labors in the fields, he never neglected his animals, which are his working tools with which he provides plowing services to his neighbors at 50 to 60 soles per field. For this reason he never neglects to plants oats, which is the primary food for his cattle. Between November and January is the time when fields are prepared for planting, and it's when Máximo and his cattle have the majority of their work. He dedicates himself to his crops the remainder of the year and eventually sells them at the market in the city of Tarma. Máximo is very satisfied with the work he carries out, since thanks to these activities he was able to educate every one of his six children. This is his third loan with Kiva partner MFP and during this time he has shown himself to be very punctual with each of his payments. With the 2000 soles he's requesting, he plans to invest in the purchase of oat seeds to harvest and feed his cattle. He will purchase fertilizer to enrich his potato fields with the rest of the money.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional phone accessories and phone credits.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.pt:
Eduardo M. S. is 49 years old, married and the father of 4 children aged 8,10,12, and 14 years old. He is originally from Majacaze, but currently resides in Boane. Eduardo studied through the 6th grade and later was trained as a primary school teacher. He has held positions as a teacher, and at a development bank until it failed. 

Since then he has been working as a business man, primarily selling used clothes. He gets his products primarily from South Africa and sells them locally in Boane. This will be Eduardo's first loan with Hluvuku. He plans to use the loan to increase his stock and increase his profits. In the future he plans on taking out more loans to further build his business.

loans.use: purchase new and used clothing for retail

loans.name: Ubaid

texts.ru: Убайд Рачабов проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Убайд более 5 лет работал по своей специальности "шофером". В данный момент он занимается ремонтом автомашины. Этой услугой занимается более 7 лет. Кредит, просит для закупа автозапчастей.
texts.en:
Ubaid R. lives in the Yavan district. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. Ubaid had worked as a driver for over 5 years. Now, he is involved in auto repairs. He has been providing this service for over 7 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of auto parts.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts

loans.name: Гайбулло

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Гаффоров Гайбулло- молодой мужчина, ему 32 года. Женат, у него один ребенок .Гайбулло мастер по ремонту автомашин. Имеет цех на дому, где работает со своими учениками. Его услуга пользуется большим спросом, так как в районе таких мастеров к5ак он мало. Он получил у нас кредит и купил себе запчасти по оптовой цене. После сотрудничества с нами он не думает о проблеме с деньгами  и рекомендует нашу организацию всем.

loans.use: покупка автозапчастей

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel M. D. H. resiD. en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento D. Ahuachapán. Reina tiene 38 años D. edad, vive con su esposo Marco quien trabaja como motorista generando 200$ mensuales los cuales aporta a su casa para los gastos D. su familia, también viven con ellos, sus dos hijos D. 15 y 8 años D. edad  estudiantes. Reina ayuda a su esposo, ella posee un negocio D. venta D. ropa hace diez años; la mayoría D. sus ventas las hace D. forma ambulante ya que va a ofrecer todos sus productos en colonias y cantones D. todo Cojutepeque y sus alrededores, el destino del crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad Reina es para surtir su negocio comprando ropa al por mayor, la cual le dejara mayores márgenes D. ganancia.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel M. D. H. lives in Cojutepeque, municipality in the department of Ahuachapán. Reina is 38 years old, she lives with her husband Marco who works as a motorist earning 200$ monthly which are used for the family expenses. They have two children, 15 and 8, who live with them and go to school. Reina helps her husband with a clothing business she has owned for ten years. Most of her sales are by traveling to all the neighborhoods in Cojutepeque and its surroundings. The loan that Reina is now requesting will be used to purchase wholesale clothing, which will give her better profit margins.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale clothing

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La señora Epifania pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en Ccotos.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es socia fundadora,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para compra venta de pescado. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de redes para la pesca artesanal, también comprara pescado que lo vende en el mercado de Capachica.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Epifania belongs to the San Salvador Luminoso Comunal Bank, which is located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 41, married, and has six children. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She lives in Ccotos. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years. She is a founding member. With her initial loan for 300 PEN she bought fish. She is now asking for a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy fishing nets. She will also buy fish to sell in the Capachica market. Her biggest wish is to keep working in order to pay for her children’s education. She likes the savings and the simplicity of the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy nets and fish, etc.

loans.name: Marta Del Carmen

texts.es: Marta Del Carmen R. reside en Tejutla en el departamento de Chalatenango. Marta tiene 59 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos y abuela de dos nietos. En el barrio donde vive Marta ella es muy conocida en la zona se caracteriza por ser una persona amable y muy trabajadora, son quince años de experiencia al frente de su negocio el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco, una tienda donde ofrece variedad de productos de consumo y que ahora quiere surtir por medio del crédito que solicita.

loans.use: surtir su negocio

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
S. Ismoil is 26 years old. He is married with three children. Since he was a very young he has been in the business of raising and selling cattle which is why he has a lot of experience. It is necessary to point out that he has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by IMON International. This support has been in the form of a loan which he has used to purchase and raise young bulls in their locality. Today, Ismoil has once again come to IMON International for a loan which will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the young cattle

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza Q. is from the village of Sumalag, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Analiza is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a business, selling ready-to-wear items, and in the evening she grills a variety of meats to sell in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $112 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Analiza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Heydy

texts.es:
Heydy es una joven soltera de 23 años, es la mayor de todos sus hermanos y vive en la casa de sus padres.
Sus anhelos son de ser una profesional, por  lo que desde el año pasado empezó a estudiar la carrera técnica de secretariado ejecutivo en un instituto de su ciudad. Desde entonces cambio su labor agrícola por las aulas; pero los fines de semana, con el apoyo invalorable de su padre muy temprano por la mañana, ya está instalada en su chacra quitando las malezas y abonando sus plantas de café, que es el producto de su preferencia por ser muy rentable y le permiten acumular dinero rápidamente en las meses de mayo a julio.
 Mientras tanto, su madre la apoya con su la alimentación, por ello sus ganancias las comparte con sus padres y además ahorra para cubrir los gastos de su educación.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo demostró desprendimiento y entrega para su banco comunal, ya que se colabora redactando en el libro de actas de la junta directiva y apoya en los cobros a la tesorera. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y fungicidas para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Heydy is a single young woman who is 23 years of age. She is the oldest of all her siblings and lives at home with her parents.

Heydy hopes to become a professional. Last year she began studying for a technical degree at an executive secretarial school in the city. During the week, she transitions from farm work to her work in the classroom. On the weekends, Heydy provides invaluable support to her father. Early the morning, she establishes herself in the fields in order to pull weeds and fertilize the coffee plants. Coffee is the preferred crop because it is very profitable. A coffee farmer can accumulate money very quickly during the months of May through July. Meanwhile, her mother supports her by providing meals, so Heyde shares in the profits with her parents and also saves enough money to cover her educational expenses.

This is her second loan with MFP. During her time as a member, Heydy has demonstrated great generosity and dedication to her Communal Bank. She is in charge of taking minutes at all of the meetings and assisting the treasurer with the collection of receipts. The money she requested will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers and fungicides for her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & fungicides

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
A business-minded woman, Merly B. is from Tagbak, Antipolo, a gorgeous province of Rizal.  She has been running a sari-sari store (a convenience store) for over 10 years. She is also involved in retail Electronic Load (Smart, Sun and Globe Load). Merly is a mother of two children, married to Gregorio B., a Security Guard.

Merly's husband's income was insufficient to meet the needs of their family, so, Merly joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2000. She was given hope and opportunity to access capital, so she started her sari-sari store business. The business has been successful and provides them a good income. For her eighth loan, she is requesting Php 35,000 pesos as additional capital to purchase some stock and renovate her store.

She hopes that with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can achieve her dreams in life: sending her children to school until they find jobs, improving her business, and developing her sari-sari store into a Grocery Store. She now feels that her dreams are within reach.

loans.use: To purchase assorted goods.

loans.name: Joseph Kimani

texts.en:
Joseph Kimani W. owns “The Leatherman” where, for the last seventeen years, he has made and sold shoes to teachers, students and walk-ins. His business is in a busy area with minimal competition. His business challenge is lack of funds to buy leather and shoe soles.

Joseph is using the proceeds of his KES 80,000 loan to buy leather, shoe soles, and clothes so as to expand his business. His dream is to become a wholesaler of shoe soles and leather.

Joseph is married to a farmer and has six children ranging in age from eight to twenty-three years. He describes himself as humble, ambitious and generous.

loans.use: To buy leather, shoe soles and clothes

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is forty-seven years of age. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community popular with tourists in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the major occupation of the people is fishing. Lydia is a trader. She trades in provisions. She sells the provisions on a table top in the market square in her community. She procures her goods from Accra. Lydia has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 35 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 hijos: Yaquelin de 15, Katerin de 11, Arnol de 6, Maricielo de 4 y Alexander de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
La creciente demanda por las llamadas por celular, le han dado a Isabel la oportunidad para ejercer un trabajo con el que se siente cómoda. Ella trabaja todos los días ofreciendo llamadas a celular de forma ambulatoria, su llamativo chaleco verde y la alegría que tiene, han hecho que sea una de las más solicitadas y que su negocio marche muy bien.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y ayudarlos a comunicarse con las personas que desean, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día parada en espera de clientes, lo cual le es muy cansado y agotador. Para el futuro, anhela tener un local para su centro de llamadas y así podrá mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Isabel con MFP, en sus primeros créditos fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también; en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará un nuevo celular para así poder atender a más gente a la vez.
texts.en:
Isabel, 35, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her five children; Yaquelin is 15, Katerin is 11, Arnol is 6, Maricielo is 4, and Alexander is 2. They are the motivation for all of her efforts. The growing demand for cell phone calls gave Isabel the opportunity to do work she is comfortable with. She works everyday offering cell phone calls as a street vendor. Her eye-catching green vest and the joy that she has have made her one of the most popular, and her business is going very well. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers and helping them communicate with the people to whom they want to talk. She has been doing this for eight years. The most difficult part is having to stand all day waiting for customers, which is very tiring and grueling. In the future she wants to have a location for her call center. That way she would be able to improve her earnings. This is Isabel’s third loan with MFP. She was very punctual with her first loans, and she expects to do the same now as well. She is much loved in her communal bank because her happiness is contagious to the rest of the members. She will use the 500 PEN she is requesting to buy a new cell phone to be able to take care of more people at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cell phone

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 35 years of age and married, with three children. All of her children go to school. The family owns and resides in a two-roomed house where she stays with five people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but has no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, medication and feeding the family. Juliet owns a kiosk selling soft drinks in Namungoona and on average she receives 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over 20 years. She doesn’t incur transport costs because she buys from her place of work. Her main challenges are seasonality and thieves. She sells both retail and wholesale. She has been with MCDT for six years, and is servicing her twelfth loan. Juliet wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and mineral water and more boxes of fruits. She aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and to start going to manufacturers.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and mineral water and boxes of fruit.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Salah has been working as a blacksmith and as a taxi driver since 2002. Salah is an active man who does his best to improve his family's financiA. conditions. He decided to start working as a blacksmith because he had gained experience and likes it. As for his taxi, it allows him to increase his income and continue working after he is done with his work as a blacksmith.

He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase iron for his work and do some maintenance work on his car. This is his fourth loan and he has always paid on time. His previous loans allowed him to continually improve his work as a blacksmith, and also his financiA. situation.

Salah is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to have all the required tools. Salah decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job which allows him to set his own schedule and work as a taxi driver. In future, he plans to keep on improving his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase iron for his work and do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Los Aliados Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Aliados”  esta representado por el señor Percy Daniel y conformado por 13 miembros D. los cuales 2 son varones y 11 mujeres todos muy unidos y dinámicos. El señor Percy Daniel es casado y tiene dos pequeñas niñas y un niño por venir es una personan trabajadora y muy dedicada a sus familia, el trabaja como taxista las 24 horas del día, su esposa se dedica a la venta D. comida rápida en la puerta D. sus casa  vero debido a su condición deberá dejar el trabajo por un tiempo hasta que su bebe este mas fuerte, los niños ayudan a su mama todas las noches cuando hace realiza su actividad y su papa llega muy temprano en la mañana para llevarlos a la escuela y regresar a atrabajar descansando solo en las tardes ya que la mayor parte D. las ganancias son en horas D. la noche, Percy destinara su crédito a la reparación D. su vehiculo que es su fuente D. ingreso y el sustento D. su familia.  El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta y comercialización D. ropa, cosméticos, artesanías, abarrotes, aparatos electricota y al servicio D. costura y transporte. El destino del crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, unos comprarán más productos, otros comprarán víveres y el resto destina el  crédito a la reparación D. sus instrumentos D. trabajo. La mayor expectativa que tiene el grupo es poder tener unos negocios fructíferos donD. con su esfuerzo y dedicación puedan mejorar sus ingresos D. forma honesta y trabajadora para crecer darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. El banco no tiene mucha experiencia en créditos solidarios ya que es si primer ciclo pero por lo que demuestran en las reuniones son gente entusiasta y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group “Los Aliados” (The Allies) is led by Sr. Percy Daniel and consists of 13 members (2 men and 11 women) who are close-knit and dynamic.

Sr. Percy Daniel is married and has two young daughters and a son. He is a hardworking person who is very dedicated to his family. Percy works as a taxi driver on call 24 hours a day. His wife sells fast food at the door of their house. Because of her condition, she had to stop working temporarily until their baby got stronger. The children help their mother every night while she is running her business and their father is still out until the early morning hours. When he comes home in the mornings, Percy takes his kids to school and then comes home to rest. In the afternoon, he is back at work because the evening hours are when he generates most of his earnings. Percy will use his loan to repair his vehicle, since this is his source of income for supporting his family.

The other members are engaged in businesses involving clothing, cosmetics, handicrafts, groceries, electronic appliances, tailoring services, and transportation. The loan will be used as operating capital to buy more products. Others will buy provisions and the rest will use their loan to repair equipment used in their work. Most of the members expect to have successful businesses. Through their hard work and dedication, they will be able to improve their income in a honest manner and proviD. their families with a better quality of life. The group does not have much experience working with solidarity loans. They have started their first loan cycle and have demonstrated in their meetings that they are enthusiastic individuals who greatly desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for vehicle repairs

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
T. Leonard is a 54-year-old married lady operating a retail shop in Rukungiri. She has been in this kind of business for close to eight years now and she cites a lack of capital to expand her retail business as a major challenge she has had to come to bitter terms with.

In a week, Leonard anticipates she makes close to 49,000 shillings and highlights her good customer relationship skills as her major calling card. Her future plans are to expand into a wholesale business and also build a family house.

With a loan of 1 million shillings, Leonard says she will be able to drive to fruition her plan of expanding her shop into a wholesale business.

Leonard is an individual client of Pearl Microfinance although she has a man's name.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more items like sugar, oils, cereals, and so on

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn

loans.name: Joyce Palanas Group

texts.en:
Joyce P. is from the village of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years-old. Joyce is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Joyce is married and has one baby.  To make a living, Joyce owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Joyce has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Joyce joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joyce is requesting a first loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Mehrac

texts.en:
Mehrac was born in 1980, and he is married, with one child. Mehrac Aliyev and his little family live in Baku city. 

He has sold fruit and vegetables for 4 years. He is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fruit and vegetables to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Grecia Edith

texts.es:
Grecia Edith P. L. tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, Erika de 22 años y Fernando de 20 años. Ella vive son su marido y 2 hijos el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Grecia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios.

Se dedica a la crianza de pollos y también tiene otro trabajo por el fin de semana. Grecia compra sus pollos y las vitaminas que ellos necesitan en Bucay. Grecia solicita el crédito para la crianza de pollos. Su meta es incrementar más galpones para poner más pollos. Su mayor desafío es la competencia para vender el pollo: el problema es que en esta temporada hay demasiados pollos y por eso baja el precio.
texts.en:
Grecia Edith P. L. is 39 years old, married, and has two children, Erika (age 22) and Fernando (age 20). She lives with her husband and two children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. Grecia is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. There are 15 members in the group, most of whom have small businesses. Grecia raises chickens and also has another job on the weekends. She purchases her chickens and the vitamins they need in Bucay. Grecia is requesting a loan for raising her chickens. Her greatest challenge is the amount of competition selling chickens. Since there is a large supply of chickens available at the moment, prices are lower.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for raising chickens

loans.name: Nasra's Group

texts.en:
Nasra lives with her family in a three room house in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Her husband, M. S., has eight years of experience selling soft drinks in the community. Nasra has six children:  four sons and two daughters. Her two sons have jobs, one is a tailor and the other sells Punjabi food (Samosas) to children. Her other four children are still studying.

Nasra is a very skillful lady. She weaves carpets by order at home. She works hard to generate income for the family. She is also a very good mother, who takes care of her children and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. Nasra has successfully repaid three loans from Asasah. Now she is applying for the fourth time for a loan to invest in her husband's business so he can purchase required items for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase required items for soft drinks business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys K. M. is 54 years old. She is widowed and has two children, ages 28 and 19 years old. She describes herself as strict, polite and generous. She sells milk to the local people and schools. Her business is located within a residential area in Kakamega. She has been in this business for the last ten years and has one employee. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is lack of enough feed for the cows leading to low milk production. Nevertheless, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Gladys is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a grade cow that will produce enough milk for her to sell and make more income. In the future, she hopes to be the major supplier of fresh milk in her area.

loans.use: To buy a grade cow

loans.name: Dolores Concepción

texts.es: Dolores Concepción R. de 65 años de edad, posee su propio negocio el cual es una pequeña tienda, que se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación. Vive junto a su esposo el cual es una persona pensionada y junto a su nieto de 16 años de edad, el cual estudia educación media. Dolores vive junto a su familia, en Santa Tecla, su casa se encuentra sobre la calle principal, lo cual es muy bueno para su negocio debido a que puede estar a la vista de más persona y así vender más. Dolores comercializa productos de primera necesidad, como detergentes, pan y otros más, los cuales vende con sus vecinos y personas de la zona, también posee muchos clientes los cuales son motoristas del transporte público, los cuales transitan por el lugar, es por ello que Dolores desea poder aumentar su inventario, solicitando un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: golosinas, bebidas, pan, medicinas, detergentes y otros más. Ella es una señora muy responsable y amable, quien desea mucho poder salir adelante y obtener mayores beneficios de su negocio, haciendo crecer la tienda y contar con más productos y más clientes.
texts.en:
Dolores Concepción R., 65, has her own business of a small store located in her house. She lives with her husband who is retired and their 16 year old grandson, a high school student.
