Dolores lives with her family in Santa Tecla and her house in on the main street. This is very good for her business since many people see store and thus she is able to sell more. Dolores sells staples such as detergents, bread and other things. She sells to her neighbors and to other people from the area. She also has many customers who are public transport drivers who pass by her house. That is the reason Dolores wants to increase her merchandise, asking for a loan so that she can buy a bigger quantity of products such as candies, drinks, bread, medicine, detergents and more. She is a very responsible and friendly woman who wants to get ahead and have greater earnings from her business by enlarging the store and offering more items to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more staples

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Maria Lida

texts.es:
Maria Lida A. Y., tiene 50 años.  Es casada,  vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, Jesenia (26), Patricia (20), Carlos (25) y Jeny (13).
 
Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Maria  se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de café y maíz. Las compras las realizan cada vez que sale la cosecha en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y vende sus productos en la misma localidad y en los alrededores.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para incrementar la producción. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio y estable para mejorar su nivel de vida. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y las enfermedades de la plantación.

Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Maria Lida A. Y. is 50 years old. She is married, and lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas province of Los Ríos. She has 4 children: Jesenia (26), Patricia (20), Carlos (25) and Jeny (13). Maria is a member of the “Y” rural bank, located 1½ hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, who primarily work in agriculture. This is the first loan they are taking through Cooperativa San José. Maria dedicates herself to farming, specifically the planting of coffee and corn. She makes her harvest purchases in Guayaquil and Babahoyo, and also sells her products there and in neighboring communities. She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, so she can increase her production. She believes this credit is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own stable business, in order to improve her standard of living. The challenges she faces are lack of funds and diseases of her crops. She very much enjoys working.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of seeds to increase production.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia N. F.  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 20 años. Actividad que le ayudado en su economía familiar ya que es el único ingreso que ella tiene para mantener a su familia pues es madre soltera. Julia quiere comprar mas ropa para seguir mostrando en su local variedad, lo que vende es usado pero de marcas muy conocidas y buena calidad. Julia desea un préstamo para surtir su negocio y así generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Julia N. F. has been selling used clothing for 20 years. Since Julia is a single mother, this business has helped her household finances because it is the only source of income by which she is able to support her family. She wants to buy more clothing to display at her variety store. Even though the clothes she sells are used, they are from well-known brands and of good quality.

Julia needs a loan to restock her business so that she can generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Gabriela Ingrid

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven de 24 años es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella acaba de terminar de estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas, pero le falta realizar sus tesis y de esa manera tener su titulo a provisión nacional.

Gabriela vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, solo vive con su madre ya que el padre las abandono hace muchos años atrás, entonces la madre sola tuvo que sacar adelante a sus tres hijos entre ellos Gabriela, ella esta trabajado de Cajera en un Banco de la ciudad de Cochabamba, además viven en una casa en alquiler puesto que su casita está en construcción. El préstamo es destinado para la compra de material de construcción y de esa manera terminar de construir su casa, y de esta manera trasladarse a vivir a su nueva casa y dejar de pagar alquiler y esas más cómodos todos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es tener su titulo y luego hacer su maestría en finanzas y de esta manera ayudar a su madre en los gastos de la casa y que hermanos pequeños terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
24-year old Gabriela is single and doesn’t have any children. She has just finished a course in Business Administration but didn’t complete her thesis so doesn’t have the official qualification. She lives in Cochabamba with her mother--her father left them many years ago--so her mother had to raise her and her siblings alone. Gabriela works as a cashier in a bank in Cochabamba. The family lives in rented accommodation as their house is being built. The loan will be used to buy construction material so the house can be finished. Then they can move into their new home, stop paying rent, and all live more comfortably. Among Gabriela’s dreams and goals is the wish to become properly qualified and then take her master’s degree in finance. In this way she would be able to help her mother to pay the household expenses and her siblings to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es: Rosmeri, de 20 años es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. En la pequeña comunidad de Miraflores, Rosmeri ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por eso que ahora se dedica al cultivo de plátano y café, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado de la ciudad de la Merced, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que los medio de transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Rosmeri, who is 20, is a very simple and happy young woman. She lives in her parents' house and what she wishes for most is to get ahead in life. In the small community of Miraflores, Rosmeri has spent the greater part of her life. At a young age, she learned her family business and it is due to this that now she is dedicated to farming bananas and coffee, work that has provided her with the income necessary to support herself. Everything that she produces, she sells in the market in the city of Merced, which is where she obtains the greatest prices for her products. What she likes most about her job is sowing her land, which she does with much care. She has been doing this work for three years and considers transporting goods to market the most difficult part since the means of transportation are scarce in her area. With time, she wishes to buy new land with the goal of increasing production in mind. This is her third loan with MFP. She has been punctual with her payments and hopes to do the same now. In her community bank, she is very active and is well-liked by the rest of the members. With the 1,800 new "soles" requested, she will buy more fertilizer for her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 32 years old and married. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years.

Josephine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Heyddi Patricia

texts.es:
Heyddi de 25 años, es comerciante informal, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Desde pequeña ella le ayudo a su mama a recopilar el dinero de los artículos que ella vendía. Hace 7 años atrás después de haberse casado comenzó a vender artículos y productos de uso personal a sus vecinos y conocidos. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 14h00pm hasta las 17h30pm todos los días. Vende blusas desde $ 5.00, pantalones a $ 15.00 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, adornos de navidad para estar preparada para la temporada navideña y así asegurar las primeras ventas a sus conocidos. En el futuro quiere tener una boutique en una parte de su casa.
texts.en:
25-year-old Heyddi is an informal merchant.  She lives in Playas, a tourist destination in Ecuador known for its wide variety of seafood.

Since she was little, Heyddi helped her mom gather the money from the things she sold.  Seven years ago after she got married, Heyddi began selling clothes and personal products to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Since then, she has worked every day from 2PM to 5:30PM.  She sells blouses from $5, pants from $15, etc.

With this loan, Heyddi wants to buy clothes and Christmas decorations to be prepared for the holiday season and secure the first sales to her customers.  In the future, she wants to have a boutique in her house.

loans.use: Buying clothes and Christmas decorations for resale

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas O. is forty years old, married and has three school-aged children who all attend school. He has been practicing mixed farming for ten years in Kisii, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces maize, beans and sweet potatoes which are all sold locally. He also earns income from other employment. He says that his biggest challenges have been drought that affects his production and the high cost of animal feed.

Lukas has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to purchase a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of his milk will help him pay school fees for his children. He will also be able to get enough manure for his farm. In the future he would like to purchase more dairy cows to increase his milk production and enable him to sell milk on a large scale.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is 37 years old. Rosemarie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred Q. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods, and coffee in the local community. She also buys and sells shoes and sandals in all sizes. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Mildred joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Mildred from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is 52 years old. He is married and has five children who are between eighteen and twenty-five years old. All his children go to school. Juvenal sells beans, sorghum and has a retail shop with clothes for women. 

He has been in this business for twenty years and he decided to request this loan to buy more beans, sorghum and children’s clothes. He is committed to buying a motor vehicle from the profits of his business and he would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man and the father of three children. He is from Lebanon. He started working in the agriculture field 35 years ago and started his own business in 1980. He cultivates vegetables and olives. He delivers his harvest to a local agriculture market. He is the main income provider of his family but two of his children help him with the household expenses. One of the children is an employee and the other works as a blacksmith. Today he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase agriculture tools and supplies to increase his productivity and, therefore, his income. He works hard and hopes to reach a better level in his life by expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture tools and supplies

loans.name: Narcisa Del Rocio

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 25-year-old entrepreneur. She lives with her partner and 3 children in Playas, a well known tourist area in Ecuador. She started selling products door-to-door but she made only a small percentage on the products she sold. She knew that the people from her area had to go far to buy groceries so she used her first loans to buy a variety of products and then set up a small store at her house. Since then, she has been expanding her business step by step.

Narcisa works mostly alone in her store from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. Her partner has been a bricklayer since he was 13 years old but when he comes home after work, he helps her in the store. Narcisa does not experience any difficulties at her store at the moment, although they deal with some delinquency in the area. She hopes to expand her store in the future and to have a stable business. Narcisa plans to use her $1,000 loan to buy more merchandise for her store. She hopes to have her own house one day and to live happily with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret O. is 48 years old from Nyamasaria area in the outskirts of Kisumu town. She is a widow and has six children to care for.

Margaret has a business selling second hand clothes. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the first one. She needs money to buy more clothes to add to her stock. Her monthly income is KES 5,000 and she intends to use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to find a stable place for her business and see it expand.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José tiene 36 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de panadería. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, siempre se ha dedicado a este medio de vida ya que vive muy pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo pues desde pequeño empezó con este negocio ya que su familia era quien se hacía cargo del negocio, con el paso del tiempo es que logro obtener su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de harina, queso, mantequilla, azúcar, entre otros productos necesarios para la elaboración.
texts.en:
36-year old Pedro José runs a bakery. He’s owned this business for more than five years and has always made a living this way. What he bakes depends on what his customers ask for. 

Pedro is a hardworking person with two young children to support. Ever since he was young he has helped in a bakery as his parents also ran one. As time passed, he managed to obtain a bakery of his own. He is seeking a loan to buy flour, cheese, butter, sugar and other ingredients needed to make his products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Mansa

texts.fr: Madame  Mansa  est âgée  de  40 ans  et  a un enfant à charge.  Pour améliorer les conditions de  vie  de son  enfant, elle fait  le  commerce  de  produits d’alimentation générale.  Elle a commencé en  2009 et s’approvisionne  au  grand marché  de Lomé.   Elle  revend  les  produits sur la route La pampa à adidogomé. Elle  sollicite  un  prêt  pour acheter  12 cartons  de  tomates,   5 bidons  d’huile et  4  cartons  de  spaghettis.
texts.en: Ms. Mansa is 40 years old and has a dependent child. In order to improve her child’s life conditions, she sells general food products. She launched this business in 2009 and stocks up at the big market of Lomé. She resells her goods along the La Pampa route in Adidogomé. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase 12 boxes of tomatoes, five jugs of oil and four boxes of spaghetti.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Augusta. She is married and has 4 children aged 23, 19, 18 and 8. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her because she is her relative. 

In 2006, Augusta established her pharmacy business. She began her business after completing her training as a professional nurse. Augusta’s pharmacy is located in the outer parts of the city where medical facilities are very poor. This pharmacy serves a lot of villagers who live around Bo city. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Augusta has a good loan repayment history. She requires a loan in order to buy additional medical drugs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Augusta plans to establish her business in the heart of the city and help her husband educate their children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional medical drugs to resell

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
Organizar muy bien su negocio, ampliarlo y convertirlo en un gran almacén, es el sueño de María Isabel R. D. quien desde hace 10 años vende mercancía en su local, al mismo tiempo le ayuda a su esposo a la elaboración de fritos que distribuyen para diferentes cafeterías lo que les ha permitido tener mejores ingresos para su familia, aunque son largas las joranadas laborales, esta emprendedora lucha día a día para salir adelante. 

María Isabel necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía y aumentar la variedad de productos.
texts.en:
To organize her business well, to expand it and to turn it into a big store is the dream of María Isabel R. D., who has been selling merchandise from her premises for 10 years.  At the same time, she also helps her husband make fried food which they distribute to cafeterias.  This has enabled them to make good income for their family.  Although her workdays are long, this entrepreneur works hard every single day to get ahead.

María Isabel needs a loan to buy merchandise and increase the variety of products she sells.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Gloria Del Rosario

texts.es: Gloria Del Rosario de 45 años, vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en el barrio Maria Auxiliadora. Ella posee su negocio ubicado de manera ambulante, en donde vende ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y público en general. Tiene clientela pues tiene variedad de mercadería y siempre satisface a todas las personas que la visitan, estar a la orden del cliente es su lema. Gloria quiere ver crecer su negocio y es así como se decidió solicitar un crédito que le permita comprar más mercadería como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes, shorts y trajes de baño pues se acerca la temporada de verano. Gloria tiene muchos sueños y confía que su negocio le ayudara a salir adelante para así lograr una vida plena junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria Del Rosario is 45 years old and lives with her life partner and three children in Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood.  She owns a business which she does not run from a fixed location.  Gloria sells clothes for women, men, children and the general public.  She has customers because she offers a variety of merchandise and always satisfies everybody who visits her business.  To be at the customer's disposal is her motto.

Gloria would like to see her business grow and so she has decided to take out a loan which will allow her to buy more merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts and swimsuits since the summer season is approaching.  Gloria has many dreams and she is certain that her business will help her to get ahead so that she can enjoy a full life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts and swimsuits since the summer season is approaching

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy breads, sauces, meats and repair his cart

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.fr: Jean Baptiste N. R. est comptable, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il a 49 ans, il est marie, et il a 3 enfants entre 7 ans et 14 ans, et aussi 2 personnes en charge.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Jean Baptiste est ne a Bukavu, en RDC, et il a fini ses études d’A0 dans le sujet d’accounting.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les pneus et payer pour l’entretien de ses deux voitures (pour lui et pour sa femme).  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de travailler beaucoup dans son boulot de comptable, et renforcer le business de sa femme, qui est commerçante.  Dans l’avenir, il voudrait construire une autre maison à louer pour augmenter ses revenues.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean Baptiste N. R. is an accountant, and has been a customer of ACB since 2007. He is 49, married, has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 14, and takes care of 2 other people. All his children go to school. Jean Baptiste was born in Bukavu, DRC, and he holds a A0 level diploma in accounting. He will use this loan to buy new tires and pay for car servicing (his own car and his wife's). His strategy for the growth of his business is to work hard as an accountant and strengthen the business of his wife, who is a storekeeper. In the future, he would like to build another house he would rent to increase his income. For his family, he would like his children to have an education.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for car servicing (his car and his wife's)

loans.name: Kafundezi Basubuuzi Twegatte Group

texts.en:
23-year-old Joseph has been in the food sales business in Mubende for 3 years now. He mostly deals in bananas in the food markets in that district. Joseph is single with no kids and he says he was inspired by his friend to try his hand at this business. 

The decision he took to begin this source of livelihood has in many ways made him proud. Joseph says living by his wits was a proposition that he dreaded. Before, he was before engaged in  a small farming business but it did not help that much as most of the food he was growing was harvested for home consumption.

Monthly he says this business generates shillings 300,000 as profit and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more foods like sweet potatoes, rice, maize, etc. which he says sell at higher prices on the local market. In the group photo, Joseph is the one with the raised hand.

loans.use: to purchase more foods such as sweet potatoes, rice, maize, etc.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a mother with a great desire to get ahead in life. Her great spirit, strong will, and hard work have allowed her to improve her and her family's quality of life. For the past 11 years, this persevering lady has been working very hard raising and selling cattle. She uses the income she generates to provide a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy.

Matluba has requested a loan of 7000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy more young cattle that she will sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, she will be able to increase her earnings substantially and improve her quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase young cattle in order to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Concepcion has a mini store that displays food supplements/ vitamins and she also engaged into buying and selling of rice per kilo and sells t-shirts and blouses from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to purchase additional food supplements, rice, and other women and mens wear from Natasha and AVON products.

Concepcion is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been operating a retail shop for the last two years, selling foodstuffs to the people of her local community. She is a hardworking 33-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two school-going children. 

She wants 50,000 KES to buy cooking fat, rice and sugar. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future for more income generation. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to run her business well because she has been trained in business management.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Jacquline

texts.en:
Jacquline is a 45-year-old entrepreneur who is widowed and has three children between the ages of 13 and 28 years old. All of her children are in school.

She has been selling fruits since 1999 and has recently started to sell wholesale.

She needs a loan to buy more fruits and make more profits. With this loan, she will purchase tomatoes, passion fruits and mangoes that she will sell at her business.

She plans to use the profits from her business to pay the school fees for her children and also to save money for her and her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, passion fruits and mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Judith Erlinda

texts.es:
Judith con su credikiva anterior comprò bolsos, mochilas y artesanias que vendiò y obtuvo un poco aumento en su capital de trabajo. Con su nuevo credikiva  repetirá su compra. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio hasta lograr su completa formalizacion; Ella està muya agradecida está por el apoyo que le dieron los financiadores de Kiva para continuar trabajando y en consecuencia dice "yo responderé con mi pago puntual.
Si usted quiere leer la historia de Judith ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/219028
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Judith was able to buy bags, backpacks, and handcrafted items to sell, as well as increase slightly her operating capital. This new Kiva loan will allow her to buy the same items. Her dream is to grow her business until it is formally complete. Judith is very grateful for the support from Kiva lenders so that she can continue working. She says, “I have responded by making my payments on time.”

To learn more about Judith’s story, please follow the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/219028

loans.use: to purchase bags, backpacks, and handcrafted items.

loans.name: Cecilia Holanda

texts.es:
Cecilia inició su negocio hace 11 años, arrancó con algo muy pequeño por lo que solo vendía utiles escolares.Poco a poco fué creciendo y fué adquiriendo  cosas de bazar, con lo que le ha ido mejor ha aumentado sus ingresos. 

Pero como todo encarece no le alcanza para mantener a sus tres hijos los cuales tienen 21,11 y 2 años respectivamente.

Como es madre soltera le  ha costado salir adelante pero no se da por vencida ya que como dice ella sus hijos son su razón y su fuerza de seguir luchando. Para surtir su negocio está decidida a hacer un préstamo, el cual lo utilizará para comprar perfumes, cuadernos, lapices, ropa de AVON, YANBAL que son las marcas que ella vende.
texts.en:
Cecilia’s business started small 11 years ago, as she only sold school supplies. Little by little, her business grew and she obtained stationery supplies which sold better and have increased her earnings.

However, as everything has become more expensive, it is not enough to support her three children who are 21, 11 and 2 years old.

Since she is a single mother, it has been difficult for her to get ahead but she has not given up. She says that her children are her motivation and strength to continue pushing forward. She decided to take out a loan in order to stock her business and buy perfumes, notebooks, pencils and clothing from Avon and Yanbal, the brands she sells.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, notebooks, pencils, clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Teresa de 28 años de edad es soltera, tiene un bebe de 1 año de edad, labora como empledada domestica desde hace 5 años ademas vende productos AVON, ZERMAT y otras cositas que sus clientes le encargan; esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, pues quiere embaldosar el cuarto, pues es de tierra y se le hace lodo cuando llueve. El mayor sueño de Teresa es poder tener su casita con las condiciones basicas para su bebecito, pues es su razon de ser.
texts.en: Teresa is 28 and single.  She has a 1-year-old baby.  She has worked as a domestic employee for 5 years.  She also sells Avon and Zermat products and other little things that her customers order from her.  She is requesting her third loan with the objective of improving her home.  She wants to tile a room since it has a dirt floor and becomes mud when it rains.  Teresa's biggest dream is to be able to have her own little home with basic comforts for her little baby, who is her reason for living.

loans.use: To tile a room

loans.name: Las Alegres De San Vi Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS ALEGRES DE SAN VI" y se ubica en el Estado de México. Este municipio se distingue por las bellas fiestas del pueblo, su gente trabajadora y emprendedora. El grupo esta conformado por ocho integrantes. La señora Adriana es la presidenta del grupo. Ella inició su negocio hace 16 años, el cual consiste en un taller de costura, requiere el prestamo para comprar materia prima como telas, hilos y agujas; varias de sus clientas son madres y quieren que la señora Adriana les fabrique los uniformes para este nuevo ciclo escolar para sus hijos ya que son de mejor calidad y precio. Tiene 39 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, ella se distingue por ser una persona con muchas ganas de trabajar, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia, vive felizmente casada con sus hijos de 20, 19, 14, 7 años de edad.
texts.en:
The " Las Alegres de San Vi"  group is located in the State of Mexico.  This municipality is known for its beautiful town festivals, and for its hard-working, enterprising people. The group has 8 members. 

Adriana is the president of the group. She began her business, a dress-making workshop, 16 years ago. She needs the loan to buy raw material such as fabric, thread, and needles.  

Several of her customers are mothers and want Adriana to make their children's uniforms for the new school year, since they are better in quality and price.

She is 39, and has a high school education. She is known as a person who is very eager to work, always wanting to provide the best for her family.  She is happily married, and has children ages 20, 19, 14, and 7.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. Tessie has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel and other seafood like shrimps and crabs. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos to buy fish to sell.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Jenny Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señorita. Jenny es socia del banco comunal Pan de Azúcar, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, por su calidez y gentileza de su gente,  esta ciudad cautiva con su variada gastronomía.

La Señorita Jenny tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres a quienes ayuda con los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
Ella hace poco tiempo se ha puesto su propio negocio que es un soda bar, en el cual labora de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. También se dedica a la venta de ropa hace 5 años.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y este nuevo crédito es para la compra de sillas y mesas para su local. 

Su meta es agrandar su soda bar.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the Pan de Azúcar (Sugar Loaf) Communal Bank.  She lives in a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its beautiful architecture, its warm and friendly people, and its captivating and varied gastronomy.

Jenny is 27 years old and single.  She lives with her parents and helps with the household expenses.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in her relative’s house.

A little while ago she set up her own business, a snack bar.  She works there from Monday through Friday from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has also been selling clothes for five years.

She has been a member of the communal bank for one year.  This new loan is to buy tables and chairs for her place.

Her goal is to expand her snack bar.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 60 years old, widowed, and blessed with two children who are married. She runs three businesses: a posho mill, rental houses and farming. She has been in these businesses for the last five years and gets an income of KES 25,500 per month.

Peris has good credit history in KADET LTD and she is applying for her third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to boost her farming. She will use the anticipated profit to build more rental houses.

She hopes to expand her rental houses and keep over ten dairy cattle. She is very hardworking and is a business-oriented woman.

loans.use: to boost farming

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns income for her family.
She lives in her brother’s home with her 6 children. Five of them are studying while her youngest daughter stays at home and helps Rasoolan in her household responsibilities.
Her brother is a driver and provides transportation services for his passengers.
Rasoolan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her sewing business. With the loan she will buy another sewing machine and will hire an assistant. This will allow her to receive more orders and make more profit.
She has been in her business for 4 years and is very confident that an investment will help her to further improve it.
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rasoolan”.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
This is Filipina. She is 46 and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a vendor, and mother to four children. She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating her business. Filipina is a fish vendor who works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. Many patrons prefer her products, since she buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning and her customers are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Filipina earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Filipina is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to help continue her business. She will use her loan to buy more fish to sell every day and she expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Filipina dreams of giving all of her children a good and high quality education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members each week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man, aged 23. He runs an auto spare-parts business to make a living. His business is in a busy location and his product pricing is very competitive. He is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy brake pads and discs for resale. Moses has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he plans to establish a wholesale business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy brake pads and discs.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, 30, is married and a mother of four children.  She has been running a retail shop for five years.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business because of financial support.  For extra income, she does farming.  She works hard in her business so as to provide for her children good education.

She hopes to grow her business for more income generation in the future.  She needs a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Leausa

texts.en:
Leausa is 28 years old and is married with 2 children.
Leausa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.  Leausa needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 120 talas or US $50 per week) to supplement her family's income.

Leausa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leausa's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Waly

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié et père de deux enfants.Il tient un laboratoire de reproduction de photographies. Il exerce ce métier depuis trois ans et parvient à entretenir sa famille avec les revenus que génère l'activité. Il a ouvert un compte à l'UIMCEC pour épargner et accéder au crédit. Il sollicite un prêt de 150000f pour acheter des produits de laboratoire. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who is father to two children. He runs a photo reproduction lab. He has practiced this profession for three years and manages to look after his family with the revenue that this business generates. He opened an account at UIMCEC to save and to obtain credit. He is asking for a loan of 150000f to buy lab products. He ambition is to enlarge his business activity.

loans.use: to buy laboratory products.

loans.name: Idulvina

texts.es: Bacilia Induvina es una emprendedora que se le ha apoyado con el financiamiento lo cual ella lo ha aprovechado por que nos expresa que tiene producto que ofrecerle a sus clientes, su negocio es de refresco y enchildas además vende cosa de horno este negocio lo tiene en su casa donde la visitan sus clientes. Bacilia esta agradecida por el apoyo que se le ha brindado para invertir en su negocio. Actualmente está nuevamente solicitando crédito para comprar materia prima para el negocio.
texts.en: Bacilia Induvina is an entrepreneur who has been supported with financing. She has taken advantage of this, because she tells us that she has products to offer her customers. Her business is selling soft drinks and enchiladas. She also sells baked goods. She has the business in her house, where customers visit her. Bacilia is grateful for the support that her been offered her to invest in her business. At present, she is asking for a loan again to buy raw materials for the business.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her business.

loans.name: Grecia Daniela

texts.es:
Grecia es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Grecia pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar vóley con sus amigas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Grecia trabaja como Asistente de Marketing en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y responsabilidad.
Grecia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento y arena, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo de su habitación, de esta manera Grecia tendrá mayor bienestar y seguridad, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Grecia, 21, is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her parents and siblings.  She is a kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who has a strong desire to improve her situation.  Thanks to her efforts and support from her parents, Grecia was able to get a degree in Business Administration.  In her free time, she enjoys playing volleyball with her friends and sometimes likes to cook a delicious Ceviche to share with family.

At her own initiative and with much tenacity and dedication, Grecia works as a marketing assistant at a company in the city.  She works approximately eight hours a day, starting in the early morning hours and enjoys her job.  She believes it is going well for her because of her hard work and responsibility.

Grecia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them she will be able to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, so she can plaster the walls of her bedroom.  This will contribute to Grecia's well-being and safety, so she can continue working and striving to get ahead.  Her goal is to have her own house one day.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Lab's Group

texts.en: Lab, 46, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. She has six children, one of whom remains in school. To tackle with her family’s hardship, she grows rice as a single source of income, which generates her decent income. This is the third loan for Lab and first loan for her co-borrower. The past loan, which she has fully repaid back, has uplifted her lifestyle gradually. For this cycle, she team up a group of two to get a new loan. Lab, the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fee for her cash-crop. She hopes that she can prepare her farmland on time.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee for her cash-crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of produce.

loans.name: Imameddin

texts.en:
38-year-old Imameddin settled with his 2 children  in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2002 he has been engaged in meat sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed first $400, he significantly expanded his business amd bought 2 calves. The loans were paid back in a timely manner.
Now Imameddin applies for a loan of $1200 to buy 4 calves, to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves, to expand his business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 39 years old.  She is a veteran of the SPBD program and is very active in her local center.  One main motivator for Maria to join the program was the goal of keeping current with her children’s school fees and buying them their school supplies.  She has used two previous SPBD loans to finance an expansion of her small shop’s inventory.  With an outstanding history of on-time and in-full loan repayments, Maria now qualifies for a third loan.  Again, she will use this loan to finance the purchase of more merchandise for her shop.  Maria is committed to ensuring that her local customers remain satisfied and are able to get all their basic shopping done within this small village.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale in her shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. C. is 49 and has 5 children, 2 of them still in school. Close to her house in the middle of the fields, she is practicing the Vietnamese field-garden-pond model. She has divided her paddies into several small areas, which in an alternating way are used to grow rice, raise ducks and fish. Last year she was able to sell 2 tons of rice. She wants to use the loan to buy more ducks and eggs for breeding and to buy food for her fish.

loans.use: To buy ducks and fish food

loans.name: Ursina

texts.es:
Ursina, 43, is married to Fausto, a 46-year old construction worker. The couple have 8 children, the oldest of whom is 23 years old and the youngest, 5 years old. Ursina says sadly that her children were unable to continue their studies after high school because they couldn’t afford a university education and they had to look for jobs to support themselves.

Ursina owns a small grocery store that she operates in her house; she also earns income from a small food stand, selling traditional dishes, at a municipal market in the city of Ita. She only goes to the food stand on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays but she works at her grocery store everyday. Her husband, Fausto, helps her with household expenses with his earnings from construction jobs.

She says that she has always turned to lending for investments in her business. She invested the first loan that she managed to get in the construction of a small addition at the front of her house that she now uses for her grocery store. She needs a loan to buy merchandise—rice, sugar, oil, flour, cheese, etc—to better stock the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ursina tiene 43 años, está casada con Fausto que tiene 46 años y es constructor. La pareja tiene 8 hijos, el mayor de todos tiene 23 años y el menor 5 años. Ursina comenta con tristeza que una vez que sus hijos terminan la secundaria ya dejan de estudiar, debido a la imposibilidad de costear los estudios universitarios por lo que deben buscar una profesión con la que puedan mantenerse.

Ursina posee una despensa que funciona en su casa propia, además cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de comidas típicas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Itá. A dicho puesto solamente va los dias Sábados y domingo y los días feriados, mientras que en su despensa atiende todos los días. Su esposo Fausto le ayuda con los ingresos del hogar aportando con las ganancias que obtiene en su trabajo como constructor.

Comenta que siempre recurrió a los préstamos para invertirlos en su negocio, el primer crédito al que logró acceder lo invirtió en la construcción de una pequeña casilla frente a su casa, en dicha casilla funciona su despensa. Necesita de un préstamo para comprar más mercaderías como : arroz, azúcar, aceite, harina, queso, etc. a fin de surtir mejor su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Martha will use the loan to increase the quantity of products she has to sell in her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: BEATRICE CHEPKOECH C. is aged 39 years. She is married with five children all schooling. Her husband is a tea farmer in Kericho District. Beatrice also takes care of her elderly parents. She never had the chance of attending any school because the Kalenjin culture was against girl child education. Beatrice is a business minded lady and 7 years ago she realized that her husband meagre income could not support the education of her children, its on this background that she started her own business of selling cereals in Liten market. After undertaking a business training conducted by Ebony Foundation, she is now able to manage her business well. The demand for her products has also greatly increased and sometimes she runs short of stock, to counter this she needs to double her reorder level. She is therefore requesting for a loan of US$ 1200 which she intends to spend as follows US$ 1000 buy 60 bags of dry maize and US$ 200 buy 10 bags of beans. Beatrice is hard working and she will repay the loan.

loans.use: to increase her current stock level

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. is a trader who sells provisions, soft drinks and clothing materials, etc. She is married to a Rewinder and has four children, ages 22, 19, 17 and15. She is  working very hard to support her husband with the family's finances. Demand for her goods has increased and she needs to purchase more goods for her shop.

She is asking for $1,200 in additional capital to  buy more soft drinks, provisions and clothing materials.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, provisions and clothing materials for shop.

loans.name: Gregoria Estela

texts.es:
Gregoria Estela R. is a very hardworking woman who, from a young age, has dedicated herself to the sale of shellfish in the city of Chinandega. She started her business because her husband did not have a stable income, and she needed to support their children.

She gained more and more experience as time went by, and her business is now located in a major market that is frequented by many visitors.

Gregoria has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and is very happy with the loans that have been provided to her to buy her products. Her current need is to purchase additional shellfish to sell. She has a record of 17 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria Estela R. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de mariscos entre ellos las conchas negras vendidos en la ciudad de Chinandega. Inicia con la venta de estos productos debido a que su esposo no percibía ingresos estables y por la necesidad de mantener a sus pequeños comercializa estos productos.

Ya con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, actualmente el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal donde es muy visitado por muchas personas.

Doña Gregoria trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados para la compra de sus mariscos. Su necesidad actual es la compra de los productos para su respectiva venta. Ella tiene un record de 17 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase shellfish.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.en:
The committee of nineteen women named “The Eight of December” is one of the best committees of women entrepreneurs in the city. They are enthusiastic, hard working women who are looking out for the welfare of their children.

These women work together to increase the success of their independent businesses. They work with everything from food to clothing, sewing, crafting and more. Together they split up the loan they are asking for, according to how much each woman needs. Then they meet a few times a month to repay the loan and talk about business strategies. The system works because all the women trust each other and understand one another’s situation.

loans.use: To buy various items for the women’s businesses, including food, cleaning items, clothing, and other home goods.

loans.name: Djumanazar

texts.en:
B. Djumanazar is 55 years old. He and his wife have raised five children. The eldest children are involved in the family business of fattening cattle. This family business is the main source of income for this large family. They have had good success developing the business for the last 8 years. Djumanazar is a very responsible and accurate person. 
He requests $525.00 for the term of 12 months. He is very happy he is getting the loan, because it will provide him with the opportunity to develop his business. Djumanazar is applying for a loan for the first time. He hopes there will be people who trust and support him. For his part, he would like to promise to do his best to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To increase his capital to maintain his business, and increase income for the family.

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en: Mr. Chhoun M. is a house builder who makes around $4.50 per day. His wife makes $4 per day selling fuel and groceries. They live in Thnal Dach Village, Siem Reap Province, and have nine children, one of whom is married. M. requests a loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle to reduce travel and transportation expenses. This will help to improve income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to reduce travel and transportation expenses

loans.name: Mary Scorly

texts.es:
Mary is 27 years old and has a sales counter on a busy avenue between Figueroa and Murillo Streets -- a central area. At her counter she sells leather wallets and cases for mobile phones and cameras. Mary lives in her parents’ house. For 9 years she has focused on making and selling leather goods. Although there is some competition in this sales field, thanks to her experience Mary has a solid client base. In addition, her sales counter is in a strategic location because people in the neighborhood tend to be more affluent. Mary has no negative credit history.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Mary tiene 27 años de edad, tiene un puesto de venta en plena Avenida entre las calles Figueroa y Murillo, esta es una zona central, en su puesto vende billeteras de cuero y también fundas para celulares y cámaras fotográficas. Mary vive en la casa de sus padres y desde hace 9años su actividad principal es la producción y comercialización de articulos de cuero. Si bien existe competencia en su rubro, ella debido a su experiencia ya cuenta con clientela fija, además que el lugar es estrategico porque la afluencia de gente es elevada. Mary no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Purchase of leather and retail zippers

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok V. and her husband (he is pictured because Sok V. was not available) have been rice farmers since they married. They have four children, two of whom are garment workers.  Rice is a high-demand crop in Cambodia, but its price continues to escalate due to last year’s drought and large exports to neighboring countries such as Vietnam.   
The family is requesting a loan from KIVA for $400 to buy fertilizer, gas, seeds and a water pump in order to increase their crop yield and water supply.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizer, seeds and gas.

loans.name: Alma Mireya

texts.es:
Alma started her business because she needed to help cover the expenses of her home and wanted to have extra income since her husband was not employed and they were experiencing financial difficulties.

She started her business two years ago, selling clothing to her neighbors, later she added the sales of shoes which currently is proving to be more profitable.

She needs a loan of USD $800, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase seasonal merchandise for the upcoming vacation season.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Alma inició el negocio por la necesidad de cubrir gastos familiares y tener ingresos extras para su casa ya que esposo se encontraba sin empleo y atravesaban por una situación económica difícil.

Comenzó con su negocio hace dos años, empezó con la venta de ropa primero con vecinas, después agrego la venta de zapatos que es lo que actualmente le esta dejando mejores ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía de temporada ya que se acerca el periodo de vacaciones.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a married woman from Laktasi. Her husband doesn't work, as he is a pensioner. Vida sells cosmetic and sanitary products. She buys her goods wholesale and then resells them to her customers. She can earn about 500 KM monthly.

This is Vida's third loan from Women to Women International, and she is asking for 600 KM. Vida will use the money to buy more sanitary and cosmetic products to sell in order to earn more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic and sanitary products to sell

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret L., 40, and her husband, Mr. Maly Mao, 46, are rice farmers. They have been farming for 28 years. With their experience, they earns approximately four dollars per day. The couple has three children: one repairs air conditioners, earning $60 per month; another works as a construction worker, earning $60 per day; and another is a student. All of them are living in the family's home in Andong Krosang Village, within the Snam Preah Commune, Pursat Province.

To increase the family's income, Saret needs to improve her farming business by expanding the amount of farmland they own. Hence, she decided to request a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a plot of farmland one hectare use for increasing their ability to grow rice. The loan will allow her to expand the farming business and improve the family's living conditions. Mrs. Saret's husband is pictured because Saret was not available.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland one hectare use for increasing her rice crop

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Mario V., tengo 36 años de edad, soy casado, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio de venta de electrodomesticos los que distribuyo de manera ambulante en la ciudad y sus alrededores tambien trabajo por encaargos, gracias a este negocio tengo mi casita y le puedo proporcionar la educacion a mis hijos, pero en la actualidad necesito mas inversion ya que se aproxima la navidad y en esta epoca las ventas son muy buenas y las demandas de mis clientes se estan incrementando mucho, tambien necesito tener mas variedad de producto. por tal razon necesito un credito para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Mario V.. I am 36-years-old and married. I have a business in which I sell appliances, which I distribute as a street vendor in the city and its surrounding areas. I also work by taking orders. Thanks to this business, I have a house and can educate my children. Currently I need more investment since Christmas is coming, and sales are very good during this season. My customers' demands are increasing a lot. I also need more variety of products. For this reason I need a credit to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electronic appliances for the home

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im M. is a villager in Prey Meilang Cheoung village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Nam Hong, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn their living. With the revenue, they do not have much money to support their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Im M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse and cart for her husband to transport goods and passengers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other three children are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Buy a horse and cart for her husband

loans.name: Yawavi M.

texts.fr:
Madame MENSAH est née le 08 septembre 1966 à Notsè, une localité au sud du Togo. Elle est divorcée de son époux TOGBEDJI Komi qui est un mécanicien et a quatre (04) enfants à sa charge. Elle a pour activité la restauration dans le quartier  d’Agoè Assiyéyé. 
Madame MENSAH n’a jamais obtenu de prêt à WAGES, elle voudrait faire prospérer son commerce et sollicite ce premier crédit pour pouvoir acheter 5 sacs de riz et 18 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Ms. MENSAH was born on September 8, 1966 in Notsè, a town in southern Togo. She is divorced from her spouse Komi TOGBEDJI, a mechanic, and has four children to look after. Her work involves catering in the Agoè Assiyéyé district. She has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan. She would like to make her business prosperous and is requesting this initial loan to buy 5 sacks of rice and 18 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and rice for catering

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: Suzana K. is a Tanzanian business woman and entrepeneur. She runs a business supplying milk to customers. She sells milk supplied from her own farm and purchases additional supplies of milk directly from other farmers which she then transports to her customers. Her customers include restaurants, cafes, and families. She requests a loan of Tshs 600,000 to increase her own farms milk supply.

loans.use: Increasing milk supply and expanding business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 25-year-old man who lives in Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Hasan has been working in livestock production for 5 years. Hasan started his business because he likes animals. He sells the animals in the market.

Hasan requests a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase the land he has been working on. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase the land he has been working on raising livestock

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita owns and manages an internet café located in their village of Barangay Divisoria, Santiago City, just two kilometers from the city proper of Santiago. Thankful that she is able to earn at least PHP 7,500 a month to support their daily family needs and school allowance of their children, she is hoping to expand into electronic loading because some of her customers are looking for a loading station. To cater to this demand, Nenita is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000.00.

Nenita is married to Nick and they are gifted with five children: Mike Angelo – 10 years old, grade five; Mark Anthony – 7 years old, grade 2; Michael Ian – 5 years old, grade one; Princess – 4 years old, a daycare student. and Precious – 3 years old. Nenita is proud of her children and the fact that they are doing well in their studies. She and her husband are working hard to generate income for the family.

“Hard work and focus on the business are the most important things I do,” Nenita adds as she strives for the success of her enterprise.

loans.use: To fund an electronic loading business.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora Dorotea A. P., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 5 hijos, con estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, su negocio es la compra y venta de lubricantes para vehículos, para lo cual solicito un préstamo de 300 soles. 
Ella requiere tener un mayor capital, para lo cual necesita un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirirá mayor mercadería, es decir aceites en baldes de 5 galones y envases de cuarto parta cambios rápidos de aceite, los ingresos los destinará a la mejora de su vivienda y al sustento familiar, ella pagara sus cuotas, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Dorotea A. P. belongs to the “El Comercio” Communal Bank in the Desaguadero district of the province of Chucuito, in the Puno area. She is 39-years-old, married with 5 children and has completed her elementary school studies. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years, and her business is in buying and selling lubricants for vehicles, for which she requested a loan of 300 soles. She requires more capital, for which she needs a loan of 3000 nuevos soles, which she will use to acquire more merchandise, such as oil in 5-gallon buckets and quarter containers for quick oil changes. She will put her income toward improving her home and supporting her family. She will pay her installments according to what she has agreed upon with her group.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire merchandise such as oil, in gallon and quarter containers for quick oil changes.

loans.name: Sugey Auxiliadora

texts.es: La joven Sugey tiene 26 años de edad, reside en Ciudadela de Nicaragua en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijitos de 6 y 9 años de edad,  su esposo es comerciante de ropa al igual que ella vende ropa variada, negocio que inicio con fondos  prestado. Con esta solicitud de crédito quiere invertir en comprar más ropa, en esta temporada de verano como short, camisolas, trajes de baño entre otros, sus planes es poder seguir con su negocio, poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia, da las gracias ala institución por los beneficios adquirido.
texts.en:
Young Sugey is 26 years old, lives in the neighbourhood of Nicaragua in the city of Managua, she has 2 kids who are 6 and 9 years old, her husband works selling clothes. Sugey sells diverse clothing too, she started her business with a loan. With the current loan request she wants to buy more merchandise for this summer season like shorts, t-shirts, bathing suits, among others. She plans to keep on with her business and cover her family needs. She is grateful to the institution for the benefits acquired.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell for this summer season

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es: Marilyn tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y aun vive en la casa de su madre. Con mucha alegría y organización atiende a cada uno de sus clientes que acuden a sus cabinas públicas de Internet, las que hace 3 años viene administrando. Los primeros años de su negocio le resultó muy rentable, porque no contaba con competidores, pero ahora está sintiendo la presencia de la competencia, por lo que ve la necesidad de incrementar el número de computadoras que tiene y aumentar la velocidad de su conexión. Aun así Martilyn está contenta por la rentabilidad de su negocio, y por otra parte, cuanta con el apoyo de su madre que le ha facilitado el local, por lo que no tiene la necesidad de pagar alquiler. En consecuencia, aporta económicamente para las necesidades diarias de su casa y apoya a sus hermanos menores con  la compra de sus útiles escolares, asimismo cuando ella tiene que salir, sus hermanos atienden su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se está integrando a un grupo de solidaridad, por ello, hace compromisos de pagar cada una de las cuotas fijadas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para re potenciar la velocidad de sus computadoras para su mejor conexión a la Internet.
texts.en:
Marilyn is 30 years old, single, and still lives in her mother's house. With great joy and organization she serves each one of the customers who come to her public Internet booths, which she has been running for 3 years. The first years of her business were very profitable, as she did not have any competitors, but now she is feeling the presence of the competition. For this reason she sees the need to increase the number of computers that she has and to increase her connection speed. Even so Martilyn is happy with the profitability of her business, and on the other hand, she counts on the support of her mother, who has provided the building, for which she does not need to pay rent. Consequently, she contributes financially to the daily needs of the house and to her younger brothers by purchasing their school supplies. Likewise, when she has to go out, her brothers take care of her business. This is her first loan with MFP. She is joining a solidarity group, therefore she agrees to pay each one of the payments established by her credit adviser. The money she is requesting is to upgrade the speed of her computers for her best Internet connection.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Upgrade her computers

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget A. is a very hardworking trader. She enjoys selling, and selling cosmetics has been her major livelihood for the past four years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. She does not have a shop at the moment, so she hawks from one neighborhood to the next. 
Bridget is a 33-year-old woman, married with two children who are currently in school. She believes that with this loan, she will be better resourced to increase her inventory and income. 
She is a member of Heavens Trust Group. Members of this group provide assistance to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Osakpamwan

texts.en: Osakpamwan is 40 years old and married with seven children. She sells cooked foods, and is requesting the loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Mwasiti L. from Mbeya who is divorced with four children between the ages of 13 and 29. She has been running a crops business since 1995, purchasing and selling crops. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about $60 a month. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Mwasiti thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Zhumabubu's Group

texts.en:
This loan group’s leader, Zhumabubu, is a widow and mother of three daughters and one son. Since her husband’s death. she has been getting support from husband’s relatives. She started her business with only two sheep that were given as a wedding present by her parents. Now she has four cows and two calves. 

After an unhappy marriage. her eldest daughter got divorced and now stays with Zhumabubu. She helps her around the house and sells the milk from the cows. Her son and little daughter go to school. Another daughter lives with her husband. Each month, Zhumabubu earns around seventy dollars from selling the milk. She has even been able to buy a new track for the house. She does not like standing on the same spot. 

Now, Zhumabubu needs a loan to purchase one more cow to increase the amount of milk she produces per day. This will help her tremendously to prepare her two children for a new school year and buy them new clothes and school supplies. Zhumabubu’s dream is to open and run a shop near her house.

Kulzhan, Aisuluu, Cholponbubu are like Zhumabubu -- women who do not hesitate to try new things and change their lives. They wisely use what they have been endowed with to grow and go forward.

Kulzhan, a divorced woman, is the mother of one daughter. She makes her living by selling women’s shoes. She has been doing this only for a few months and she already makes a good profit. She needs a loan to purchase new goods and refill her shop.

The other member, Aisuluu, is married and has one daughter and one son. It was easy for them to start raising livestock, because her husband and son were engaged in farming. Now Aisuluu needs a loan to purchase one more cow and sell its milk. With the rest of the loan, they intend to purchase hens.

Cholponbubu is fifty one, divorced, and has five children. Her children work abroad and send her money each month. She needs a loan to buy furniture to make her house a better place. She plans to start her own business soon.

loans.use: To purchase two cows, one hen, increase the inventory of a shop and by furniture

loans.name: Sadia Muhammad Rafiq Group

texts.en:
My name is Sadia and I have lived in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. My husband's name is M. R. and he deals in seasonal vegetables. He buys vegetables wholesale and sells them to his customers and also treks to different communities to sell his produce, calling out in loud voice. He uses his donkey cart when he goes to different communities.

I handle my own plastic bottle cap-making business, taking orders from the factories. I save my income in a committee and plan to renovate my house with the committee amount. I am applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to grow my husband’s business.
