This loan consists of three additional people:

Sheena Firdous baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her drinks corner.

Khalida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy CDs to sell.

Kosar Ayaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Sadia R. baji is seated first on the left side in this photo.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Phul Phai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phul P. is a farmer who owns a small piece land to cultivate rice and she is also a silk weaver in the local village. She is a widow with three children who are all attending the local school. Since the second business is going well, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy silk for her weaving. She is the village bank president, who has been selected by the members.

This village bank consists of 18 people located in Kandal village in Takeo province. The members will use their loans for different purposes. Eleven members in this group have end-of-term loans (the rest have monthly payment loans). They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. They allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 34 años, es madre de 3 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos estudiantes y el mayor acaba de culminar sus estudios secundarios y por el momento la apoya en su negocio. Su esposo es albañil y todos viven en su casa propia. Hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos comestibles en un pequeño ambiente al frente de su casa. Adicionalmente, y con lo que obtiene mayores ganancias, vende verduras regionales a otros lugares fuera de su ciudad. El comercio es una actividad que le agrada mucho a Rocío porque puede conocer a mucha gente, a quienes les brinda un trato amable al momento de vender sus productos, pero sobre todo, le agrada ver que día a día sigue progresando, pues gracias a este negocio y a su carisma al atender cuenta con una gran clientela y tiene buenos ingresos diarios. Para más adelante, Rocío quiere incursionar en el negocio de la distribución, al por mayor, de bebidas gaseosas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy entusiasmada de trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha notado que son personas responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abarrotes y productos comestibles de primera necesidad, haciendo un gasto de 200 soles, con el resto, adquirirá verduras para llevarlas a vender a otros lugares.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: H. is 31 years old, married with two school-aged children and lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital, that has many good locations for making money. H. currently makes a living selling fresh fish caught by her husband or bought from wholesalers. She and her husband are also farmers. The growing season is approaching, and they need farming supplies. She is applying for a loan for $300 to buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma Anta

texts.fr: Ma anta D. est un mécanicien auto il est installé à Mbour ville situé à 80km de Dakar  la capital sénégalaise. Dans son atelier il a trois apprentis qui son formation pour le métier de mécanicien. Pour renforcer son activité il  vend des pièces détachées .Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite, il compte acheter des pièces     détachées pour les revendre à ses clients.
texts.en:
Ma Anta D. is an automobile mechanic. He is established in Mbour City, located 80 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. In his workshop, he has three apprentices being trained in this trade by him. To bolster his business, he sells spare parts. With this loan he's requesting, he intends to buy spare parts to resell to his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Mokwe

texts.en: L. is 28 years old and married with 5 children. She is a tailor and has been in the business for the past 6 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N70000 to purchase more bags, shoes and clothes to sell. She thanks all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson S. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old and married with three school-age children. To make a living, Nelson owns and operates a vulcanizing shop, repairing motorcycles in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Nelson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional equipment for his vulcanizing shop. This will be his second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional equipment for his vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie C. is  49 years old. She is from the village of Calamagui, San Pablo Isabela, Cagayan. She is married to Michael, 48 years old, who manages their hog farm. Farming is the major source of income of  most of the residents in their village. The couple are blessed with three children and all of them are studying.

Connie has been raising pigs for eight years. She started  the  business to assist her husband in providing for the daily needs of their family and also to send their children to school. She wants her children to receive a college education. For this reason, Connie and husband are working hard for their future. Sometimes, her children help her in caring for the hogs, especially on weekends. 

Connie believes that with cooperation and patience, a lot of improvement will happen to their business. In this regard, Connie is asking for additional business capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to Php5,000. She intends to use the loan to buy a sufficient supply of feed for her hogs.

loans.use: For additional capital to purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline U. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline sells snacks such as hot cakes and twisted bread in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

Evangeline joined HSPFI this year for financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her first HSPFI loan of 5000 PHP, and now requests her second loan, for 8000 PHP, so she can improve her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in improving her business.

loans.name: Joseph Owino

texts.en: Joseph Owino O. owns the Moke engineering shop and sells windows, doors, gates and chairs to neighbouring schools and walk-ins.  He has three employees and has been working in the business for the last twenty years.  His business challenge is price undercutting by competitors and the short ordering period of customers. He is using the proceeds of KES 50,000 to buy a grinding and drilling machine. Joseph is married and has seven children.  He describes himself as hard-working and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy grinding and drilling machines

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Prosperidad está integrado por Marlyn V. de 40 años de edad quien vende cosméticos  y ropa de manera ambulantes. Ella invertirá el crédito en comprar lápiz labial, rubor, marbellí, delineador, polvo compacto, base y ropa entre otros productos para luego comercializarlo de manera ambulante. 

Sus compañeras son Yolanda R. N. que tiene una pulpería y Xiomara del Socorro que vende tortillas y frijoles. Estas tres mujeres aseguran que aunque tienen poco de tar con adim este le ayudado mucho a aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Prosperidad (Prosperity) group is made up of Marlyn V. who is 40 years old and sells cosmetics and clothing as a street vendor. She will use the loan to buy lipstick, blush, eyeliner, compacts, foundation and clothing among other things to later sell on the street. Her companions are Yolanda R. N. who has a grocery store and Xiomara del Socorro who sells tortillas and beans. The three women tell us that although they have only been with ADIM for a short while, the loans have helped them grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene S. is from the village of Ospital Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Eugene is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eugene owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cologne, powder, napkins, facial cleanser, cottons, etc. in the local community. Eugene has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eugene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugene is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eugene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Ali has been working as a school van driver since 2007. When he first started his business, he had to face some competition, especially since he didn’t do a lot of networking. He had some financial issues as well. Now, Ali is well-known for his work because he is punctual and trustworthy.

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to expand his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Matín

texts.es:
El señor Martín G. el mismo es casado con casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar es de la zona de Edelira 60   sus tres hijos estudian en la escuela Nacional de Edelira.
 El cliente es propietario de  una carpintería denominada CARPINTERIA  G.  cuenta con 10 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos fabricando muebles sumamente finos utilizando maderas de primera, el fabrica mesas, sillas, ventanas, o cuelquier otro mueble diseñado.
El cliente solicito el crédito para compras de maderas como ser cedro, lapacho para la fabricación de carrocerías y  muebles estándar.
texts.en:
Mr. Martin G. is married, owns his own home with all the necessities in the zone of Edelira 60. His 3 children study at the school, Nacional de Edelira. He is the owner of a carpentry shop named Carpinteria G., which is long and well-established in the area and that allows him to have a very good clientele and a good income producing fine furniture, using primarily wood. He makes tables, chairs, windows or any furniture design. He is asking for a loan to buy wood such as cedar and walnut to manufacture auto-body specialty items and standard furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials and wood such as cedar, walnut, petereby

loans.name: Bertha Nubia

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha Nubia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Responsable del cyber de la Alcaldía municipal de El sauce donde tiene un año de laborar en este cargo. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel el cual será invertido en la compra de uniformes y útiles escolares, ya que es una madre soltera que lucha por brindarles lo mejor a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Bertha Nubia is from El Sauce. She is responsible for internet services for the municipal town hall of El Sauce. She has been working there for one year. This is the first loan that she requests from CEPRODEL. She will use this loan to purchase uniforms and school supplies as she is a single mother that struggles to provide the best for her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase uniforms and school supplies.

loans.name: Ana Isaura

texts.es:
La señora Ana Isaura M. tiene la edad de 59 años, es soltera y con dos hijos varones los cuales son mayores de edad y trabajadores del Ingenio San Antonio. Doña Isaura se dedica al comercio desde hace 12 años, es una pulpería donde vende Granos básicos, pollo, carne, enlatados, gaseosas, etc. 
Ella trabaja con Ceprodel desde el año 2001, obteniendo hasta la fecha 38 créditos los cuales todos han sido para invertir en su negocio. Nos expresa que todos los créditos que le han financiado han sido de gran ayuda ya que ha invertido en el negocio y a la vez le permitió darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos preparándolos en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana Isaura M. is 59 years old and single. She has two sons who are adults, and they work for the Ingenio San Antonio. Isaura has been a merchant for 12 years. She has a mini-market where she sells basic grains, chicken, meat, canned goods, and soft drinks, etc. She has worked with Ceprodel since 2001. She has had 38 loans, and all of them have been to invest in her business. She says that all of the loans have been a great help because she invested them in the business. That allowed her a better standard of living. It also allowed her to prepare her children in the university.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various kinds of rice, brown and white sugar, and chicken

loans.name: Liah

texts.en:
Liah B. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Liah owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Liah has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Liah joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Liah is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Uth

texts.en:
Uth S., 25, is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorian temples.

S. works at a local garment factory for an income of about USD 2.50 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy a new motorbike to commute to work at the garment factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Ana Mag-Usara Group

texts.en:
Ana M. is from the village of Bato. She is 55 years old. Ana is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ana is single. To make a living, Ana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Ana has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Ana is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Ana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es: El señor José Enrique C. es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo para sostener los gastos de la familia. José es padre de 3 pequeños por quienes sale adelante y desea darles una mejora calidad de vida, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos para darles una mejor atención. La protección es primordial en esta familia es por ello que el quiere un crédito para comprar un portón en su casa.
texts.en:
José Enrique C. is a man who is dedicated to his work in order to support the family expenses. José has three little ones for whom he gets ahead and wishes to give a better quality of life. His wife devotes herself to taking care of their children to give them better attention. Protection is fundamental in this family. That is why he wants a loan to be able to buy a gate for his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a metal gate

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en: Nansalmaa is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house, in a yard that belongs to her sister. Her husband, Bukhchuluun, is working as an engineer. She operates a trading business at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia. Her children help her in the business. She has been operating her business since 1999, and has steadily expanded her business since then. She operates a retail business and purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. Her product selection is very good and she has a great business mind. Since she founded her business, her living conditions have improved. Nansalmaa has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. She says, “I have been planning to build a warehouse for my business and my family in the future".  She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nicholas Gedion

texts.en:
Nicholas Gedion O. is a 22-year-old single man from the Nyalenda area in Kisumu, Kenya.  He is a new client in Kadet Ltd and this is his first loan.

Nicholas is an electrician and intends to use the money from this loan to buy more electronic spare parts to add to his stock. Most of his clients consist of constructors who buy spare parts from him during the construction process.

His desire is to see his business grow and to be able to create job opportunities by employing someone to help him with the shop.

loans.use: Buy electronics to add to his shop

loans.name: Blanca Nory

texts.es:
Blanca es separada y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales uno esta estudiando en la Universidad, Blanca se dedica a la elaboración D. papa seca, cuyo proceso se inicia con el sancochado D. la papa, luego se pela y seguidamente se pica para luego secarlo al sol, este producto se utiliza para la preparación D. diferentes platos, sus ventas los realiza a los intermediarios. Además Blanca compra cereales variados que luego D. almacenar lo venD. en el mes D. setiembre cuando el precio delos cereales suben. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. papa.
Blanca es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua y lo que mas le gusta son el incentivo al ahorro , los sueños D. Blanca son comprar un carro para que trabaje y terminar D. construir el tercer piso D. su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is separated and has 6 children, one of whom is studying at the University. Blanca makes dried potatoes, a process which starts with partially cooking the potato in boiling water. Next, she peels the potato, then she chops it up, and then dries it in the sun. This product is used to prepare various dishes and she makes her sales to middlemen. Blanca also buys various grains, which she stores and then sells in the month of September when prices go up. She will use this loan to buy potatoes. Blanca is a member of the "Kusikuy" (which means "Rejoice" in Quechua) Communal Bank and her favorite thing about it is the incentive to save. Blanca's dreams are to buy a cart for her work and to finish constructing the third floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Oscar Ivan

texts.es:
Oscar Ivan  E. L., tiene 32 años.  Es soltero,  vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tienen 2 hijos. 

Oscar es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Oscar se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de café y maíz. Las compras las realizan cada mes en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y los vende en la misma localidad en un local de la casa donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semilla de café y maíz para incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños dinero para incrementar la producción. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero y la variedad del clima las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer deporte y criar animales.
texts.en:
Oscar Ivan E. L. is 32 years old and single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas in the Los Riós province. He has two children. Oscar is a member of the “Y” Communal Bank, which is one and half hours from Ventanas. There are 17 members in all, and most of them are farmers. This is their first loan with Cooprativa San José. Oscar is a farmer, and he plants coffee and corn. He makes his monthly purchases in Guayaquil and Babahoyo. He sells in the same town in a place in his house. He is requesting a loan to buy coffee and corn seeds in order to increase his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have the money to increase his production. He faces challenges; which are lack of money, the change in climate, pests, and illnesses. He likes to play sports and raise animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coffee and corn seeds to increase his business

loans.name: Melia

texts.en:
Melia D. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. Melia owns and operates a general store which offers a variety of products to the local community. Melia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years.

In 2009, Melia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Guliana Margoth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI ”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guliana;  La socia tiene 39 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos ; La socia estudio  la carrera profesional de administración de empresas,  y ella a su ves tiene un bus turístico, ella renta este bus desde hace 12 años; La socia requiere combustible para su unidad de transporte. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de combustible para el bus.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Guliana, 39, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE CHAPI” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is married and has 3 children. She studied Business Administration and owns a tourist bus that she has leased out for the last 12 years. She needs fuel for the bus and is asking for funds to buy it. She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fuel for the bus.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia Pelongo is from the Barangay of Baybay Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years of age, married to Elario Pelongo and is blessed with 5 children. Three of the children are adults and two are teenagers in school.  To make a living, she is presently engaged buying and selling pigs. Her husband is her business partner. She is also receiving support from her other children to meet the family's basic needs. They have been engaged in this business activity for 2 years and earn approximately Php8000.00 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilian as an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php35,000.00. She is requesting the same loan amount of Php35,000.00  to be used for additional capital for their existing pig raising business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education, insurances and possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy and sell pigs

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn P. is from the town of Talibon. She is 19 years old. Jovelyn is married and has a 9-month-old baby. She buys empty shells while her husband is a fisherman. She cleans the empty shells and makes accessories and displays items in their community. She also helps sell her husband's catch and makes dried fish.

Jovelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase empty shells and repair their fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase empty shells and repair their fishing boat

loans.name: Nancy Leticia

texts.es:
Nancy de 41 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Ella hace trabajos de computación en su casa y alquila la computadora a las personas del sector donde vive para tener mas ingresos. 

Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus tres hijos ella comenzó a ser un estudio en su barrio de la necesidad de las personas del sector y vio que ellos buscaban lugares para hacer investigaciones por Internet. Decidió comprar una computadora y dar los servicios de computación y alquilarla poco a poco pudo comprar una impresora para imprimir los trabajos. En la actualidad ella trabaja desde las 14h00pm hasta las 18h30pm porque a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela y ella tiene tiempo para atender a sus clientes. La hora de Internet la da a $ 0.50, las impresiones con investigaciones a $ 1.00. Con el tiempo que tiene haciendo trabajos ha podido comprar un dispositivo de recargas celulares para tener otro ingreso adicional. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una computadora para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener un Cyber en su casa y darle mas oportunidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy, 41, lives in a canton called Playas one of Ecuador’s tourist destinations with a wide range of seafood.  She does computer jobs at home and rents her computer to people in the area as a source of extra income.

To help her husband meet their three children’s expenses she did a study in her neighborhood to see what folks in the area needed and she discovered that what they wanted was someplace to do research on the Internet.  She decided to buy a computer and provide computer services and to rent computer time.  Little by little she was able to add a printer to print out the assignments.  

She is currently open for business from 2pm to 6:30pm because that’s the time her children are in school and she has time to take care of customers.  She charges $0.50 per hour of Internet time, printing research costs $1.00.  With the time she’s been in business she’s been able to buy a cell phone recharging base as still another source of income.

She wants to use the loan to buy another computer to provide improved customer service and earn more income.  In the future she’d like to have an Internet café in her house to provide better economic opportunity for her children.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Joselyn Vanessa

texts.es: Joselyn Vanessa P. G. de 20 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual reside en San Marcos, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y junto a sus dos pequeños hijos de 2 años de edad y el menor de 3 meses de vida. Joselyn se dedica a la venta de ropa interior femenina, la cual comercializa en el mercado de San Marcos, estas ventas las realiza de forma ambulante en las instalaciones del lugar, así mismo comercializa por encargos. Sus ventas son muy buenas, es por ello que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar ropa interior que este de moda con estampados y colores juveniles, ya que son las jóvenes quienes más compran sus productos. Ella desea mucho salir adelante y poder brindarles de esta forma una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Joselyn Vanessa P. G., age 20, is a hardworking person who resides in San Marcos, Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works as a mason, and their two small children (ages 2 and 3 months). Joselyn sells women’s undergarments on the premises of the San Marcos Market as a traveling vendor. She also generates sales through orders. Her level of sales is very good, so she is requesting a loan so that she can buy undergarments with different prints and youthful colors since younger women buy more of these products.

Joselyn has great determination to succeed and provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: Purchase undergarments to sell

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Ruth Andeso

texts.en:
Ruth A. is 48 years old,  married, and has two adult children. They live in Eregi area in Vihiga.  Ruth has a cereal business, which she has been doing for the past four years. She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET after successfully repaying her previous ones. Ruth will use the money to buy 15 sacks of maize to add to her stock. Her monthly income is 13,500 KES.

In the future, Ruth hopes to acquire a posho-mill (grinding machine).

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia Blasé raises ducks and makes balut (a boiled, fertilized egg) to earn a living. She is 46 years old, married and has 3 children ages 13, 12 and 8. Her children go to school. Nemia makes sure she can sustain their education because she wants them to finish college and be professionals.

Nemia raises ducks to produce and use the eggs to make balut. Sometimes the eggs produced are not enough so she has to buy from other sellers to make more balut. Nemia hopes to acquire more ducks so she will have enough eggs to sell and make balut from. Nemia also raises some chickens.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase more ducks, feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity S. is a married woman who lives in Purok Yanog, Brgy. Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a food vending business.  Her husband Hansel S., who is 29 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is three years old.

 Charity joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Charity has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she can continue to save up for the future and support her children's education.  

Charity S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is married, responsible for the support of five people and earns a living by making and selling kenkey, a dumpling made of corn husks that is very popular in the Accra region of Ghana. Her husband makes a living as a farmer. Esi uses her income to help her husband run and maintain their home. She has applied for a loan to buy ingredients to make more keneky, and eventually hopes to purchase her own farm. In this photo, we see Esi holding a sample of the corn dough she uses to make kenkey, and in the nearby sack we see the corn husk from which she makes her dough.

loans.use: To buy maize to make kenkey to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional materials for his general store

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school while two have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 20 years, she has operated a food stall business from home; neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. In addition, she also has rental houses that contribute to her other source of income. Tabu faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, few customers visit her food stall. She hopes to operate a beauty salon business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, rice, wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr:
Madame DIOUMA F. est une femme de 50 ans. Elle est veuve et a la garde de 11 enfants. Elle fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA depuis le 03 mai 1997. Elle a 26 fois reçu de crédits auprès de CAURIE-MF et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement


Elle développe un petit commerce comme activité principale. Parallèlement elle fait un élevage de porcs, de chèvre et de moutons. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité afin de prétendre à des bénéfices qui l'aideront à prendre en charge sa famille. 

Son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge de sa famille et à subvenir à ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
F. DIOUM is a 50 years old lady. She is widowed and has custody of 11 children. She is a member of the communal bank SANGHA DOUKAS since May 3, 1997. She received 26 loans from CAURIE-MF and always paid back on schedule. 
She has developed a small business as her main activity. At the same time, she also raises pigs, goats and sheep. 
This new loan will allow her to improve her business and increase her profits, which will help her to support her family. 
Her objective is to ensure the care of her family and to meet their personal needs.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and kitchenware

loans.name: Jovid

texts.en:
Since he was a young boy, Jovid has known how to work. His parents taught him how to get by as a farmer and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of his own family, he still works as a farmer. Thanks to his parents, Jovid now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good farmer and worker, he needs help to move forward and improve his production. Therefore, Jovid is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive but necessary to improve his production.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Nueva Esperanza nació hace más de 5 años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, en estos más de cinco años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. Han pasado por una prueba muy difícil en el ciclo anterior ya que varias de las compañeras incumplieron en los compromisos de pago semanal, cancelaron el crédito y asumieron el compromiso de levantar nuevamente con éxito el comité al cual pertenecen.
La señora Silvia O. fue una de las más persistentes, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y agradece por el préstamo porque tiene muchas ganas de superarse constantemente y cree que sin este crédito no podría lograrlo, ella vive gracias a su puesto de frutas y sólo espera que siga prosperando, aunque eso cueste mucho sacrificio.
texts.en:
The committee “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) was started more than five years ago as a result of the efforts and support of another committee that was working in the same area.

This committee is located in San Lorenzo. After more than five years of hard work, the group has grown socially as well as financially. The members have been recognized locally for being hardworking women. They endured a very difficult situation in their previous loan cycle in which several members defaulted on their weekly loan payment. As a result, their loans were cancelled and they pledged to rise up again to become a successful part of the committee to which they belong.

Sra. Silvia O. is one of the most persistent members. She sells fruit and is grateful for her loan because she has great eagerness to succeed. Without this loan, she believes she would not able to accomplish her goals. She survives as a result of her fruit stand and only hopes to continue prospering, even though it requires a great amount of sacrifice.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: María Sorany

texts.es:
Desde pequeña María Sorany R. G. aprendió el oficio de la confección, aunque su esposo trabaja su salario no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos del hogar, fue entonces cuando con el apoyo de una amiga decidió crear su propio negocio de confección a terceros y su propia línea con el fin de aportar para cubrir los gastos del hogar . 

Actualmente Maria Sorany necesita de un préstamo para comprar materia prima e insumos con el fin de sacar una nueva producción e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Sorany R. G. learned the sewing profession when she was young. Although her husband works, his salary was not enough to cover their household expenses. That was when, with the support of a friend, she decided to start her own sewing business. She sews for third parties and has her own line. Her goal is to contribute to covering the household expenses.

María Sorany currently needs a loan to buy materials in order to start a new production and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es:
El grupo Arco Iris lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Ana Martínez Rivas, Rosa M. y Carmen Martínez. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Martínez Rivas de 61 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería para aumentar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes doña M. vende productos Avon y ropa interior y Carmen Martínez de 48 años comercializa perfumes, chinelas, ropa…etc. de todo un poco.
texts.en: The Arco Iris group consists of three hard-working and enterprising women: Ana, Rosa and Carmen. The group's coordinator is Ana, 61, who has made a living selling clothes for the past five years. She plans to use the loan to purchase more merchandise to expand her business. Rosa sells undergarments and Avon product, while Carmen, 48, sells perfumes, slippers, clothing and a little bit of everything.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and other merchandise

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Don Pedro Antonio H. P., es casado, tiene 53 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 11 hijos, 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, tejido de cortes típicos, lleva 10 años de experiencia con este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien también se dedica a la tejeduría. 

Solicita un préstamo a ASDIR para compra de hilo, hilo mish y tambien hilo de seda, para seguir tejiendo mas cortes, ya que quiere ver su negocio grande y prospero. De esta forma contribuye a desarrollo familia y del pais.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro Antonio H. P. is 53 years old, married and has 11 children, 2 of whom are in school. He never had the chance to go to school himself. He is a weaver, making traditional clothing. He has 10 years of experience in this work, and his wife, who is also a weaver, helps him. 

He asks for a loan from ASDIR to buy thread, rayon thread and embroidery thread to continue weaving more skirts, since he wants to see his business grow big and prosper. This is how he contributes to the development of his family and the country.

loans.use: to buy embroidery thread.

loans.name: Edwin Ernesto

texts.es:
Edwin Ernesto, de 34 años de edad, habita en casa propia, con su esposa y dos hijos. Edwin posee una tienda en su casa de habitación en donde vende frutas, pan dulce, recargas para celular, juguetes, etc. Ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para sacar adelante a su familia y su sueño es poder darles a sus hijos todo lo necesario para que sigan estudiando y lleguen a ser grandes profesionales. 

Por esta razón ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para invertir en su negocio y poder comprar variedad de frutas como sandías, naranjas, uvas, manzanas. Además comprar variedad de pan dulce y de juguetes que es lo que el ofrece en su negocio. Todo esto lo hace con la fe puesta en Dios que va poder obtener mayores ganancias que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su querida familia.
texts.en:
Edwin Ernesto is 34 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children.  He has a store in his home where he sells fruit, sweet bread, rechargeable mobile phone cards, toys, and other items.  Edwin has worked a long time so that his family can get ahead.  His dream is to provide his children everything they need so that they can continue their studies and become successful professionals.  

For this reason, Edwin has decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral to invest in his business.  He plans to buy a variety of fruits such as watermelons, oranges, grapes, and apples.  In addition, he will purchase a variety of sweet breads and toys to offer in his business.  Everything he does is achieved through his faith in God so that he can generate more income, which will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon, oranges, bread, and toys to sell in his store.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Gulnar is not married, and she lives with her parents. She runs a small business selling perfumes, cosmetics, wedding gifts, kids' toys, and other items. Gulnar has been in this business for five years. The business brings a stable income to Gulnar's family. Her goals are to develop the business further, to rent a larger facility, and to begin selling items in bulk. She would like to borrow 600 AZN to purchase more inventory. Gulnar hopes to increase her sales and to earn additional income.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deisy, tiene la edad de 60 años, está casada, tiene un hijo y vive con  su esposo. Ella pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de insumos para la asistencia de su vivero  para el buen mantenimiento de sus flores. Ella cuanta con las instalaciones ya hechas y con plantas  como pastoras y chinas para la venta a sus clientes. Ella lo que quiere es tener sus plantas en buenas condiciones  de calidad y así poder venderlas bien bonitas a sus clientes. Ella  quiere hacer crecer su vivero y generar las ganancias para seguir adelante con el proyecto. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Deisy is 60 years old and married.  She has one child and lives with her husband.  She plans to use her loan money to buy supplies for her plant nursery, so that she can care for her flowers properly.  She already has the installations and plants such as poinsettias and 'chinas' to sell to her customers.  What she wants is to have good-quality plants so that she can sell them looking really beautiful to her customers.  She would like to grow her nursery business and make the profits necessary to get ahead in her project.

This is the first loan that Deisy has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to stock her plant nursery

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a married woman with eight children, seven of whom attend school. One child is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, Mwenda has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a dairy farming business which contributes to her other source of income. Mwenda faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and salt.

loans.name: Adidjatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de profession, Adidjatou est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur. Adidjatou est mère de trois enfants. Elle a commencée son activité de revendeuse de céréales depuis 1990 et pour se faire s’approvisionne à DAPAONG une ville située à 540 km au nord de Lomé puis revend au marché d’Agoé assiyéyé et Agoé Atsanvé.  ce crédit qu’elle sollicite pour une première fois va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en céréales pour desservir  la population environnante en quantité voulue et mieux accompagner son époux dans les tâches ménagères.
texts.en: Adidjatou, a professional merchant, is 44 years old and married to a driver. She is the mother of three children. She began her activity as a merchant of cereals in 1990. She gets her supplies in Dapaong, a city located 540 kilometers north of Lomé, and resells her goods at the markets in Agoé Assiyéyé and Agoé Atsanvé. This loan, which is the first one she applies for, will enable her to buy cereals to appropriately serve the local population. She will better help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Camindo Juntos” pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa (Cusco, Perú) y las reuniones de las socias son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Papelpata de la ciudad de Quillabamba  departamento del Cusco. La comunidad se encuentra a unos treinta minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú). 

En esta comunidad de Papelpata conocimos a la señora Hilda nació en la misma comunidad, tiene 44 años de edad, tiene su pareja y tiene 2 hijos. Actualmente, Hilda vive en la misma comunidad y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas.  

Hilda tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y se dedica a la crianza de animales y también  se dedica a la agricultura a la cosecha de café y cacao. Hila en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercedaria para la tienda y así poder abastecer su local con productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más y también va comprar animales menores como por ejemplo pollos y chancho.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Camindo Juntos" belongs to Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) in Cusco, Peru. The members' meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Papelpata of the city of Quillabamba in the department of Cusco. The community is located at some thirty minutes from the city of Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru). 

In the community of Papelpata we met Hilda. She was born in the same community and she is 44 years old. She has a partner and she has 2 children. Hilda currently lives in the same community and she works in her business activities.

Hilda has a small grocery store in her house, she raises livestock, and she is an agriculturist who harvests coffee and cocoa. Hilda requires a loan to purchase merchandise for her store, in order to supply her business with basic consumer goods, such as rice, sugar, and other products. She also wants to purchase small livestock, such as poultry and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase basic consumer goods such as rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Espirita

texts.en: Espirita, 51 years old, is married with six children. Three of them are being sent to high school and college. To continue to support their studies, Espirita is doing her best to help her husband improve their farm production to generate higher income and elevate her family from their current living situation. Every harvest, usually during the months of April and November, Espirita makes 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) average net income from farming that is used to meet their basic needs and pay the school fees of her children. They have been growing rice for 20 years already. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, hybrid seeds of rice, and herbicide for her farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, hybrid seeds of rice and herbicide for her farming.

loans.name: Angel Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Ángel es soltero, tiene 42 años y vive con su madre; es una persona trabajadora y de buenas referencias personales testigo de ello son todos los vecinos de él,  su casa familiar está destruida por el terremoto del 2007, su principal negocio es la venta de pescado en su triciclo, vendiendo todas las mañanas por todas las calles de la zona sur de la ciudad de Ica. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pescado para la venta del mismo.  Su principal sueño es poder reconstruir su casa y poner un puesto de venta en un mercado central. El Sr Ángel esta muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Angel is single, 42-years-old, and lives with his mother. He is a hard-working person with good personal references. Witness for that comes from all his neighbors. Angel's family home was destroyed by the 2007 earthquake. 

His principal business is selling fish from his 'tricycle' every morning in all the streets of Ica city's southern zone. The loan angel requests will allow him to buy more fish to sell.

Angel's principal dream is to be able to reconstruct his house and open a sales stall in the central market. Angel is very grateful for this offer of a loan.

loans.use: increase the fish he can buy and enhance sales.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo Irineo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. LLochegua. Delfina viene administrando su peluquería por casi 12 años, siendo sus hijas, quienes la apoyan en el trabajo, atendiendo a los clientes con una amabilidad y cortesía. Durante este tiempo, ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. sus clientes y la destreza que tiene para hacer variedad D. cortes y peinados, asimismo es solicitada en eventos ya sea para matrimonios y quince años. Ahora desea implementarse D. más productos para ofrecer un buen servicio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP por lo que ella se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago D. sus cuotas.Con los 2000 soles que solicita, comprará muebles para acondicionar su peluquería.
texts.en:
Delfina, age 54, lives with her husband Irineo and their six children in their own home in the District of Llochegua. She has managed a beauty salon for almost 12 years. Her daughters help her with the work. Delfina attends to her customers with kindness and courtesy. During this time, she has managed to gain the trust of her customers. Her skills enable her to offer a variety of cuts and hairstyles. In addition, her services are requested for events such as weddings and quinceañeras. Now she wants to introduce more products so that she can offer a good service.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to complete her payments on time. With this loan of 2000 PEN that she requested, Delfina will buy furniture to equip her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Isolda Elena

texts.es: Isolda Elena, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Esta no es la primera vez que ella tiene experiencia con financiamientos. El empeño y dedicación que brinda a sus clientes es algo que les llama la atención. Debido a esto solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar los encargos que tiene pendiente como sabanas, toalla, perfumes, calzado, cremas entre otros. A pesar de que cada día tiene que hablar con diferentes personas ella siempre tiene su carisma que atrae.
texts.en: Isolda Elena sells general merchandise. This is not her first experience with loans. The commitment and dedication that she provides her customers is something that catches their attention. Because of this, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise for the orders she has pending, such as sheets, towels, perfumes, shoes and creams, among other merchandise. Despite having to talk to different people every day, she always has her charisma, which attracts people.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, perfumes, shoes, creams and other merchandise

loans.name: Alma Vee

texts.en:
Alma Vee is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Alma Vee has a tailoring shop; she sews office and school uniforms. She is also into repairing some dresses and uniforms. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw materials needed for tailoring, like cloth.

Alma Vee has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alma Vee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for tailoring, like cloth.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
To share the financial burden with her husband, Razia, a mother of five children who are all attending school, is a seamstress who sews clothes with perfect measurement, and her clients admire her for her quality of work. Her husband has a salt-selling business and also offers spice-grinding services to his customers, most of whom are grocery shop owners whose spices he grinds to meet the needs of their customers. Razia supports her husband in her spare time by operating the grinding machine.

Razia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy both another grinding machine and salt to provide better services to his customers and increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past five years, and Razia is confident that the loan investment will improve it further.

loans.use: to buy a grinding machine and salt.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
La señora Minerva es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta trabajar y ser independiente. Hace 3 años inicio su negocio de la venta de tortillas de harina y frijoles cocidos que ella misma prepara en la comodidad de su hogar, el cual le beneficia ya que puede estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus pequeños y labores diarias de la casa.
Minerva ve que el negocio esta funcionando ya que variedad de amas de casas o trabajadoras por comodidad o falta de tiempo, le compra su producto ya que es con sabor casero que les encantan. Por los pedidos requeridos la materia prima no le bastece para la elaboración del producto por eso requiere de efectivo para comprar harina, maseca, frijol e ingredientes para poder cubrir sus pedidos de esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Minerva is an enterprising woman who likes to work and be independent.  She started her business making flour tortillas and cooked beans that she makes herself in the comfort of her own home three years ago.  This benefits her because she can watch over her children and do her daily household chores

Minerva has noted that the business is working out because many housewives or employees because of lack of time or just for their own comfort buy her products because they love its home-cooked flavor.  

Because of her pending orders, her on-hand raw materials are insufficient to make her products so this is why she needs cash to buy flour, Maseca brand corn flour, beans and other ingredients to fill her orders and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans and other ingredients.

loans.name: Sixto Arnaldo

texts.es:
El señor Sixto es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es solerto, tiene 27 años de edad. Su profesión es Peluquero, en lo cual trabaja hace ya un buen tiempo. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes los cuales siempre van a cortarse el pelo con el y se podría decir que es como un ingreso seguro.
El se define como un hombre trabajador, luchador y emprendedor. Es muy buen peluquero, por lo cual sus clientes siempre regresan a requerir sus servicios. Una de sus metas es poder ampliar su negocio y con eso poder expandirse más y más.
El solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya para la compra de tijeras, gel, peines y demás insumos necesarios para su negocio. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sixto’s from the city of Curuguaty.  He’s single and 27 years old.  He’s a barber by profession and has been working as such for a long time.  He comments that he has many customers who always go to him for their haircuts and one could say that it’s a secure income.

He defines himself as a hardworking, tenacious and enterprising man.  He’s a very good barber so his customers always return when they need his services.  One of his goals is to be able to enlarge his business and expand more and more.

He is asking Fundación Paraguaya’s help to buy scissors, gel, combs and other supplies needed for his shop.  He is grateful for the opportunity he’s given.

loans.use: to buy scissors, gel, combs and others.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho is 33 years old and a widower. He has been farming on his rice field for almost 10 years to make a living. He also raises pigs to generate additional income. He has been with VisionFund for 3 years. Tho completely repaid his loans from VisionFund. Now he is applying for a fourth loan to grow rice and raise pigs. This loan will enable him to harvest more rice and increase his piglets and earn more income to expand his business.

loans.use: to grow rice and raise pigs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Grecilda

texts.en: Twenty-two-year-old Grecilda is a married woman with 3 children. She is engaged in farming. Grecilda primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also grows banana plants. Grecilda has been in this kind of business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds. She hopes to have a stable income that will help her achieve her goals, like send her children to college and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last six years, he has been operating a business of repairing vehicles to support his family. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to open a tailoring business for his wife. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: to open a tailoring business for his wife.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier a 16ans et le dernier 12ans.
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de friperie depuis 2010. Elle a boutique dans laquelle elle répond à la demande de la clientèle. Elle n’a aucune difficulté dans l’exercice de son activité.
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait élargir l’activité en ouvrant d’autres boutiques. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’occuper de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 34-year old woman, who is a widow. She has two children who are both at school; the eldest is 16 years old and the youngest 12 years old. Afi has been working as a second-hand clothes retailer since 2010. She has a shop where she meets customer demand. She has no problems in running her business.

Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy goods. She wants to reinvest in the business. In the coming years, Afi would like to expand her business by opening other shops. She says that with the profits she makes she is planning to look after her family.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary is a 49-year-old peasant who has been growing maize for more than ten years to earn a living and feed her big family. She lives in a village of the Ratanak Mondul district with her seven children, five of whom are still in school. 

Sary now leads a group of three members applying for their first loan with VisionFund. She is the only lady in the group. She wants to hire workers to harvest her maize crops. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crops and increase her income to better feed her family and also keep her children in school until graduation. In addition, she hopes to have some savings for the future.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest her maize crops

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 29 years old. She is married with three children between 6 and 10, all of whom go to school. Her husband works as a driver. She sells shoes and sugar. With the loan, she will buy more shoes and sugar to sell. Profits will be used to reinvest in the same businesses. She dreams to have a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and sugar to sell

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children.
 
Eric provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Eric has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eric hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Adalid

texts.es:
La señora Adalid se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años , ella nos cuenta que lo que  mas le gusta de su negocio  es atender a sus clientes  y darle la ropa al precio gusto y tener sus pedidos a tiempo para que estén contentos con el servicio que les da.
Tiene la cantidad de  dos hijos es madre soltera pero gracias al apoyo de dios a podido ser padre y madre para sus hijos ya que siempre a trabajado con amor  para que las cosas le salgan bien  y sus hijos la vena feliz y estén orgullosa de ella.
Tambien se dedica a la siembra de plantas de chile.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa para la venta .
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla  a ella ya todas las mujeres solteras que necesitan una  mano  para levantarse y seguir caminando.
texts.en:
Adalid has been selling clothes for two years.  She tells us that what she likes best about her business is tending to her customers and selling clothes at fair prices and to have her orders ready on time so that they will be happy with the service she provides.

She has two children and is a single mother but thanks to God she’s been able to be both father and mother to her children since she’s always worked with love so that things will turn out well and her children will see her happy and be proud of her.  She also grows chili plants.

She requested the loan to buy more clothes to sell.  She thanks the Fundación for supporting her because all single mothers need a hand to get up and continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Poor Nor Good Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the members of the Poor Nor Good lending group from Waterloo, in Sierra Leone. They are very grateful to Kiva lenders and SMT for the loan they have received. 

With the help of Kiva lenders' loans, these entrepreneurs' socioeconomic status has improved tremendously. Each was able to expand his or her business in size and quality. This led to an increase in sales and profit margin. 

Today, they are requesting a new and larger loan, after they successfully repaid their last Kiva loan. 

Osman, who is the leader of this group, is a photographer and also sells photography materials. As with the first loan, Osman is going to use his share of the loan to buy cameras, photo albums, film, etc to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy cameras, photo albums, film, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 54 years old, married with 7 grown up children. She is a member of Korea PCEA church and a member of mother’s guild. She is a part time preacher and prays for people in jail and frequently visits Tumaini children’s home for street children to encourage them. Alice loves farming; she keeps cows, sheep and has a farm where she grows maize, beans, peas and potatoes. Alice gets her income from selling milk to the neighbors and the nearby hotels. Before the drought period, Alice was selling 15 litres of milk from her 2 cows. Unfortunately, she could manage to buy hey and other feeds in the dry season and this made her sell them. The cows did not fetch much due to poor feeding. Alice had established good clientele and clients tell her that her milk was good unlike others who add in water to earn more. It is from this that she wants to give it a second try, well prepared to handle all calamities.

loans.use: Alice wants to buy two hybrid dairy cows.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida M. Garcia is married and mother of 2 children. The money from loan by PRISMA will be invested to buy clothing, shoes, and beauty products such as perfumes, soap, make-up etc. The products will be sold in the various businesses that she visits. The sale of these products will allow her to increase her earnings and to better her family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Armida M. G. es casada, madre de 2 hijos, el dinero que le proporcione PRISMA lo invertirá en la compra de Ropa, zapatos y productos de belleza como perfumes, jabones, pinturas, etc. los cuales venderá en las distintas instituciones que ella visita. La venta de estos productos le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la esituación económica de sus familiares.

loans.use: The money from PRISMA will be invested to buy products which the vender will sell and distribute between her co-workers and in other businesses.

loans.name: Maselina

texts.en:
Maselina is a teenage mother of three children. She runs her business at the flea market at Apia.

She makes porkbuns and mixes drinks to be sold. This is a good location, and she doesn’t need to search for customers because they are always there.

Maselina’s husband does not work, and he is the one who really supports her in doing the business. So when it’s time for Maselina to go to the Center meeting or when she is sick, her husband runs the business.

This is the usual place for all Samoan schoolchildren to gather together to have their last meal of the day before they go home.

loans.use: To purchase cordials, plastic cups, mutton flaps, onions, soy sauce, flour and sugar

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en: It is characteristic to the Vietnamese people to smile even if they are hit hard by destiny. Mrs. N., now 55, was born in the Southern highlands, where as a child she got in contact with Agent Orange during the American war. She was lucky to survive, but she could never give birth to children. Over the years, she survived with the scarce support the Vietnamese government could offer. With a loan from another bank, Mrs. N. opened 2 market stalls for underwear and children's clothes in Do Luong, Nghe An Province, where she moved to live with her husband. She is now asking for a loan of US$200 from TYM Fund to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi T., 29 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur.  She lives in a single family household with her husband and a son.  Mrs. T. and her husband, Mr. Netra T., both work in their own small hotel and her son is studying in primary school.

She, with the help of her husband, opened the small hotel two years ago.  In their hotel they sell newari food.  Now she seeks $150 to buy goods such as meat, food grains, vegetables and other food materials to improve the standards of her shop.  She is ready to pay back her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her shop

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en: María is 31 years old and has three sons, ages 10, 8 and 7 years-old.  She’s living with her partner who helps with her business.  The couple owns a ‘colmadito,’ a grocery store where they sell basic foodstuffs like rice, sugar, juice, beans, and so on.  María started the business two years ago.  Before, she had been working as saleswoman at someone else´s grocery store.  After putting aside money for a long time, and with her partner’s help, she started her own business.  The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies as they running out.  With the extra income from profits, the couple will be able to continue improving their family’s lives.

loans.use: to supply her business with products such as rice, sugar, floor, vegetable oil to satisfy her client´s demands.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells a variety of foods, but mostly she carries bananas and plantains. She attributes her success to the fact that she is the only large-scale supplier of these products in her area. A few times a week, Ama travels to neighboring villages to purchase bananas and plantains. Then she lugs them back by carrying them into tro-tros (a packed Ghanaian bus, converted from mini-vans). Because of this tedious transportation process, many banana and plantain sellers in the area come to her for their stock.

Ama has three children. The youngest, 14, is in middle school, the second youngest, 19, is studying to become an electrician, and the oldest, 26, is finished school.
