La représentante de ce groupe, nommée  Pauline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Pauline est mariée à un mécanicien  du nom de Machoudi. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont trois sont encore à leurs charges. Certains des enfants ne sont pas  scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de onze ans  que Pauline mène comme activité la vente d'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile. C’est la cinquième fois que Pauline sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs reçus ont été  bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle Pauline et l'ensemble des membres du groupe ENTENTE 1 désirent obtenir un autre financement.
texts.en:
The "Entente 1 Group" (harmony) is composed of eight persons, all living in the same neighborhood in Benin. Pauline, the representative of the group, is the woman who is raising her hand in the photo. She is married to Machoudi, a mechanic. They have five children, of whom three are still in their care. Some of the children do not attend school. The parents provide together for the family.

Pauline has been selling akassa (a local dish prepared from corn starch) from her home for nearly eleven years. This is the fifth time that Pauline applies for a loan from the microfinance institution Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid on schedule. Eager to bolster her activity and better meet her customers' demand, Pauline and her fellow group members from Entente 1 would like to get a new loan.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of corn.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Gemma has a food shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue. She has had this business for a year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients for barbecue making.

Gemma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for barbecue making.

loans.name: Abuslom

texts.en: Abuslom is a 29-year-old married man with one child and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in second-hand clothes for four years. He started with 500,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the increasing demands of his customers. His vision is opening another outlet, buying land, and building a house. Abuslom needs the money to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy  clothes to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel Antonio tiene 31 años, es casado vive con la esposa y la hija de 5 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir con la hija a jugar en el parque.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio is 31 years old, he is married and lives with his wife and his 5-year-old daughter. He lives in the precinct of El Progreso in the Chillanes canton.

The member communal bank El Progresso is located 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes. It is made up of 13 members and this is the third loan they are requesting from the cooperative. The members of this communal bank make their living in agriculture planting cacao, corn, plantains, soy beans and cassava. 

Manuel makes his living in agriculture planting cacao, corn, plantains, soy beans and cassava. He does his purchasing in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes his sales at the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help in the purchase of supplies, fertilizers and manure. The loan has helped him to increase his crop production. He has faced challenges such as the workers getting sick as well as pests and disease in the crops. 

His dream is to have his own house. In his free time he likes to go to play in the park with his daughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo, who is 54 years old, is a happy single man engaged in rice farming. He only earned PHP 15,000 net income last harvest in April. To improve his crop production, Wilfredo is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor fees of his hired laborers who transplant the young rice crop. 

For 15 years in farming, Wilfredo tried his best to get a bigger income but due to typhoons and droughts, his harvest was being affected most of the time, especially if there was no available pump well to irrigate his crop when in drought.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Bul

texts.en: Bul, 40 year old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker and their income is $10 per day. She has five children, four of them are studying and one is too young for school. Every month, Bui has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $50 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy construction materials for her husband doing construction. In the future, she wants to repair her house to be better than now.  Bui will work hard to support her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy construction material for her husband doing construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for millet - 2 bags @SLL600,000, pepper - 3 bags @ SLL70,000 and garri - 4 bags @ SLL50,000.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is 34 years old. He is from the village Ganakhleba, Adjara region. Ruslan is married and lives with his family: wife – Nino, two sons (1 year old each) and parents. Ruslan works in the local marble factory. Along with his main job, he is involved in the family agricultural business. They have a milk cow and sell milk locally. At the same time the family members grow various types of fruits and vegetables and sell them to local greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,250 GEL. 

Ruslan requested credit for expansion of the dairy farm. He will purchase an additional milk cow and double the amount of the sold milk. The family will have more income and will be able to provide better care for their children, as well as improve the overall living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Felma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Felma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Felma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She has been running her food sales business for 20 years. She is also engaged in the hog raising business for additional income. 

Celia is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase different kinds of  fish such as milk fish, tilapia, and big head to sell in her village. With this loan, she hopes to expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish such as milk fish, tilapia, and big head to sell.

loans.name: Paosia

texts.en:
Paosia is 63 years old and married with seven children.

Paosia plants and harvests taro (a potato-like tuber) for sale. She has one year of experience in this business.    

Paosia needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 260 WST or US $108 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Paosia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Paosia's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 1 to 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the overall social metric score. For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia is a hardworking businesswoman who is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been running a cafeteria for the last three years to earn a living. Previously, she was selling fruit. In five years, she wants to expand her business. Anastasia dreams of opening a hotel in the future. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more plates, spoons and forks for her business.

loans.use: To buy plates, spoons and forks.

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Silvester used his previous loan to buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. His business improved.  

His desire is to expand his business into wholesale in the future. He dreams of buying a vehicle in five years.

Silvester has requested 110,000 KES to buy cereals, maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy cereals, maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works in a factory, her elder son is a cab driver, and her younger son is a student. She started her business in 2002 by sewing at home. She specializes in curtains and toddler garments. Now that she has been in business for quite a long while, demand for her products is increasing. Therefore, she plans to rent a workshop and buy some equipment. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I always try out new designs for my products, and my customers like it very much. My products sell almost instantly." She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy sewing equipment.

loans.use: To buy sewing equipment.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou est une femme  de 54 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 2 enfants. Elle évolue depuis plus de 15 ans dans la confection d’habits à vendre. C e son t les difficultés de la vie qui l’ont poussé  a choisir cette activité de commerce dans le but de gagner des revenus. Elle  est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2011.Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus à confectionner. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité de commerce pour mieux améliorer ses conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en:
Seynabou lives in Senegal. She is 54 years old and has 2 children. She has been manufacturing clothes for resale for over 15 years. Challenging life circumstances forced her into this line of work so that she could earn a living.

Seynabou has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since June 2011. She is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs so that she can buy fabric to make into clothes. She would like to strengthen her business so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make into clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Eya est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est marié å un agent de sécurité. Elle a 2 enfants.
Eya travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2007. Elle vend de la nourriture pour tous clients dans un bar restaurant. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de  difficulté.
Eya a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des condiments pour la restauration. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Eya voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Eya is 38 years old. She is married to a security officer and has 2 children.

Eya has been a restaurant owner since 2007 and sells food to all the customers in a bar/restaurant. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself, and for the time being it's not a problem.

Eya has asked for her 1st loan from WAGES to buy spices for her restaurant. She would like to reinvest in her work. 

Over the next few years, Eya would like to increase the size of her business. She says she will use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and yams.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Dornod province of eastern Mongolia. Her husband and elder child are employed. Her younger child is a college student. 

Enhtuya operates a grocery retail business. She started her grocery retailing business in 1999 by renting a counter in a market. Over the years she has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that the holiday season is approaching, she needs 500,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to buy more fruit at wholesale prices in order to meet her customers' demand. Her current supplies are not quite enough to run her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 32 years old and married to Eddie. They have three children.

She has operated a clothes boutique for the last eight years from which she earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kes. She is applying for her first loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan to buy more clothes to stock in her boutique and expand her business. She plans to use the profits to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for her boutique.

loans.name: Los Caballeros Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Caballeros esta integrado por 9 personas cada uno con diferente actividad economica, este grupo se caracteriza por ser alegres, amables y trabajadores, ellos viven en una comunidad en la cual hay un hermoso rio de agua azul aperlada y muchos de sus habitantes se dedican a la recoleccion de hule, siembra de arboles y cuidado de sus parcelas.
Emeranda es una de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 29 años, estudios hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y es soltera, ella nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de 10 años con el apoyo de sus padres abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para ganar un poco de dinero extra y no tener que salir a buscar trabajo fuera de su comunidad, Emeranda platica que cuendo inicio fue un poco dificil hacer clientes pero que ya tiene clientela que le hacen el gasto, a ella siempre le gusta tener bien surtida su tienda para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que busquen y vuelvan ha hacerle el gasto, ella a hecho crecer poco a poco su negocio y quiere este credito para invertirlo en la compra de  galletas, aceite, arroz, frijol, cremas, chiles enlatados, cafe, velas, cerillos, papel higienico, pasta dental, jabon, cloro, refrescos y dulces para resurtir su negocio.
ella desea que esta inversion haga crecer mas su negocio y atraiga mas clientes.

los demas integrantes de este grupo son:

Roque venta de abarrotes 
Filiberto venta de abarrotes 
Adrian venta de pan 
Esperanza venta de abarrotes
Julian venta de abarrotes
Daniela venta de abarrotes 
Guadalupe Costura 
Luz Elena Abarrotes
texts.en:
The “Los Caballeros” Group is composed of 9 persons, each with a different economic activity. All the members are known to be happy, friendly, and hard-working. They live in a community where there is a beautiful river with blue pearly water and many of its inhabitants are dedicated to collecting rubber, planting trees, and caring for their farm lands.

Emeranda is a member of this group. She is 29 years old, studied until the 3rd year of secondary school, and is single. She tells us that a little over 10 years ago, with her parents help, she opened a small grocery store, hoping to earn a little extra money and to avoid having to leave her community to look for work. Emeranda says that when she started out, it was a bit difficult to find customers but, now, she has enough clientèle to cover costs. 

She always likes to have a good assortment of merchandise in her store so that her customers always find what they are looking for, making it worthwhile to return. Emeranda has expanded her store little by little and will use this loan to purchase crackers, oil, rice, beans, creams, canned chiles, coffee, candles, matches, toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, clorox, soft drinks, and sweets to restock her store. She wants this investment to encourage business growth and to attract more customers.

The remaining members of the group are:
Roque who sells groceries
Filiberto who sells groceries
Adrian who sells bread
Esperanza who sells groceries
Julian who sell groceries
Daniela who sells groceries
Guadalupe who is a dressmaker
Luz Elena who sells groceries

loans.use: buy cooking oil, rice, beans, creams, canned chiles, coffee, candles, matches, toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, clorox, soft drinks, and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Tito

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su esposa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Francisco no pudo estudiar la carrera de Arquitectura que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta salir de pesca y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su esposa, Francisco trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, él cuenta con pequeño auto el cual utiliza como taxi, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, recorriendo las diversas calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Francisco se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea poder hacer el tarrajeo y puesta de piso de su hogar; de esta manera Francisco tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones, que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto con su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 36 year old man who lives in the city of Camaná with his wife. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to excel. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work to pay his bills, Francisco was not able to study the Architecture career that he wanted to. But he would have liked very much to have done so. In his free time he likes to go fishing and occasionally he cooks a tasty dish Chaufa rice to share with his family.

With a lot of hard work, dedication and the support of his wife, Francisco works offering a taxi transportation service. He has a small vehicle which he uses as a taxi. Every day from the early hours of the morning he starts work, travelling the diverse streets of the city looking for passengers. He works approximately 12 hours and believes that it is going well because of his friendly and respectful dealings with his customers.

Francisco is very grateful for the Kiva loans, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to make improvements to his house. He wants to do the floor and finishing of his house. In this way Francisco will have a house in better conditions, which will give more security to his family and improve their well-being. He will continue working and making an effort to get ahead, together with his family.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She is a secondary school Teacher at Ndonga Secondary School. At group level, Catherine is the secretary and a devoted Christian.

Catherine operates a retail shop which sells clothes, Cosmetics, shoes and ornaments. Her business is progressing very well and on average she gets a profit of about $150 per month. Her children are in school and she does not have problems in raising their school fees because of her business is doing very well. She wants her business to grow and later support her family when she retires from her Teaching service.

loans.use: She would like to buy dresses, skirts and blouses that are fashionable that enhances appeal to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her used clothes business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S. is 35 years old and works in a garment factory making $2/day.  Her husband (pictured here) makes $7/day driving a mototaxi in Phnom Penh.  They have 4 young children that live with them and go to school.  Kim S. will use this loan to build a home that she can rent to factory workers.  She hopes that this new business will allow her to stop working at the garment factory and give her greater daily income.  Her husband would like to start earning more money by driving his motobike, but also by working as a mechanic.  After they pay off this loan, they plan on taking out another loan to build another house for rental.

loans.use: To build a house for rent

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en:
Vuth has been married since 1993 and has four daughters. He has been a motor taxi driver for 7 years. His wife is a housewife. All of their children are studying. Vuth has finished grade 7, while his wife has never studied at school, but they both are polite, honest and reliable.  
Vuth is borrowing US$500 to change the motorbike. With the new motorbike he hopes to increase the revenues and decrease expenses related to repairing and the use of petrol. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike .

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old, is married and has 2 children. Her husband makes a living making and selling chipas, which is a bread-like food made out of a starch, cheese, milk and vegetable oil. He sells chipas on the streets, mostly on the weekends, when he sets up a stand outside the stadium during soccer matches.

Maria runs a small food stand in her home and also helps her husband make chipas. Her food stand has been around for 15 years. They plan to expand the food stand to allow them to sell fast food and ice cream during the summer months. They are requesting this loan to finance the expansion of their small grocery stand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

María tiene 51 años, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Su marido se dedica a la elaboración y venta de “chipas”, la chipa es una comida típica muy consumida en Paraguay, es parecido al pan y está hecho a base de almidón, queso, leche, aceite vegetal, entre otros. Es así como el elabora las chipas y las vende de forma ambulante, especialmente los fines de semana que va a vender a las canchas de futbol durante los partidos. María tiene una despensa en su casa además también ayuda a su esposo en la elaboración de la chipa. El negocio ya lleva 15 años de funcionamiento. Tienen proyectado realizar una pequeña ampliación del espacio físico de la despensa para empezar a vender en la temporada de verano comidas rápidas y helados; para concretar éste proyecto solicita un préstamo de $ 250, ya los presupuestos de mano de obras y materiales a ser utilizados oscilan ese monto.

loans.use: To expand the grocery stand

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: A dedicated LAPO client who has been a member for 6 years, Mrs. Helen O. is 44 years old, married with 5 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She learnt her business from her mother. She  hopes to get the requested amount of $400 to enable her to buy more garri, bush meat, melon and pepper which she sells to people living in her community.

loans.use: To buy more melon pepper, garri & bush meat for sales

loans.name: Ugiljon

texts.en: Ugiljon is a young business lady who has three children and helps her husband to support her family. Her business is to sells different kind of candies and is located in J.Rasulov, district of Khujand, Tajikistan. Her current turnover is fast, and she has many constant clients who come from remote districts and purchase her goods in lots. She also received many orders for the coming New Year party. They prefer her candies because her goods are high quality and show her to be an accurate and honest partner. When she heard about the Kiva program, she decided to take part in it to expand her assortment by buying her goods in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase 10 boxes of chocolate, 20 boxes of fruit drops, and 30 boxes of fruit-paste sweets.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro A. has 2 children, and he wishes to give them the best and to be able to offer them the opportunity to go to college so they can have a better life than they have had up to now. After having worked for a long time at a company where they laid him off due to a personnel reduction, he used his severance pay to invest in a location and supplies to make tacos. With his wife's help, he started to perfect his tacos, and his clients kept coming back to buy them.

Right now, Alejandro thinks it is a good time to grow his business and make improvements so his clients feel more comfortable eating at his restaurant. This is why Alejandro is requesting a credit of $1,125 that he's is willing to pay back in 6 months. With this money, he will be able to buy merchandise to offer new products and make improvements to his business. With your help, Alejandro will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Alejandro A. tiene 2 hijos a los cuales desea darles siempre lo mejor y poder ofrecerles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera para que en su vida les vaya mejor que como les ha ido hasta hoy. Después de haber trabajado mucho tiempo en una empresa los despidieron por recorte de personal y fue así que con el finiquito (dinero que dan cuando despiden al trabajador) invierte en un local y material para poder elaborar tacos. Con la ayuda de su esposa fue como comenzó a darle sazón a sus tacos y así los clientes regresaban a comprarles.

Sin embargo Alejandro considera que hoy es un buen momento para poder crecer su negocio haciéndole adecuaciones para que sus clientes se sientan más cómodos en comer en su local. Es por eso que Alejandro está solicitando un crédito de US $1125 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y así con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para ofrecer nuevos productos y hacerle mejoras al local. Con tu ayuda Alejandro podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: To expand his business and purchase raw material

loans.name: Maria De La Concepci

texts.es:
Doña María comes from a very poor neighborhood called “Batea” in the municipality of “Muelle de los Bueyes”. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children that study at the elementary school. Her husband works as a Security guard.

In order to contribute to the household expenses, she has a small groceries store at her house. She has had this small business since 10 years and the profits it has raised, together with her husband’s income, have allowed her to expand her house and to provide her children with education and a better standard of living.

Doña María now needs to buy more staple commodities as she does not have enough and her customers often ask for this type of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña María, es originaria del municipio de Muelle de los Bueyes de una zona muy pobre llamada La Batea, tiene 39 años, casada, con 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando primaria, el esposo de Doña Maria Concepción trabaja como Guarda de Seguridad.

Para ayudarse con los gastos de la casa Doña Maria atiende una Pulpería en su casa de habitación, tiene 10 años de tener este negocio, y es con esta pulpería y el apoyo de su esposo como ha podido salir adelante y han ido construyendo su hogar y su negocio y también brindarles a sus pequeños hijos educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Doña Maria en estos momentos necesita comprar productos de consumo básicos, ya que en existencia no cuenta con suficientes y sus clientes demandan a menudo dicho productos.

loans.use: To buy more staple commodities to provision her small groceries store

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: Saidu has been running his business for 4 years.  Married with 2 children, the 29-year-old father sells used shoes in the market of Makeni town in Sierra Leone.  With his previous loan from SMT, he was able to acquire a space for selling.  With a new market stall he would like to increase his stock and is requesting for a loan of $350.

loans.use: Saidu now has a space for his business, but needs more merchandise to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Faga Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 7 women of Faga on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Faamaimauaso T. (27, married, 2 children) will purchase knives, timber, varnish and other materials to produce fine mats.

Iseaso M. I. (37, married, 4 children) is starting a bingo business. She needs a loan to purchase bingo sets. Leatuvai T. (31, married, 1 child) will purchase a fence, taro roots, knives, a filing (knife sharpener) and planting sticks to produce cocoa.

Mele T. (37, married, 5 children) will purchase chicken legs, soy sauce, onions, Chinese onions, sauce and tin foil to bake and sell BBQ.

Merita A. (38, married, 9 children) will purchase a fishing boat, 2 nets, flashlight, a spear and a pair of goggles to fish and sell the catch 3 days a week.

Paula T. (36, married, 4 children) will purchase flour, sugar, oil, egg, baking soda, baking powder, yeast and other ingredients to bake pies, donuts, buns, etc..

Tolopa S. (45, married, 6 children) will purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, a knife, filings and an axe to cultivate and sell taro, bananas and tuamu, etc..

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, a weed killing sprayer, bush knives, etc

loans.name: Proeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Proeung S. is 21 years old and makes a living sewing and weaving clothes that she sells to people in her area. She also makes clothing to order for customers. Her business earns about $2 to $3 a day. Her husband earns about $4 a day selling sand. In Cambodia, people use sand for many reasons -- to fill ponds, in the foundations of their houses, or in industrial production. Usually, they get sand from the bottom of a river or from special plots of land.

Mrs. Proeung S. has applied for a loan to buy materials and cloth for her business. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy a plot of land where her husband can dig sand to sell for a profit.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a tailoring business and a plot of land.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Francisica has a business selling coffee and ayote (squash) seeds in small quantities in the market of San Martín Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango. She learned this business from her mother and has had it for 25 years. She buys seeds and coffee in bulk and sells them in small units.

Her older daughter helps her with her business, which has in turn helped her four children. Her husband does not live in Guatemala; it has been many years since he went to the United States and he sends her a little help.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Francisca tiene un negocio de venta por menor de café y de semillas de ayote o calabazas, en el mercado de San Martín Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango. Este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, y tiene 25 años de tenerlo. Ella compra la semilla y el café por mayor y lo vende en unidades pequeñas. Su hija mayor le ayuda con su negocio, de esta forma ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos. Su esposo no vive en Guatemala, hace muchos años viajo a los Estados Unidos, y le envía un poco de ayuda.

loans.use: Investment in seeds to harvest coffee and ayote (squash)

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Mrs. Dy S., 42, earns around $5 per day by making rice wine and raising pigs, Her husband, Mr.Houn Hoeurn, 46, is a soldier. They live in Khvean Village, Siem Reap Province and have four children. One of their children is working for a shopping center and is earning around $50 per month. Because of their family’s growing expenses and because they would like to improve their income, Mrs. Dy S. is seeking a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorcycle for family use. She plans to use remainder of the loan to purchase pig food for her pig-raising business. The loan will help to reduce the family’s expenses so it will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use in family and she plan to use remainder of loan purchase pig food for her pig raising business

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto, the “Rosales” Association works in the Senkata Center. It is made up of 12 people that perform their duties with much determination. The group carries out different activities like the sale of CDs, cosmetics and clothing and they are also seamstresses. Within the association they know each other really well – they are partners and solidly united. Nowadays, the majority of the women sell their products in the streets with the help of their families. Rosa, for example, works alongside her father. They live in an area very far away and return each night to their home. It’s a little dangerous and for that reason her father accompanies her and always takes care of her.

The “Rosales” Association wants additional credit to be able to purchase or rent permanent stands in the main markets and/or fairs in the city where they will have guaranteed sales and make more money.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto, en el centro focal de Senkata trabaja la asociación “Rosales” formado por 12 personas que realizan sus actividades con mucho empeño. El grupo tiene diferentes actividades algunas se dedican a la venta de Cds ,venta de cosmeticos, venta de ropa, también son costureras . Dentro la asociación todos se conocen muy bien, son compañeros y solidarios. Actualmente, la mayoría de ellas realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante con la ayuda de su familia, Ross por ejemplo trabaja al lado de su padre, ellos viven en una zona muy alejada y retornar por la noche a su casa es un tanto peligroso .por eso su papa la acompaña y cuida siempre. La asociación Rosales quiere mayor crédito para poder comprar o alquilar puestos fijos en principales mercados y/o ferias de la ciudad con lo que tendrían ventas seguras y generarían mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase and/or rent permanent stands in the city's markets

loans.name: Njuma's General Store Group

texts.en:
NJ., 20, is married with a one-year-old child. She has been a shop owner since 2007. She works from 6AM to 10PM daily and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

NJ. is requesting a loan to buy more inventory items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal & banana sales, firewood sales, chips sales and shop ownership.

loans.use: To buy more inventory items for resale.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Madame KUE–ADJA Afi, originaire d’Aklakou Hétchavi, est née en 1971. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle a pour activité la vente de la farine de manioc appelé "gari". 

Un commerce qu’elle a acquis depuis son jeune âge. De ce dernier, lui procure un revenu maigre, insuffisant aux besoins de la famille et spécialement à la scolarisation de ses deux enfants.

Dotée d’une expérience de 15 ans, cette activité n’a jamais trahi. Elle sollicite un crédit pour relancer son commerce d’où une amélioration des conditions de vie au sein du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi K. who comes from Aklakou Hétchavi was born in 1971. Married and the mother of 2 children, her business is selling the manioc flour known as "gari".

This is a business she learned at a young age. From it she draws a meager income, insufficient for the needs of the family and especially for the cost of sending her children to school.

As she has the benefit of 15 years of experience, this business has never let her down. She is requesting this loan to get her business going stronger so that her family will benefit from an improvement of living conditions in her household.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling manioc flour

loans.name: Comlanvi Mathias

texts.fr: Né en 1966 à Aklakou, Monsieur A. Comlanvi Mathias est un revendeur très dynamique ayant le sens de l’entreprenariat. C'est un conducteur de btaxi moto, marié et père de 5 enfants. Pour répondre aux besoins sans cesse croissants de ceux-ci, il décide d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire grâce à l’achat d'une nouvelle moto pour le transport. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie de ses enfants et de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Aklakou, Mr. Comlanvi Mathias A. is a very energetic retailer with an entrepreneurial sense. A motorbike taxi driver, he is married and has five children. To meet their ever-growing needs, he decided to raise his level of business through the purchase of a new motorbike for transportation. It will enable him to improve his situation and the standard of living of his children and family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto taxi

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres, ya que aún es soltero y no tiene compromiso. Joven suspicaz y trabajador, ha visto en el negocio de la confección de bolsos una buena fuente de ingresos económicos, es por eso que desde hace 10 años viene realizando este peculiar trabajo. Jaime trabaja por pedidos que le hacen diferentes personas, y también para exportar los bolsos al extranjero, es así que el tiene que trabajar mucho para lograr las cantidades que le solicitan, siendo su trabajo muy rentable. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más tejidos artesanales para elaborar  sus bolsos y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Jaime is 24 years old. He lives at home with his parents since he is still single and is not engaged. A thoughtful and hard working young man, he has seen the business of making bags as a good fountain of economic income. As a result, for the last ten years, he as worked at this job. Jaime completes orders made by different people, as well as exports bags to foreign places. Consequently, he has to work a lot in order to satisfy the quantities requested. He feels his work is very profitable. This is his first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he is requesting, he will purchase more artisanal embroidered fabric to make his bags and increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more artisanal embroidered fabric to make his bags.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Married with a child who is currently in school, Grace is 27 years old. Grace supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing. Selling used clothing has a very big market in Ghana, as brand-new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Grace has been in this business for the past 3 years. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door-to-door sales. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used things to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to trade.

She is member of the group called Ephesians Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Maria Aurelia

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro 
Es separada tiene  43 años, dos hijos de 22 y 19 años están estudiando  superior.
Hace cinco años que Maria tiene una tienda, al principio solo atendía  los sábados y domingos, ahora abre la tienda todos los días, tiene una Hija que la ayuda todos los días. Desde que la tuvieron que  operar le preocupa más su negocio,
Desde que recibe los préstamos la han ayudado bastante se siente apoyada.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1400 dinero que será invertido en la compra  de  una puerta y la compra de un exhibidor y congeladora (de segunda) 
El sueño que tiene es construir su casa y que su negocio sea mas grande, mejorar para ayudar a sus hijos en su carrera.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro (Women of the Future). She is 43 years old, separated, and has two children, aged 22 and 19, who are pursuing higher education. She has had a shop for five years, which at first she only opened on weekends but now operates every day and her daughter helps her. Since she has begun running it she has had to pay more attention to the business. The loans she has received have helped her feel supported. Maria needs a loan of 1400 with which she will buy a door and a second-hand display case and freezer. It is her dream to build a home and expand her business to better help her children with their careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 1400 to buy a display case and freezer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary, vive en la calle Inca Roca  Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive  en la casa de sus padres, Ella es casada y tiene  una hija de dos años, su esposo recientemente consiguió un empleo como vendedor de artefactos eléctricos a comisión.

Se dedica al comercio informal en su puesto callejero en una de las ferias de la ciudad vendiendo ropa interior de señoras. Negocio que se pone en movimiento a partir de las 18 horas. Momento que esta permitido por la Alcaldía para la instalación de dicha feria.



El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería (ropa interior de mujer), y así mejorar sus ingresos

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Mary lives on the street Inca Roca, Rio Seco, in the city of El Alto. She lives in her parents’ house. She is married and has a daughter of 2, her husband recently got a job selling electronic parts by commission. Mary sells goods in her location on the street in one of the markets of the city. She sells women’s underwear, a business of 18 hours that she started once she gained permission from the mayors office to install her stand in the market she mentioned. This loan will be used to buy the highest quality merchandise (women’s undergarments) and to improve her business by doing so. This is her first loan with Impro, the evaluation that she completed qualifies her to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more women's undergarments to sell in a market of El Alto, a city.

loans.name: Adiru

texts.en:
Adiru C. is currently in the business of selling fruits like guava and mangoes at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Adiru is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has one child, and her child do not go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a tractor that will be used for plowing at the farm.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a tractor for plowing on the farm

loans.name: Lida,

texts.es:
Lida siempre ha trabajado en el comercio D. confección y compostura D. ropa. Anteriormente ofrecía sus servicios a empresas D. ropa en varios centros comerciales, como el centro comercial Gamarra D. Lima que actualmente está tratando D. crecer con sus micro empresarios para lograr un mayor mercado en el extranjero.
Como es separada, durante todo el tiempo que sus 4 hijos eran menores D. edad nunca pudo ahorrar para invertir en empezar un negocio propio, por que todas sus ganancias las utilizaba para cubrir los gastos D. la crianza D. sus hijos. Sin embargo cuando ellos crecieron y se hicieron independientes económicamente Lida pudo cumplir su sueño D. tener su negocio propio.
Uno D. sus primeras inversiones fue comprar maquinas industriales D. confección y compostura D. ropa, ya tiene 4. DesD. hace 4 años tiene un puesto alquilado en un centro comercial donD. venD. la ropa que ella misma produce, y durante la temporada alta contrata a una persona para que la ayuD. en la producción. 
Ahora sus ganancias las utiliza para cubrir sus gastos personales y pala apoyar a su mamá que vive en Juliaca. Recién empezó a sacar préstamos por EDAPROSPO, solo hace ½ año, pero ya tiene planificado usarlos para en un futuro poder comprar un local propio para estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lida has always worked in the business of making and repairing clothes. Previously she offered her services to clothing business in various shopping centers, like the File Halter shopping center that is currently trying to grow its small businesses in order to achieve a greater market abroad. As she is separated, during the whole time that her four children were underage she could never save enough to invest to begin her own business, because all of her profits were used to cover the expenses of raising her children. Nevertheless, when they grew and became independent economically, Lida could begin her dream of having her own business. One of her first investments was to buy industrial sewing machines to make and repair clothes. She already has four. Since four years ago, she has a rented a space in a shopping center where she sells the clothes she produces. During the busy season, she contracts a person to help with production. Now she uses her profits to cover her personal expenses and to help support her mother who lives in Juliaca. She began to take out loans with EDAPROSPO, an affiliate of Kiva, six months ago. But she already has plans to use her loans in the future in order to buy a local space to stabilize her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a showcase to better display her products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys O. is 40 years old and married with four children.  She sells stockfish to her customers.  Gladys is requesting a N50,000 loan to purchase more stockfish to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more stockfish to sell.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina A. is married with 3 children and received an education through junior high school. Since 1997 Georgina has worked as a trader in Elmina, selling goods such as food items, utensils and rubbers.  While Georgina works as a trader, her husband is employed as a mason. Georgina uses her income to help her husband in paying for her family’s expenses.  She will use the loan to purchase additional goods such as food items, utensils and rubbers in order to expand her business.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D. is 47 years old and has been a widow for five years. She has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. According to her, one of her daughters is currently in primary school. The first son has completed university, while the rest are learning trades. Elizabeth lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works very hard to provide for the family. Elizabeth is a baker. She bakes bread. She hawks to sell the bread in her community. Elizabeth also distributes the greater part of the bread to retailers and beverage sellers. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from the local market. She has been in this business for over 30 years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk. Elizabeth hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour

loans.name: Alida

texts.fr: L. Alida est née le 17 Juillet 1975 à Djassin un quartier périphérique de la ville de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN; d’où elle est originaire. Alida est mariée à HOUESSOU François un commerçant. Alida est mère de deux enfants dont une fille et un garçon tous scolarisés. Alida vendait des tissus à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C’est par manque de moyens financiers conséquents pour asseoir véritablement cette activité de vente de tissus qui a amené Alida à l’abandonner. Depuis quatre (4) ans Alida vend en gros différentes sortes de savons et des sachets toujours à Dantokpa. Alida a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Actuellement, Alida sollicite un quatrième crédit pour continuer de développer son activité afin de fidéliser sa clientèle.
texts.en:
L. Alida was born on July 17, 1975 in Djassin, an outlying district of the city of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin, to where she traces her roots. She is married to HOUESSOU François, a merchant. She is the mother of two children, a girl and a boy who are both in school. Alida used to sell cloth at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. But due to a lack of substantial funding for really establishing this cloth-selling business, she was obliged to abandon it. For four years, she has been selling different kinds of soaps and bags, still at Dantokpa, at the wholesale level. She has already benefited from three loans with ALIDÉ to develop her business. Currently, she's requesting a fourth loan to continue developing her business, in order to earn the loyalty of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 boxes of soap and three bales of bags

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina sells sarongs in various colours. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with three children and she is 40 years old. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet works very hard selling dresses and clothes for women in the Nyamasaria neighborhood of Kisumu. She has been working for one year, and has ideas about changing her business. She would like to begin selling in Kisumu’s Oile market, which would allow her to deal with mostly cash-paying customers. Violet finds that she currently faces problems with customers purchasing on credit and not following through with payment. She would like to eliminate this risk.

Violet is the industrious mother of two children, aged 9 and 7, and she hopes that—together with her husband’s income from mechanic work—she can provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: New Stock of Clothing to Sell

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: M. Munira is 34 years old and she and her husband have two children. To improve her family position and to support her husband with family expenses, Munira started her business six years ago. She bakes “lepeshka” (the national bread: circular flat loaves with a decorated top) at home. Having many customers, Munira sells the majority of her products just from her place. Munira is doing her best to ensure her children have the best future. Now she requests 800 USD that she is planning to spend on the purchase of flour wholesale as required for her business. Munira is grateful for all supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour wholesale for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Daysi Dominga

texts.es: Doña Daysi López, tiene la edad de 48 años de edad, reside en el barrio 22 de enero en la capital de Managua,  costurera desde hace veinte años, tiene dos hijos que trabajan en estesa, sus planes es mejorar las condiciones de vida,  inicio con recursos que su esposo dio, con este crédito va comprar ropa y tela para hacer sus vestidos. Da las gracias Afodenic por el préstamo ya que a través de ellos, ha logrado estar estable en la costura y también ha podido lograr cuidar a su esposo que ha estado mal de salud. Su objetivo es poder  comprar otra maquina para crecer en inventario y poder hacer los encargos a menos tiempo.
texts.en:
Doña Daysi López is 48 years old. She lives in the town 22 de Enero, in the capital of Managua. She has been a seamstress for twenty years and has two children who work for Estesa. Her plans are to improve her living conditions. She started with resources, which her husband provided. With this credit, she will purchase clothes and fabric to make dresses. She thanks Afodenic for the loan. Through these loans, she has been able to achieve stability in her work and also take care of her husband who has been in poor health. Her objective is to be able to purchase another machine in order to increase her inventory and be able to fill orders in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothing and fabrics to make clothing

loans.name: Nuestra Sra Del Rosario Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Nuestra Señora del Rosario” están representadas por la señora Clariza y conformada por  13 miembros que residen en el mismo barrio, la mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la elaboración D. platos D. comida como chicharrón y carnes a la parrilla el resto se dedica  ala elaboración D. pan, a la venta D. ropa, al lavado D. ropa y la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos entre los varones se dedican a la construcción D. viviendas. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El destino del financiamiento es para adquisición D. herramientas mas modernas para realizar un pan D. mayor calidad en menor tiempo, también para la adquisición D. mercadería mas acorD. a las exigencias del mercado en especial para el cambio D. temporada y también para el emprendimiento D. nuevos negocios que ayuden a generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Nuestra Señora del Rosario” (Our Lady of the Rosary) is led by Sra. Clariza and consists of 13 members who live in the same neighborhood. Most of the members prepare dishes such as fried pork skins and grilled meats. Other members make bread, sell clothing, wash clothes, and sell cosmetics by catalog. The men in the group are engaged in housing construction. The level of business competition is high but the members are experienced enough to know that they must offer a variety of products in order to succeed.

Their loan will be used to acquire more modern tools for making high-quality bread in less time. They will also purchase merchandise based on their customer demands in time for the new season. Their new business ventures will help generate more income for their families. The members are working together on their first cycle, but have previous experience with other solidarity groups. Therefore, they promise to give everything they have in order to move forward with responsibility and unity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maleha Group

texts.en:
Maleha wants to take out a loan for her husband's general store. Ghallam Nabe wants to take out a loan for his general store. Qayes wants to take out a loan for his gas station.

Maleha is the leader of the Maleha Group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for business development. They are requesting a group loan 42,000 afghani. They are very happy to have this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To develop their businesses

loans.name: Yo Tengo Fe Group

texts.es:
Dulce María T. J. de 38 años de edad, es la coordinadora del Grupo Yo tengo Fe. Quien posee un taller de sastrería muy humilde pero de gran calidad en cuanto a los productos que elabora.

Desde hace 15 años, Dulce aprendió este oficio, trabajando en un taller como operaria. Cuando sintió que poseía la capacidad para hacerlo sola, con la ayuda de su familia (Sus hijos de 19 y 22 años y su esposo). Tomaron la decisión de poner un taller propio donde trabajaran y salieran adelante con sus conocimientos.

Actualmente su meta es lograr la adquisición de maquinas industriales y sustituir algunas de pedales que posee. Su negocio lo inicio con capital propio y aunque tuvo que enfrentar el hecho de que con la crisis económica en honduras perdió más de 14,000 córdobas en mercadería que exportaba, con sus ahorros y disciplina hoy ha alcanzado recuperarse de esta pérdida.

Darling T. trabaja en la compra de frutas y verduras en Masaya para luego llevarla a vender ha Matagalpa, cuando viene de regreso trae frijoles para venderlos en Masaya y así incrementar sus ingresos. Lorenzo posee un vivero donde compra y vende plantas.
texts.en:
Dulce María T. J. is 38 years old and the coordinator for the group “Yo Tengo Fe” (I Have Faith). She owns a modest tailoring shop where she manufactures high quality products.

Fifteen years ago, Dulce learned her trade working as a seamstress at a textile factory. When she decided to work on her own, she had the support of her family (her husband and children, ages 22 and 19). They made the decision to build Dulce her own workshop where she could use her knowledge to get ahead.

Today her goal is to acquire industrial machines and replace the pedals on her existing equipment. She started her business with her own money. Due to the economic crisis in Honduras, she recently lost 14,000 Nicaraguan córdobas on merchandise she exported (due to the exchange rates). Through saving and discipline, she has been able to recover from that loss.

Darling T. buys fruits and vegetables in Masaya and sells them in Matagalpa. She brings back with her beans that she sells in Masaya in order to increase her earnings. Lorenzo owns a nursery where he buys and sells plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to fulfill customer orders

loans.name: Las Escogidas 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
Gina is a 45-year-old borrower from Batey Alegria, a small community outside San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Gina is a coordinator for her group, Las Escogidas (The Chosen), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Gina lives with three of her six children. Her oldest children work in exporting, transportation, and woodworking, and her youngest children are currently in school. Gina lives in a batey, a rural community built by sugar companies for their workers. Gina and her family have a difficult life – little access to electricity, no running water or medical services, and insufficient roads. Bateyes are filled with some of the poorest people in not just the Dominican Republic, but the entire Western Hemisphere.

Despite these difficulties, Gina runs a successful pica pollo, or fried chicken stand. Pica pollo is one of the most popular foods in the Dominican Republic, and Gina knows she will always have a demand for her product. With her loan, Gina plans to buy and raise young chickens, as well as buying other foods such as rice, plantains, bananas, and juices.

Gina is very thankful for this loan, her third with Esperanza, and she hopes to continue her successful borrowing in the future. Thank you for lending to Gina and Las Escogidas Group!

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and rice, bananas and juices

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia M. is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Antonia owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $45 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Antonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for working capital to purchase additional inventory. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her eighth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita P. is from the municipality of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old, married, and has four adult children.

In 2003, Pablita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase coconuts. This loan will be her tenth from PMPC.

Pablita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business in the market. She has been in this kind of business for over thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts

loans.name: Estrellito

texts.en:
This is Estrellito S., 42, a hardworking father to four children. Two of the children are in high school and the other two in grade school.  He is married to Imelda, 43, a plain housewife. This simple family lives in Ibayong Ilat Kaong, Silang, Cavite.

Estrellito is raising pigs to get an income to support his family, especially their children’s education.  He brings his pigs to the butcher when they are ready for slaughtering.  He also manages a motorized tricycle transport and has a few boarding rooms for rent.  He earns more than P5, 000.00 a week from these business activities.

He became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative last year in 2008.  He applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of P12,000.00 to purchase bulk supplies of feedstock.  He laments that prices of commercial feed for livestock has gone up since the many calamities that came.

Estrellito dreams of seeing his children finish their school.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of feedstock for pigs

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 37-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Hussein has had a snack food restaurant for over two years now. He does all types of sandwiches and burgers; he also makes “falafel” sandwiches and “kebab”.

Falafel is very popular in the Middle East as a fast food. As a main dish, it is served as a sandwich, stuffed in pita bread with lettuce, tomatoes, and tahini. As an appetizer, it is served on a salad, or with hummus and tahini. As for the Kebabs or also known as "shish kebab": Shish kebab is translated to 'skewer of grilled meat' and includes many variations of the kebab; therefore, there are several spellings, such as kabob, kebob, kebap, kabab, and kebab.

When Hussein first started his business, he had to pass through some financial issues because he wasn’t really known and didn’t have his own customers. Hussein decided on doing his business because of his experience. Hussein requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his restaurant and a coffee machine. This machine will help him to start serving coffee and expand his snack food into a real restaurant. This is his second loan and he repaid the first loan on time. His customers are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his restaurant and a coffee machine

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. makes a living selling bags of water at Chapel Square near Elmina.  She has received a high-school education, is married and has three children. Her husband makes a living as a trader. Florence has been selling bags of water since 2000, and works hard to help her husband support their children and pay school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to buy more bags of water to sell. Florence hopes to use additional income she earns to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 42 años, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos: Julisssa tiene 12 años, Yelsin tiene 9 años, Boris tiene 7 años y Jerónimo tiene cinco años. Ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco.
  
Nieves vende productos secos como cebada, trigo y maíz. Nieves nos cuenta que tiene que llevar sus productos a vender, los días viernes al mercado de Urubamba, los días sábados al mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco y los domingos a la ciudad de Calca. 

Nieves es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas, abono y para fumigar sus chacras. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nieves, 42, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” communal bank. She lives with her life partner and has 4 children: Julissa, 12, Yelsin, 9, Boris, 7 and Jerónimo, 5. They live in Urubamba province, Cusco department. Nieves sells dry products like: barley, wheat and corn. She tells us that she has to transport her products every Friday to sell in Urubamba's market, on Saturdays to the market in Huancaro in Cusco, and on Sundays to the city of Calca. Nieves is a hard-working, enterprising mother who needs funding to buy more seed, natural fertilizer, and to fumigate her farmlands. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, natural fertilizer and to fumigate her farmlands.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has worked as a taxi driver since 2006, servicing his town and its surroundings. Married with children who are still going to school, Mohamad works hard because his only purpose is to continue his children's education to the university level. His wife is helping him to achieve this goal. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,000 to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married with two sons. He is a farming entrepreneur from Gladkovka, in south-eastern Ukraine. He owns a greenhouse and grows vegetables for sale in his region. Oleg launched this enterprise 5 years ago. Ever since his business has grown and flourished much. Presently, Oleg has 50,000 Grivnyas invested in this venture. 

Oleg is requesting a 9,000 Grivnya loan to repair his greenhouse and purchase a supply of firewood (acacia and pine wood) to heat his greenhouse. He hopes to make his greenhouse more energy-efficient and is focused on sustainable agriculture. These practices would help him reduce costs and gain higher profit as a result.

loans.use: to do some repairs on his greenhouse and purchase firewood

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Emilia es casada, tiene 46 años y 7 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella, Emilia vive en la comunidad de Chiara, tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además se dedica a la agricultura.
Emilia necesita 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
Emilia sueña con construir su casa de material noble y tener mas capital para su negocio.
texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the communal bank "Milenio." She is married, 46 years old, and has 7 children, 4 of whom live with her. Emilia lives in the community of Chiara. She has a store in her house that she operates daily where she sells groceries, including vegetables and meat, and general merchandise. She also works in agriculture. Emilia needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy school supplies. She dreams of building her own home made of quality materials, and having more capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
A dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2006, Luzviminda is grateful for access to the capital that supports her entrepreneurial dreams. Luzviminda has achieved solid performance with her regular attendance to group meetings and her steady repayments. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Luzviminda is hopeful that the family business will continue to flourish. With continuing success, the business will deliver stable revenue, fund the education of her five children until they finish college, and will support improvements in her family’s quality of life.

To provide additional income for her family, Luzviminda would like to receive a new loan of 30,000PHP to expand the family’s fishing business. With the loan, she will purchase raw materials including fish cages, bamboo, and nets. With this additional equipment, Luzviminda believes their fish inventory will increase thus generating higher income and profits from the business.
 
Luzviminda M. is 50 years old, married and has five children. She lives in the coastal town of Talim Island, Binangonan Rizal with her husband, Severino.  Her husband has been engaged in the fishing business for almost five years. This business supports the family.  

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials including fish cages, bamboo, and nets.

loans.name: Marcela Alexander

texts.es: Marcela Alexander tiene 22 años, ella es una mujer ejemplar y muy negociante, por lo que su actividad es una pulpería. Ella desde hace mas de 4 años es conocida por la Fundación como una excelente cliente, por lo que está muy contenta de tener un medio que le genere ingresos y ha demostrado que puede salir adelante ella siempre busca la forma de cómo atraer a sus clientes para que siempre su negocio este activo. Una de sus metas es que su negocio sea más grande. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, detergentes y pan.
texts.en:
Marcela Alexander is 22 years old. She is an exemplary woman who is very businesslike, and her activity is a general store. For more than 4 years she has been known by the Fundación as an excellent client, because she is very pleased to have a way to generate income and she has demonstrated that she can succeed. She is always on the lookout for ways to attract new customers, and for this reason her business is always busy. One of her goals is to make her business grow larger. The loan that she requests will be used to buy sweets, natural drinks (juices), detergents and bread.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to stock her general store with sweets, drinks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 52 years old and married with three children. She distributes rice to earn a living. She buys rice from farmers directly at a lower price and sells it in Nairobi to earn a profit.   She was previously running a retail shop before she ventured into this business.  

Cecilia saves her money with her group in Faulu Kenya called `Mla jasho’ which guarantee loans to its members.  In their groups they are offered training by Faulu Kenya and she appreciates that, for she has learnt to keep business records.   She hopes to grow her business and open a general store in the future. She has many customers and she is not able to meet their demands due to her limited capital.  She has therefore requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her inventory of rice.

loans.use: To add to her stocks of rice for sale

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Âgée de 50 ans, Madame Aminata Kassongué est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses  enfants dans le quartier Kouloukoro  de la ville  de Koutiala. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de brillante étude,  Aminata s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus avec l’achat vente de diverses marchandises telle les condiments  et  la farine de blé. 
Elle exerce cette activité depuis plus de 11 ans. 
Pour pouvoir combattre les petites ruptures qu’elle subit  fréquemment, qui la fait perdre de la clientèle, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle  il y a 6 ans.  
Après avoir  8 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) tous correctement  payés,   elle est à son 3e  prêt individuel dont les deux précédents ont été correctement  remboursés.  
Elle compte acheter  des sacs de farine de blé auprès des grossistes à Koutiala et effectue sa vente  au marché Kouloukoro et à son domicile à une clientèle  essentiellement  féminine, au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec le renforcement de son fonds de commerce, elle compte sur un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA  par mois  qu’elle envisage  utiliser  pour payer les  intérêts du prêt de Soro, participer aux dépenses familiales et s’entretenir elle même ainsi que ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Kassongué is 50 years old, married and mother to eight children. She lives with her husband and children in the Kouloukoro district of the town of Koutiala. Since she did not have the chance to shine in her studies, Aminata became interested at an early age in income-generating activities, notably with the purchase and sale of various goods such as condiments and wheat flour. She has been carrying out this activity for more than 11 years. In order to overcome the small ruptures in stock which she experiences frequently and which lead to her losing customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso six years ago, to be able to satisfy her customer demand.
