Having had eight group loans, all of which she repaid on time, she is now on her third individual loan (the two previous ones having also been repaid on time). She is planning on buying sacks of wheat flower from wholesalers in Koutiala; she sells her goods at the Kouloukoro market and at home to a customer base which is predominantly feminine, for cash and on credit. With the reinforcement of her business, she expects to make an average profit of 75,000FCFA per month, which she plans to use to pay the interest on her loan from Soro, to contribute to her family's expenses and to look after herself as well as her children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita D. is from the village of Camanucan. She is 55 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Esterlita owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel G., 39, has been managing her own tailoring shop for quite some time now. She is married to Jemmy G., a tailor, and they are blessed with three children. Marifel is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.

Marifel has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her tailoring business.

 To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 16,000 Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital to expand her business by buying materials needed to continue operations of the tailoring shop. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for a tailoring shop

loans.name: Nadeem

texts.en:
Nadeem Q. is a father of two sons and one daughter. Nadeem tried many jobs, but he didn't succeed in keeping any due to the hard conditions in Palestine, in addition to the economic crisis.

Nadeem decided to start his own business and guarantee a stable income for his family. He started a small restaurant that sells traditional Palestinian meals. The restaurant is prospering, so Nadeem decided to buy a refrigerator so he could to start preparing extra meals in response to his increasing demand.

Nadeem is planning to rent a better place for his restaurant than the one appears in the picture above, where he stands. By using his business returns, he thinks he can start saving in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Honiwel

texts.en:
Honiwel S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 27 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Honiwel owns and operates a business providing cellphone repair services and selling cellphone accessories to local community members. Honiwel has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Honiwel joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Sope Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE NABY est créé en juin 2010 lors de la scission du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 11 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage.

Madame Nogaye D. à debout à gauche de la photo, de thioup noir mauve vêtue et emmitouflée d'écharpe est la responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Elle achète des gousses d'arachide, les décortique avant de procéder à la transformation. Elle vend son produit dans les marchés et à domicile.

Avec son prêt elle va acheter de l'arachide pour poursuivre son activité de transformation d'huile.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Sope Naby solidarity group was created in June 2010 when the « Banc Villageois » loan group was dissolved. It is made up of 11 women from the same village, who got together through personal affinities and as neighbors. Mrs. Nogaye D., the group responsible, can be seen on the left of the picture, wearing a black and purple thioup and wrapped in a scarf. She is married and the mother of five children. She processes and sells peanut oil. She buys unshelled peanuts, and has them unshelled before processing. She sells her product in local markets and does home delivery. She will use her loan to buy peanuts and continue her oil-processing business. Her objective is to assist her husband in handling the various family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy peanuts

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en:
Nijat A. is 22 years old and is not married. Due to his family’s financial situation, he did not have many opportunities to study at the university. That’s why, after finishing school, he tried to become independent and to find a way of earning money in order to help his parents with the family’s expenses.

Since 2008, Nijat has supported his family through his efforts and started his business selling cell phones. His monthly income is about 300-350 Azerbaijani manat (AZN). He believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family.

Currently, his business is doing well, but Nijat needs to increase his stock of goods in order to serve the demands of his clientele. With this purpose in mind, Nijat requests 1000 AZN. He is grateful to all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: purchase more cell phones

loans.name: Sokkhy's Group

texts.en: Miss Sokkhy N., age 40, is the village bank president having been elected by its eleven members in Ta Nu village, Kandal province. While each member of this village loan will use their portion to support a different purpose, they are all responsible for the others' loans should they default. Sokkhy N. is a single farmer who owns three hectares of land that she uses to cultivate rice. She works very hard to support the eight members of her family. In order to increase her income, she will use the loan to buy piglets to raise, and for pig food.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and for pig food.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor Y Paz se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

La señora María tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su propia casa, también vende algunos medicamentos y tarjetas telefónicas que le dejan unas pequeñas ganancias. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00, trabaja sola y en cuanto a sus productos los compra en Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su propio local.

Tiene 54 años y está casada hace 32 años, de esta relación tuvo 7 hijos aunque nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que uno murió en un accidente, tres de sus hijos viven con ella los mismos que junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mas productos para la venta, especialmente arroz ya que se viene una temporada en la que escasea y no quiere quedarse sin este grano que es muy vendido en el país.

Ella es socia fundadora del Banco y le encanta por la seriedad que tienen para con sus clientes.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para movilizarse.
texts.en:
The “Amor y Paz” (Love and Peace) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Calderón parish. Most of the residents of this location are farmers and raise animals to sell. María has a grocery store installed in her home; she also sells a few medicines and telephone cards which provide some small profits. She is open for business every day from 6am until 10pm. She works by herself. She buys her products in Portoviejo and some are delivered directly to her store. She is 54 years old, has been married for 32 years and she had 7 children although she relates sadly that one of her children died in an accident. Three of them live with her and, like her husband, are farmers. She will use this loan to buy more stock items for her store, especially rice since a season is approaching when it becomes scarce and she doesn’t want to run out of this particular grain which is sold a lot in the country. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she loves it because of the seriousness with which they treat their clients. Her dream is to buy a car to get around in.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot has been operating his mixed farm in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya for the last six years. He has employed one person from his community to help on the farm. His farm produces tea, milk and pineapples, which he sells locally. He is 32 years old and married with two children ages 3 and 11. His eldest child attends school.

Cheruiyot has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 50,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the extra income from this loan will help him venture into other businesses and improve the livelihood of his family. His biggest challenge has been lack of enough funds to expand his farming activities. He would like to practice large-scale dairy farming in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin R. S. is 37 years old. He lives with his partner and their three children in a rented home in La Victoria, one of the poorer neighborhoods of city of Chiclayo. His home has basic services, but the streets nearby remain unpaved, a situation he would like to see improved.

The family participates in a number of income generating activities. Martin´s partner manages a small general store out of the their home, in which she sells basic household items such as soap, dry foods and beverages. They own a mototaxi, which Martin drives on a daily basis in and around the city, transporting people to work, school and stores as needed. Further, Martin has a small plot of land just outside of La Victoria on which he raises crops.  This land is in Campiña Chacupe Bajo, Martin’s childhood home.

This will be Martin’s second credit with our institution. Martin is requesting the loan in order to purchase additional merchandise at bulk prices to expand the selection of the general store. He hopes that this will solidify the customer base and increase profits.

Martin and his family are well respected in the community. They are hard-working and dedicated to improving the lives of their children.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise at bulk prices

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie D. is from the town of Banga. He is 30 years old. Eddie is married and has three children, aged 4, 8 and 9. To make a living, Eddie plants and harvests rice and corn for sale. Eddie wishes to become successful and have a happy and healthy family.

Eddie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eddie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eddie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sophia Efia Ntiwa

texts.en: Sophia Efia Ntiwa E. is a fishmonger at Abura. She is a widow and has four children. Sophia has been a fishmonger for five years. She ensures the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is from the village of Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Alicia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling beauty products like cosmetics, from several suppliers, like AVON, NATASHA and FULLERLIFE, in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

location.town: Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
A. Dilshod lives in Gonchi, a region in Northern Tajikistan. He is 29 years old, married with two children. Dilshod is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling cows at the local market. His wife helps him with the business. Once every 2-3 months he purchases young animals from local villagers and raises them over an 8-9 month period and later sells the adult cows to local butchers. Today Dilshod is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase young cattle. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Kuña Aty Joayhu Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Aty Joayhu, se conformo en fecha 19 de julio del 2.010, gracias a que la Directora de Finanzas, la Sra.  Nancy M. quien convenció a algunas compañeras que ya habían formado parte de otro grupo, a formar un nuevos grupo, luego contactaron con la asesora para la conformación del Comité.
En estos momentos se encuentran en el  2° ciclo, está conformado por 15 integrantes, las mismas reconocen la importancia de acceder a préstamos con la sólo presentación de  la cédula de identidad, y siendo la única condición de trabajar  unidas para fortalecer la solidaridad entre ellas.  
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Veneranda quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y se encuentra trabajando mucho por la temporada de mucha venta. Es una señora muy trabajadora y con la de sus ropas ella prepara y ofrece varios productos como comestibles y frutas y se siente contenta con su negocio.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas de diferentes modelos como remeras, camisillas, shorts, calzados para verano y otros.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty Joayhu Women's Committee was formed on July 19th 2010 by the Financial Director Mrs Nancy M. who convinced some friends who had already formed part of another group to form a new group.  They then contacted their advisor who authorized the committee.

The committee are now in their second loan cycle and their group has 15 members.  They recognize the importance of being able to access loans simply by presenting their ID card with the only condition being that they will work together to strengthen the solidarity between them.

All of the women carry out business activities to make funds, they help each other to reach the common goals that they all have within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.  They take an active part in the weekly meetings and work together impeccably.

One of the members of this group is Veneranda who sells clothes.  She is working a lot right now because this is a season when she makes a lot of sales.  Veneranda is a very hard-working woman.  As well as selling clothes, she also sells other products such as food and fruit.  She feels very happy with her business.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy different kinds of clothes such as t-shirts, tops, shorts, summer footwear, etc.

loans.use: To buy clothes such as t-shirts, shorts, dresses and footwear

loans.name: Mak's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of sixteen members.  They are located in Stueng village in Kandal province.  This village loan selected Mrs. Mak S., 50 years old, as the village bank president.  The members of this village hope that they will increase their income to improve their family's standard of living with these loans. 

Mrs. Mak S. and her husband, Mr. Va Vay, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land that they use to cultivate rice for their family's living.  With this farming, they do not have enough money to grow rice.  So Mrs. Mak S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate rice.  They also earn a living by working as farming laborers.  This spouse is working hard to support their six children: one of whom is a pure drinking water seller, one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are students in the local school who also supports their parent's farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to cultivate rice.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George K. N. is a married man. He and his wife have two children aged fifteen years old and five years old.

His business is located at Kitengela. He provides transport services for local residents. He mainly transports water to the residential houses at his customers' requests. He has been in this business for the last five years. He says that this business is profitable. The major challenge he has is over-coming harrassment from the local government. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business running well.

George is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy a new engine for his vehicle to enable him to provide better services to his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future to diversify into a real estate business. He also sees his business growing so he can earn a monthly income of Kes 30,000. He describes himself as hardworking and customer-friendly.

loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle engine.

loans.name: El Rincon De Las Amigas Group

texts.en:
"El Rincon de las Amigas" group was created by the formation of the Family Committee of the district of San Salvador, which was at its second meeting and the number of participants exceeded the allowable amount. Therefore, split in two.
Today, the committee comprises 12 members and is in the tenth cycle of the program.
Ms. Maria Rossana L., for example, makes the sale of food. She invested the money in the purchase of goods to produce the food they sell, they want to give his family a better quality of life, it is hard living in poverty.

loans.use: Buying goods to make food to sell.

loans.name: Ta-Landeneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Ta-Landeneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the second loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Zainab B..  Zainab is age 30.  She was born in  Makeni city, where she is currently residing with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a businessman.  Two of her children attend primary school and two are in secondary school. For 6 years, Zainab has been selling soaps, cigarettes, powdered milk, sugar, butter, etc.  With her share of this loan, Zainab is going to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy soaps, cigarettes, powdered milk, sugar, butter, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel V. B. tiene 52 años, vive en es casado vive  con la esposa en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es educar a los hijos que les falta estudiar la universidad.

Le gusta jugar boly con los amigos.
texts.en:
Miguel V. B. is 52 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province. He has 7 children.

The members of the Juntos Venceremos (Together We Will Overcome) Rural Bank are located in the Matilde Esther district of Chillanes Canton. This rural bank has 12 members engaged in the agricultural work of raising cacao and cassava.

Miguel plants cacao and cassava. He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the Sunday market in Chillanes.

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase supplies for cultivating cacao and cassava. The loan will help him to fulfill his economic needs.

He confronts challenges such as infestations, diseases, and variations in climate. His dream is to educate his children who have been unable to study at university.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for cultivating cacao and cassava

loans.name: Marias Del Rosario Group

texts.en:
Norma Ninet is 37 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are currently studying in school. She cares for her home and her children but has also started running a small general store to supplement her family's income. Her husband works as a security guard to help support the family. 

Norma started her business selling small products from her home four years ago and would now like to stock her small store so that her business may have a chance to grow. She hopes to one day run a local store with a variety of goods.

Norma is a member of the Marias del R. Group. This is group's second loan through ASDIR, and the previous loan was paid back in full with no problems. Other members of the group are involved in the following activities: animal raising, farming, and general goods sales.

loans.use: to stock the general store

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es natural de Ayacucho, tiene 49 años de edad, enviudó hace 10 años, es una señora muy trabajadora y  lucha por dar lo mejor a su hija menor llamada Briyid de 11 años. Juntas viven en un casa alquilada en el distrito de Kimbiri, menciona que anteriormente contaba con vivienda propia por problemas familiares pero la despojaron de su morada. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar y ha ganarse el dinero con el esfuerzo de si misma. La actividad que realiza es comprar productos a los campesinos tales como: café, cacao, achiote y palillo; son productos netamente de la zona selvática. Ha trabajado durante 04 años, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de sus trabajadores quienes se encargan de cargar y pesar los kilogramos de cada producto que compra, y con la ayuda de un vehículo recorren varias comunidades en busca de productos, una vez acumulado una buena cantidad de mercadería lo trasfieren a las empresas acopiadoras de gran renombre como: “Cooperativa Agraria”, “Cacao Vrae” y “Machupichu”; quienes le pagan un gran porcentaje por cada kilogramo de carga entregada. Su negocio le es muy rentable, además la mercadería que entrega a las empresas acopiadoras le premian con una buena cantidad de dinero anualmente. Los meses de enero, febrero y marzo, son épocas de lluvias y derrumbes en la carretera, propias de la naturaleza, pero para ella son meses de atraso en el negocio, ya que obstruye el pase, perjudicando con el traslado de la carga a su destino. Los planes para el futuro de su negocio es seguir trabajando con el mismo ahínco que le caracteriza para así sacar adelante a su hija. El dinero solicitado, le servirá como capital para comprar  productos a los campesinos. Este es su 11avo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos, y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de los integrantes. Los 2,000 mil nuevos soles, le servirá como capital para comprar los productos a los campesinos.
texts.en:
Marceilna is from Ayacucho, 49 years old and has been a widow for 10 years.  She is a hard-working woman who strives to provide the best she can for her daughter, Briyid, who is 11 years old.  They live together in a rented house in the Kimbiri district.  They used to live in their own home but, because of family problems, had to move out.  Her parents taught her how to work to make a living for herself.  Her business is buying products such as coffee, cocoa, annatto and tumeric, mainly forest area crops, from the indians.  She's been in the business for four years and has the help of workers who load and weigh the items she purchases.  She uses a vehicle to travel around to different communities in search of her products which she then transfers to the well-known co-ops such as "Cooperativa Agraria", "Cacao Vrae" and "Machupichu" who pay her a percentage for each kilogram she delivers.

Her business is very profitable and she receives an annual premium from the co-ops.  The months of January, February and March are the rainy season and roads are flooded, so during these months she lags behind in her business.  Her plans for the future are to continue working in the same way to provide for her daughter.

The loan will be used as capital to buy products form the indians.  This is her 11th loan through MFP and she has always paid back the previous loans on time and is committed to doing so this time.  She is well loved in the communal bank by the rest of the members.  The 2000 PEN will be used as capital to buy products from the indians.

loans.use: To buy cocoa, coffee, annatto and tumeric

loans.name: Elvira Justina

texts.es:
Elvira de 53 años, es una mujer inspiradora que después de separarse tuve que entra en la venta de comida para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.

Labora de jueves a domingos en la venta de almuerzo y meriendas. Por el momento no tiene dificultades en su trabajo. Su nuevo conviviente es maestro albañil la ayuda en algunas ocasiones junto con su hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques para la adecuación de su vivienda para tiene una vida mas cómoda con su familia.
texts.en: Elvira, 53, is an inspirational woman, who, after divorcing, began selling food in order to care for her three children. She works Thursday through Sunday selling lunches and snacks. At the moment she has no problems with her work. Her new romantic partner is a master mason and sometimes helps with her children. She will use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement and blocks in order to update her home so she can have a more comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and sand.

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia, ella tiene 36 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13, 9 años de edad; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista; ella vende emoliente y desayunos escolares de forma independiente; la socia compra insumos y todas las hierbas medicinales, la socia prepara todos los días diferentes hierbas hervidas y naturales llamados emolientes estos en realidad son infusiones o mates nativos usados para aliviar diferentes problemas de salud, desde una tos, hasta problemas con el hígado, riñones y otros. La socita solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para su negocio.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” and is located in the town of Pisac belonging to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

Julia, 36, is the member.  She’s married and has three children who are 15, 13 and 9 years of age.  She is a retailer.  She sells emollients and school breakfasts independently.  She buys supplies and medicinal herbs and every day prepares various natural boiled herbs called “emolientes” which actually are infusions or native teas used to alleviate various health problems, everything from a cough to liver and kidney problems and others.  She needs the loan to buy supplies for her business.

She is grateful and expresses that she will meet her repayment obligations in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó gracias a la Sra. Mirna que vive en la ciudad de Concepción. La presidenta se motivó en la idea de producir un bien para sus compañeras, dandoles una visión de que a través del comité estarían alcanzando el progreso de cada una. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el comité de mujeres emprendedoras nombrándolo Comité Primavera.
El comité cuenta con quince  (15) miembros en donde la mayoría se dedica a pequeñas actividades desde la venta de minutas, mercaderías en general, de tal manera que en un futuro no muy lejano les estaría produciendo una pequeña ganancia a través de su venta. También estas señoras son muy unidas, trabajan en grupo y les es más fácil pagar la cuota según experiencias anteriores.
Por otro lado la Sra. Patricia, es una mujer muy humilde y desea el crédito para invertir en una actividad productiva y espera generar una pequeña ganancia através de la venta de alimentos y todo tipo de comidas rápidas para superar los desafíos cotidianos.
Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad.
texts.en:
This Committee came together thanks to Mirna who lives in the city of Concepción.  The group President was motivated by the idea of doing good for her fellow members, providing them with the vision that each one of them could attain progress through the committee.  Gladly they agreed to form part of this group of enterprising women that they called “Comité Primavera” (Spring Committee.)

It has 15 members.  Most are in businesses selling snacks and merchandise and hope in the not too distant future to be producing small profits through their sales.  These women are also very unified, they work as a team and making their payments is easier than had been in previous experiences.

Patricia is a very humble woman.  She wants the loan to invest in a productive activity and hopes to generate small profits selling food and all kinds of fast food to overcome daily challenges.

They all hope to continue to struggle to get ahead seeking progress for each one of them and for their community.

loans.use: to buy fast food ingredients.

loans.name: María Lidia

texts.es:
Este cliente reside en esta ciudad capital   de Managua, la señora María Lidia  se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer honrada  trabajadora con buenos valores y principios  morales como persona, debido a que ha sabido  ganarse el aprecio de todos sus  compañeros de trabajo. 
Se presento ante esta oficina  de  Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción, como es lamina   de zic perlìnes y  pago de  mano obra, este crédito será utilizado para cambiar techo en mal estado de su vivienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María Lidia lives in the capital city of Managua.  She has stood out fas a person for being an honest, hard working woman with good values and moral principles since she has always known how to win over the esteem of her coworkers.

She came by this Ceprodel office to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies, like zinc metal sheets and purlines, and to pay labor costs.  She will use the loan to replace the roof on her house and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Limber Abad

texts.es: El señor Limber,  hombre casado con una hija,  cuya actividad es de el servicio de transporte urbano (taxi) cabe mencionar que es de nuestra entera satisfacción saber que lucha y pasa los obstáculos que la vida le pone en frente todo para darle una buena y mejor vida a su familia e hija la actividad que el realiza tiene una competitividad grande en el mercado pero aun así el cliente lleva en su mente el crecimiento que puede tener gracias al crédito otorgado en la institución ya que utilizara el dinero en el mantenimiento de su vehículo, y también en la compra de llantas trabaja de manera sacrificada pero rentable el inicio su trabajo como chofer ahora cuenta con un vehículo propio obteniendo buenos resultados el rendimiento es bastante valorado por el esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días de la semana, para que el y en compañía de su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad y forma de vida.
texts.en: Limber, a married man with a daughter, provides urban transport (taxi) services. We should mention that we are so satisfied to know that he fights and overcomes all the obstacles life puts in front of him to give a better life to his family. His line of work is very competitive in the market, but the client keeps in mind the growth he can realize thanks to the loan this organization authorized. He will use the money to maintain his vehicle, and he will also purchase tires. He works in a sacrificing yet profitable way. He started working as a chauffeur. Now he has his own vehicle and is getting good results. His performance is good because of the hard work that he puts in every day of the week so that he and his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle and purchase new tires

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is 31 years old and is married with two children aged 9 and 12 years of age. She also takes care of one relative who is 18 years old. She earns a living by selling cosmetics, breads, milk, juice, etc. This is her fourth successful year in business. She operates her business, which is well organized, from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her.

Zawadi has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more breads, milk, juice, etc. to sell. By adding more products and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock by buying more breads, milk, juice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena tiene 63 años, es soltero vive solo no tiene hijos, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C DIVINO NIÑO, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 10 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz y platano, ademas se decicana a la comercializacion de granos secos.


Luz Elena  se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, ademas se dedica a la crianza de aves. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo para el trabajo.

Le gusta ser una persona responsable y festejar las fiestas de San Rita.
texts.en:
Luz Elena, 63, is single and has no children. She lives in El Progreso belonging to Chillanes Canton.

The members of the “Divino Niño” (Divine Child) communal bank are located twenty minutes from the Chillanes office.  It has ten members and this is their third loan request from the cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans, corn and bananas; they are also dry grain merchants.

Luz Elena farms cocoa beans, corn, banana, soya and manioc; she also raises barnyard fowl.  Her purchases take place in Chillanes and San Pablo and sales take place in the Chillanes Sunday market.

The loan will help her buy supplies and fertilizer.  The loan has helped in in such a way that crop yields have increased.  She has faced challenges like illness among her field hands and infestations and illnesses in the crops.  Her dream is to buy a vehicle for work.

She enjoys being a responsible person and celebrating the feast days of Saint Rita.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pasar Lontar Group

texts.en:
Enung is 42 years old and is married with 4 children.  Her business is selling childrens toys.  She start her business in 1987.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for children's toys like cars, rackets and congklaks. 

Until now her business has been running well.  She wants to expand her business in Pasar Lontar, Cilincing.  She hopes she can educate her children until university by continuing to do this business.

loans.use: to buy children's toys like a cars, rackets and congklaks for sale in her children's toy store

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, 53 years old, feeds chickens and ducks to sell. Her husband is an English teacher, and their income is $4 per day. She has three children; all of them are working at $4 per day for each. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy clothes and other things for her son-in-law so he can travel to work in Korea where he can make better income than here.

loans.use: To buy  clothes, etc., for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Volodymyr

texts.ru:
Володимир женат, у него есть 7-летняя дочка. Он живет в Ивано-Франковске, Западная Украина и работает таксистом в местной транспортной службе. Он предоставляет не только перевозки по городу, но также и пассажирские перевозки по всей Украине. Володимир работает в этой сфере вот уже 7 лет. Его валовый доход в месяц составляет 7 000 гривен.  

Володимир планирует использовать кредит в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести газобаллонное оборудование и переоснастить свой автомобиль для работы на сжиженном газе, что существенно снизит расходы на топливо. Этот бизнес – главный источник доходов для семьи клиента. До работы в службе транспортных перевозок Володимир работал в государственной службе охраны, но потом рассчитался и начал работать таксистом, когда жена родила дочку. В целях Володимира – дать образование дочери и со временем приобрести авто поновее. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Volodymyr is married and has a 7-year old daughter. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk in Western Ukraine and works as a taxi driver in the local transport service. He offers not only local   transportation services in his town but also long-distance transfers throughout the Ukraine. Volodymyr has been working in this business for seven years. His gross monthly income is 7,000 UAH.

Volodymyr plans to use his loan of 5,000 in order to buy equipment for compressed natural gas and make alterations to his car allowing it to run on CNG, which will substantially decrease his fuel expenses. This business is the main source of income for the client’s family. Before joining the transportation service, Volodymyr used to work in the state security service, but then, after his wife gave birth to a daughter, he left that employment and started working as a taxi driver. Volodymyr's goals are to provide for his daughter’s education and eventually to purchase a newer car.
Note: loan description is in Russian.

loans.use: to buy equipment for compressed natural gas and make alterations to his car allowing it to run on CNG, which will substantially decrease fuel costs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en un banco, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia quiere implementar su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar muebles para implementar su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This is a member of the Qorimancacha communal bank. It is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.
The member is Maribel, who's 33 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities with her job at a bank. She works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and through her work she is able to get her family ahead. The member wants to set up her house. She requests the loan to purchase furniture to set up her home.
She is happy for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to set up her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials
